<color=black>•</color> Trebuie sa fi deblocat toti modificatorii Astrofructului si Verzei lui Helios inainte ca aceasta sinergie sa devina valabila in magazin pentru 15k.
<color=black>•</color> Cu cel putin 10 Astrofructe si 10 Verze Selene pe teren, Mini Luna din Varza Selena nu mai dispare. Fiecare Astrofruct si Varza Selena canalizeaza un fascicul catre Mini Luna, care le imbină intr-un singur fascicul concentrat.
<color=black>•</color> Daunele Fasciculului: 100 × (plante care canalizeaza) la fiecare 0.02s, mereu tintind zombiul cu cel mai mare HP maxim. Daunele cresc liniar in timp atunci cand se focalizează pe o singura tinta.</color></size>

plants.name: Ciupermageddon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Nuclear deterrence is beneficial. Someday, zombies will stop attacking out of fear of my self-detonation," Shroomageddon claimed confidently. Sadly, all the radiation did was turn it into a grotesque monstrosity vaguely resembling a legendary mutated cephalopodic calamity that flattened cities. Still, it was evident that Shroomageddon failed to understand that zombies wouldn't initiate a Cold War just because of some cold breeze.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sprays deadly fumes all around, bringing ultimate destruction. Beware!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>(100+100×8)×4/1.9s</color>
<color=black>Damage Range: </color><color=#8B0000>5×5</color>
<color=black>Detection Range: </color><color=#8B0000>5×3</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack adds 5 Cryo points.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Sprays spores, which then explode (both deal penetrating damage). An explosion occurs upon death, dealing 1800 cremator damage and freezing all zombies on the screen.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Explosion damage on death → 1M
2. Now immune to Cherry and Jack-in-the-Box explosions. After resisting 10k points of explosive damage, triggers a Doom-shroom explosion</color></size>

plants.name: Laser Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Magnet-shroom's power remains unmatched," said Laser Pumpkin. "After all, composite armor, electromagnetic catapults, and plasma guns came nearly a century after aircraft carriers." Other plants envied Laser Pumpkin's high-tech gear, but only Magnet-shroom knew his power came from a Magnetar meteorite.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spawns laser drones that home in on enemies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>200/1.5s (Drone)
200/1s (Wingman)
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>16000</color>
<color=#666699>Magnetic System:</color> <color=#8B0000>When part of a Magnetic System with a Mechanized Pumpkin or any Metal-infused Pumpkin (including the Joker Pumpkin part of Pumpkin Bunker), gains their special traits. Additionally, assimilates all but one Mechanized Pumpkin in the same system into a Laser Pumpkins every 30s (first time 10s).</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Always has a Laser Drone wingman with him when he appears. Generates a Laser Drone on top of a tile around a 3×3 area every 30s (first time 10s).
<color=black>•</color> Reflects 100 damage back to zombies biting it.
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Wingmen Amount → 3
2. Wingmen & drones damage ×3</color></size>

plants.name: Laser Drone
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Thanks to Laser Pumpkin, now we have an entire arsenal of hi-tech equipment! Take a look at these beauties: Composite alloy armor, electromagnetic rotor, and plasma railgun... Wait, NO!!! THAT WAS MY FAVORITE VASE!!!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Laser Drones shoot piercing lasers to attack.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>200/1.5s</color></size>

plants.name: Obsidian Tall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Rather than seeking his best friend's protection, this plant prefers to protect him. With a hard, gem-like body and steadfast gaze forged by Obsidian Tall-nut's own soul, he endured the trials of ice and fire. Though his body may wear down one day, he's determined to keep other plants safe.</color></size></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>The Obsidian Tall-nut has four times the defense of a normal Tall-Nut.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>32000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Restores 1500 Toughness every 15s.
<color=black>•</color> Tall plant. Anti-crush, taking a maximum of 200 damage each time.
<color=black>•</color> When one Obsidian Tall-nut receives damage, it is shared and divided among all Obsidian Tall-nuts and Obsidian Mines on the lawn.
<color=black>•</color> Recovers 10% lost HP when affected by Ice-shrooms or Jalapenos.
<color=black>•</color> Blocks Balloon Zombies from passing, forcing them onto the ground.</color>
<color=black>Main Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Max HP Cap ×3
2. Redirects damage dealt to adjacent plants in the same lane to itself</color>

<color=black>Cherrizilla Synergy Modifier:</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You must have unlocked all Cherrizilla and Obsidian Tall-nut's modifiers before this synergy becomes available in the shop for 20k.
<color=black>•</color>  When Cherrizilla and Obsidian Tall-nut (or their subspecies) are both present, Cherrizilla/Garlizilla no longer has a maximum Toughness cap, and Obsidian Tall-nut/Obsidian Mine-nut gains a 90% damage reduction.</color></size>

plants.name: Wither-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After overcoming past struggles, Wither-pult now aims for a calm life. "All I want now is to watch classic movies and live in peace."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Capable of rapid-fire and spread-fire volleys of projectiles.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/2s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> 42% chance of rapid-firing. Has an equal chance to spread-fire in a number equal to the number of zombies in its lane. 
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles deal an additional 5×(target Poison value) damage and inflict 1 Poison point.
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles then split into garlic cabbage, garlic kernel (25% garlic butter), and garlic melon upon impact.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Spread-fire is now guaranteed
2. Lv1: Stacking Poison points will immediately poison the zombie and Poison Value Cap → 120; Lv2: Poison Value Cap removed</color>

plants.name: Cob-literator
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Clad in icy armor and dark as a warning, each shot from Cob-literator brings destruction. Zombies hit by it need not prepare—nothing will remain after the flash.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Possesses earth-shattering power.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Main Blast: 1800 in a 3×3 area. 
<color=black>•</color> Additional: 1800 + 30% of the Zombies' max HP across the entire screen.
<color=black>•</color> Side Gun: 360×2/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Reloading Time: </color><color=#8B0000>36s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Infuses all plants across the field with Ice-shroom (prioritized)/Doom-shroom (except Flower Pots). 
<color=black>•</color> Side cannon inflicts Chill and adds 10 Cryo points.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Main Blast damage ×4
2. Reload Time → 12s</color>

plants.name: Midas Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>From its appearance, you can tell that Midas Umbrella has a knack for business. "That's right, my hat of emerald was a trade item I exchanged with someone from a place full of blocks..."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A combination of Alchemist Umbrella and Umbrella Kale.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Has the traits of both its ingredients.
<color=black>•</color> Receives 75% less damage from Tridents.
<color=black>•</color> Bouncing projectiles now increases their damage by 100%.
<color=black>•</color> Also allows projectiles to hit zombies in the two adjacent lanes.
<color=black>•</color> Inherits Alchemist Ultimate ability, but can instantly kill zombies below 50% max HP.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:<color=#8B0000>
1. Bounced projectiles additional Damage 100% → 300%
2. Activates ultimate automatically free of charge if zombies are near, 7.5s cooldown | Aegis Umbrella Subspecies Unlocked</color>

plants.name: Enchantress-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The subjects of the Empress-shroom are captivated by the Enchantress-shroom's mysterious power. "She's not just my advisor; she's the force that keeps our kingdom thriving. Her magic isn't just powerful—it's explosive", the Empress-shroom declared. In truth, the Enchantress-shroom simply delights in blowing up any unruly dissenters who dare resist her charm.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Summons exclusively explosive zombies to fight for you!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Empress-shroom's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> The same as Empress-shroom, but only summons Cherryshooter Newspaper Zombie/Zombarine/Gatling Cherry Newspaper/Gatling Explode-o-rider zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Immediately summons a zombie when an Empress-shroom dies in a 3×3 range.
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Summon Interval → 10s | Enchantress-shroom Subspecies Unlocked
2. Can now summon corresponding Ultimate Zombies</color>

plants.name: Ashen Threepeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The flames consume his broken body, each breath a torment, yet the Ashen Threepeater stands tall. He believes the fire within will achieve eternal glory in one final, grand explosion.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Ashen Threepeater awaits his rebirth.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Loses attack capabilities after being thoroughly burnt.</color>

plants.name: Phoenix Threepeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>No one knows if fire truly brings rebirth to plants—it's just a legend. Those who chased it turned to ash, until he became the new legend. "I don't know how many times I must endure the flames to succeed, but for them, I have to."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>From fire reborn!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>160×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Ignites the whole lawn upon entry.
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles inflict the Enflamed debuff and pierce 2 times.
<color=black>•</color> Its damage is doubled after passing through an Infernal Squashwood.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Enflamed damage bonus 50% → 150%, and regular ignited projectiles can now inflict the debuff
2. Phoenix peas can now pierce infinitely and cause Enflamed explosions | Phoenix Drone Subspecies Unlocked</color>

plants.name: Gravitron
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Gravitron has mastered electromagnetism with Magnetar. "It's not rocket science—left-hand force, right-hand electricity", it boasted. "And don't forget the moving magnet—trust the smartest plant around!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gravitron pulls stars, accelerates them and launches at zombies at maximum force.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Magnetar</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Magnetar.
<color=black>•</color> Storage Limit - 60 | Acceleration Time - 1.5s | Damage ×3 | Projectile Speed ×2</color>

plants.name: Garlizilla
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Dressed in plain clothes with a gaudy gold tooth, one word from him sends others fleeing. "Garlick me, I've had enough of the spotlight. Standing out doesn't suit me anymore—I just want a quiet, simple life."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cousin to the ultimate defensive plant on land.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Cherrizilla</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1000/1.75s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=#5E1675>Poison System: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits garlic properties, and shoots projectiles that poison zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Cherrizilla. Inherits all its traits but shoots Toxic Garlic Bombs with 300 AoE damage that stack 1 Poison point and apply Garlic Butter effect instead.
<color=black>•</color> No longer heals from cherry explosions but still immune.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Heal amount ×3
2. Devour CD reduced to 15s</color>

plants.name: Blast Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cherry? Pumpkin? Or a hybrid born of fusion? The Blast Pumpkin doesn't bother with such details. For him, Halloween is all about handing out juicy cherries to the good kids and cherry bombs to the naughty ones—nothing else matters. </color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Blast-proof pumpkin.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Laser Pumpkin</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>16000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Laser Pumpkin. Inherits other traits but no longer spawns Laser Drones or assimilates Mechanized Pumpkins, instead spawns self-destructing wingmen every 30s that seek out zombies and explode like a Cherry Bomb.
<color=black>•</color> Absorbs damage from cherry explosions to heal from them and protect plants in itself from cherry explosions.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Wingmen Amount → 3</color>

plants.name: Aegis Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Many question the relationship between Midas Umbrella and Aegis Umbrella. "We're brothers!" Aegis confidently declares, thumping its canopy. "My dear elder brother is just going through a rough patch emotionally."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Reflects projectiles from zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Midas Umbrella's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Midas Umbrella.
<color=black>•</color> Loses the ability to buff lobbed projectiles and attract tridents. Instead, gains a 90% Damage Reduction and the ability to reflect projectiles (except tridents) from zombies.</color></color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:<color=#8B0000>
2. Activates ultimate automatically free of charge if zombies are near, 7.5s cooldown | Aegis Umbrella Subspecies Unlocked</color>

plants.name: Charmatron
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>With the power of love and friendship, even a rotting zombie with an unbeating heart would become our best friend and greatest ally! Well, that and a copious amount of suspicious mind-altering spores powered by magnets of all things that are <b>DEFINITELY<b> safe for human contact. Well, for now at least...
- TetsuDaPlanta (@tetsuchris)</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Charisma maxima.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/2s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles have a 1-tile splash radius with no falloff and have a 50% chance to hypnotize zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Zombies that try to bite it are hypnotized instead.
<color=black>•</color> Feeding it metal objects grants 1 charge level for 30s, up to 2 charges.
<color=black>•</color> At Charge Level 1, it fires 2 shots per attack. At Charge Level 2, 4 shots. At Charge Level 3, 6 shots.
<color=#666699>Magnetic System:</color> Each plant in the same Magnetic System provides a 5% damage boost to its shots.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Hypnotization Toughness threshold increased from 50% to 100%
2. Attack Interval → 1s, Charge Level will not drop below 2 and can be fed metal to reach Charge Level 3 for 5 mins</color>

plants.name: Obsidian Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Obsidian Mine possesses immense power despite its size. He fears no zombies. However, it has its troubles, as block people with diamond pickaxes often come to knock on its head.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Has extremely high Toughness and can block Diggers.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Obsidian Tall-nut</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>32000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Obsidian Tall-nut.
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> When one Obsidian Mine receives damage, it is shared and divided among all Obsidian Tall-nuts and Obsidian Mines on the lawn.
<color=black>•</color> Anti-crush, taking a maximum of 200 damage each time.
<color=black>•</color> Blocks Digger Zombies. Forces them to emerge early.
<color=black>•</color> Releases a small potato explosion for every 1000 damage received (before damage reduction), dealing 500 damage to zombies in a small area.<size=36>

plants.name: Aristocattail
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I think it's better to use animal hair to keep myself above water than relying on, for example, a swim ring!" Aristocattail stands by her belief. Hmm... If you think this is due to her poor academic skills and inability to stay afloat on the river, you're right. How could a cat possibly swim! Though she refuses to be categorized randomly.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Summons drones to attack every time she defeats a zombie.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>160×2/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Summons a drone every time she kills a zombie. The drone lasts for 3s, firing 60 nettle spikes that deal 160 damage each and cannot target flying zombies.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Drone Attack Damage ×3
2. Regular Attack Damage ×5 | Thunder Bunnyon Subspecies Unlocked</color><size=36>

plants.name: Apeacalypse Minigun
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Apeacalypse Minigun rarely interacts with people. It's not due to arrogance, but because people keep asking whether the fire on his body is hot or cold, and whether he can create hot ice or cold fire. These questions bore him.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Becomes stronger the more Toughness it loses.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120×3/0.5s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Other plants cannot absorb damage for Apeacalypse Minigun. Each shot fired inflicts 50 damage to self until Toughness is reduced to 500. 
<color=black>•</color> Shots knock back zombies and pierce twice, with power halved per pierce. 
<color=black>•</color> Fires faster as Toughness decreases and reaches maximum speed of 0.25s at 1/3 Toughness. If Toughness is further reduced, attack damage increases. Damage is capped at 480 at 0 Toughness.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Lv1: Defense increases as Toughness decreases. Below 500 HP, becomes immune to damage under 1k; Lv2: Below 500 HP, base damage ×2
2. Increases projectile damage and knockback ×3</color><size=36>

plants.name: Calamity-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Everyone wonders how Calamity-shroom subdues massive creatures to serve her. Endless destruction should bring silence... When questioned, she sits alone atop a tower, sipping her dreamy brew: "Oblivion? No, I simply grant them rebirth within illusions."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Turn the tide of battle!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Hypnotizes all zombies in range (same as Doom-shroom) and makes them explode upon death like Doom-shrooms.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. All Doom-shroom explosions are now craterless | Avarice-shroom Subspecies Unlocked
2. Now spawns 3 extra Hypnotized Gargantuars and Zombonis when it explodes</color><size=36>

plants.name: Gatling Sunburst-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Production is also part of the fight!" said Gatling Sunburst-shroom, wiping its sweat. Its platoon has been reorganized into the 'Sunshine Bay Construction Corps,' but their fighting spirit remains undiminished.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates a large amount of sun for you.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Gatling Icicle-shroom's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×4×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Gatling Icicle-shroom.
<color=black>•</color> Shots no longer slow but instead drop 5 sun on hitting the 1st and 2nd zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Each subsequent pierce deals 20 more damage but requires 5 sun per hit (does not consume Sun if the total amount of Sun is below 15k).
<color=black>•</color> Synergizes with the sun value doubling Odyssey Modifier and dropped suns are worth 15 each when the modifier is active.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Increased penetration to infinite times, the first 5 hits of horizontal shots each split into 2 new bullets at ±15°, dealing (20 × split count)% more damage.
2. Gatling Sunburst-shroom Subspecies Unlocked</color>

plants.name: Gatling Frenzy-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Compared to the composed demeanor of Gatling Doom, Gatling Frenzy-shroom has a much shorter temper, especially when someone calls her a "Gray Egg". She often yells "Quietus!" and charges into the fray.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Continuously fires Doom-shroom attacks at zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Gatling Doom's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/1.5s (0.25s Minimum)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Gatling Doom.
<color=black>•</color> Each attack will shorten the attack interval by 0.1s, to a minimum of 0.25s. Explodes when zombies get near.
<color=black>•</color> Fires an Ultimate Doom Shell every 16 attacks, dealing 1800 damage, and then rests for 4.5s.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. No more rest after firing an Ultimate Doom Shell | Gatling Frenzy-shroom Subspecies Unlocked | Effects also apply to Epic variants
2. Now fires a Ultimate Doom Shell every 4 attacks | Effects also apply to Epic variants</color>

plants.name: Obsidian Spike-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Obsidian Spike-nut loves hugs. "A warm embrace can soothe even the rowdiest of zombies," he says. And sure enough, every zombie he's hugged is now lying peacefully on the lawn... completely still.
plants.info:
<size=36>Defends against zombies and vehicles with its spikes.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Obsidian Spikerock's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>16000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Obsidian Spikerock.
<color=black>•</color> Reflects 100 (500 after unlock condition Modifier) damage back to zombies biting it.
<color=black>•</color> Received damage is capped at 1000.
<color=black>•</color> Recovers 1500 Toughness every 15s.
<color=black>•</color> Can puncture tires, dealing 50% of the maximum Toughness to the vehicle zombie and repelling them.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Damage ×5 | Obsidian Spike-nut Subspecies Unlocked
2. Gains a 95% Damage Reduction</color></size>

plants.name: Tycoonwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Though still a small child, Tycoonwood returned from abroad with a showman's flair. His "turn a stone into gold" trick had audiences roaring with delight. Backstage, as he stirred a mysterious drink, he smirked and whispered, "It's kind of magic, actually."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Turns all straight-shooting bullets into coin bullets!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Converts all ordinary straight-shooting bullets encountered into 2 Silver Coins and 1 Gold Coin.
<color=black>•</color> Gold Coins will move in a straight line. Silver Coins will split to the top and bottom rows initially then join the Gold Coins in the middle row after 0.8 Seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Silver Coins will deal 50% of the original bullet's damage and return 10 coins when hitting zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Gold Coins will deal 100% of the original bullet's damage and return 30 coins when hitting zombies.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. 1% Damage increase to Coin projectiles for every 1000 Coins you have
2. Tycoonwood's projectiles now deal splash damage</color>

plants.name: Thornminator
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Thornminator is one of the top hairstylists in town, revolutionizing botanical fashion with every masterpiece she crafts. "Real style takes real work," she says, twirling a carving knife between her fingers. Hammers and chisels may not be traditional hairstyling tools, but for her, they're essential for "fixing" even the most stubborn strands.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires Doom-hypno Ice Spikes. When planted, unleashes a barrage of Doom-hypno Ice Spikes.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Doominator</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each projectile inflicts chill and adds 20 Cryo points. Deals ×4 damage to frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Doominator. 
<color=black>•</color> Attacks pierce infinitely, prioritizes air units.
<color=black>•</color> Has a chance to hypnotize zombies and cause explosive damage—same effect as Doominator.
<color=black>•</color> When planted, scatter-shoots at most 80 Doom-Hypno Spikes, targeting both air and ground enemies.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Attack damage ×3
2. Zombies take damage equal to 30% of their current HP each time they are defrozen</color>

plants.name: Helios Cabbage
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Sun God—lord of light and warmth, the eternal ruler of the heavens. Wherever he treads, darkness fades, and life flourishes under his radiant embrace. Suspended high above the firmament, his indomitable glow pierces the void, casting away despair and igniting hope in all who bask in his presence.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Summons a Mini Sun to attack zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300×5/2s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Inherits the traits of Solar-pult.
<color=black>•</color> Summons a Mini Sun every 30s. The Mini Sun lasts for 15s and deals 60+(40×Amount of Helios Cabbages) damage to all zombies every 0.5s.
<color=black>•</color> When Sun exceeds 15k, consumes 200 Sun to inflict triple the damage each time the Mini Sun damages zombies.
<color=black>•</color> When the Mini Sun is present, the drop rate of Sun in the level is greatly increased (once every 0.75s).</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 1000 Coins; if there is no Mini Sun on the field, summon it immediately. Otherwise, extend the duration of the Mini Sun by 15s. Only one Mini Sun can exist at a time.</color>
<color=black>Main Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. When Sun exceeds 15k, each attack consumes 0.5% of the excess to boost projectile damage by 20 per 1 Sun spent
2. Mini Sun deals 3× damage</color>

<color=black>Magnetar Synergy Modifier:</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You must have unlocked all Magnetar and Helios Cabbage's modifiers before this synergy becomes available in the shop for 15k.
<color=black>•</color> With at least 10 Magnetars and 10 Helios Cabbages on the field, Magnetars summon a Helios Meteor instead, and the Mini Sun from Helios Cabbage no longer disappears and deals 5× damage.
<color=black>•</color> Helios Meteor: (1800 + 1800 × Magnetars) × (1 + 0.2 × Helios Cabbages) Damage, and drops 1250 Sun.</color>

plants.name: Mechanized Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After a full-scale mechanical overhaul, Mechanized Pumpkin was a fortress on wheels. Composite armor? Check. Iron reinforcements? Double check. Tactical interface? You bet. Everything was perfect... until he caught a glimpse of his reflection. A crab. They turned him into a crab. "Guys, seriously?! A little heads-up would've been nice!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A pumpkin with many functions.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color>
<color=#8B0000>Metal Plant. Has a multitude of traits.
<color=black>•</color> Immune to Jack-in-the-Box explosions.
<color=black>•</color> Forces Digger Zombies to come out of the ground early.
<color=black>•</color> Halves damage from Cherry explosions.
<color=black>•</color> Allows you to use Iron objects to regain Toughness.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers: </color><color=#8B0000>To Be Determined</color>

plants.name: Radiant Pot
plants.introduce: Deep in the garden, where the sun always shines, Radiant Pot stands in quiet devotion. He doesn't chatter, nor does he boast—he simply gives, weaving sunlight into golden coins, waiting patiently for you to grow as radiant as he is.
plants.info:
<size=36>Can quickly generate a lot of Sun and Coins.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Special:</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Produces 50 Sun and 300 Coins every n=(Current Sun/1000) Seconds, where 3 ≤ n ≤ 15.
<color=black>•</color> Inherits Golden Pot's Ultimate-syncing ability.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Upgrade costs from Silver Pots to Golden Pots will not exceed 8000
2. Coins exceeding the maximum amount will be converted into Sun at a rate of 2:1</color>

plants.name: Pharos Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once the beloved director of the Plant Orphanage, she was more than just a caretaker—she was family. Her broad leaves were the perfect playground for young sprouts, offering shade, comfort, and joy. Though those days have passed, her kindness remains. "Oh? Would you like to try this marshmallow, my boy?" she asks, her warmth as enduring as ever.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots lasers to attack zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300</color>
<color=black>Energy Limit: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Search Range: </color><color=#8B0000>(2×Lumos Level+1) Rows</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> It has all the traits of Lumos Umbrella.
<color=black>•</color> Fires lasers to attack zombies, dealing 100% damage every second. Prioritizes air zombies, and deals ×3 damage to air targets. Can attack up to 4 zombies at a time.
<color=black>•</color> Every 2s, consumes up to 10% max energy to heal up to 2 injured plants in a 3×3 area for 5% max HP (max 500). Healing increases by 100% per Lumos Level beyond 1.
<color=black>•</color> When two Pharos Umbrellas are positioned one above and one below, they will link together, and their detection range will expand to cover the entire screen. In this state, the two Pharos Umbrellas can simultaneously attack up to 6 zombies, and their damage is doubled. Additionally, if exactly 6 zombies are being attacked, a 3×3 explosion will occur at the location of a random zombie every 6s, dealing 300% of the attack power as damage.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Energy Limit ×10 | Recovery Speed ×20 | Healing Speed ×2
2. Normal Attack Multiplier → 300% | Explosion Multiplier → 1000% | Attack Interval → 2s</color>

plants.name: Avarice-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"They told her not to open it. Naturally, she opened it." Avarice-shroom ran a finger along the ornate lid, gilded and humming faintly with temptation. Whispers spilled from within—hunger, envy, ambition—all begging to be set free. With a smile too knowing to be innocent, she lifted the seal. What emerged wasn't hope. It was profit. "Welcome, little monster," she whispered, as the abyss stirred and a new fortune clawed its way out.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>She can summon Mini-boss zombies!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Calamity-shroom's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Calamity-shroom.
<color=black>•</color> Summons a Mini-boss Zombie depending on the scene:
Day: Professor Cherryz | Night: Giga Football Striker | Pool: Jackson Worldwide | Fog: Skystrider Mecha | Roof Day: Pozeidon | Roof Dusk: Clown Jill-in-the-Box | Roof Night: Ultra Mecha-nut
<color=black>•</color> At the same time, summons its ordinary Odyssey variant on all rows.
<color=black>•</color> Defeating the Mini-boss Zombie gives you a ton of Sun, Coins, and points.
<color=black>•</color> Defeating an ordinary Odyssey variant gives you 1 Plant Giftbox.
<color=black>•</color> It can only be summoned once per round. This plant will not spawn from a Plant Giftbox.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Avarice-shroom Subspecies Unlocked</color>

plants.name: Cherrybomber Drone
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Originally developed as a rapid-fire prototype for the Gatling Cherrybomber, Cherrybomber Drone was recently upgraded to fire real cherry rounds to combat the zombie surge—earning explosive acclaim.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Provides enhanced firepower when coordinated with shooter plants directly below.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Gatling Cherrybomber</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Hovering plant and Subspecies of Gatling Cherrybomber.
<color=black>•</color> If the plant directly below attacks faster than every 1.5s, its attack synchronizes with that plant's.
<color=black>•</color> Maximum number of Cherrybomber Drones on the lawn: (number of lanes×2)</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Explosive cherries from plants ×3 damage
2. Attack Interval halved</color>

<color=black>Epic Gatling Frenzy-shroom Synergy Modifier:</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You must have unlocked all Gatling Cherrybomber and Gatling Doom's modifiers before this synergy becomes available in the shop for 15k.
<color=black>•</color> When Cherrybomber Drone and Epic Gatling Frenzy-shroom are on the same tile, they perform coordinated attacks, and the former gains 0.05 energy while the latter gains 0.1 energy. Energy drains at 0.3 per second. For the first 7 whole points of energy, each increases the number of shots fired during coordinated attacks by 1. Energy above 7 increases the 8th bullet’s damage by ×(1 + excess point).</color>

plants.name: Napalm-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Napalm-Shroom isn’t just fire on the battlefield—his BBQ skills are legendary. His dream? To host the greatest barbecue party ever, with every plant and zombie in town invited.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs Napalm melons that split on impact and leave behind an inferno.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>3000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/6s + 30/0.02s (Inferno)</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Each melon creates an inferno zone that lasts for 2.5s.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Range: 4 tiles; Manual launch: full board. After launching a Napalm melon, rests for 1.5s, then charges up for at least 6 seconds, increasing damage to 1+(charge time in seconds×50%) to a max of 30s.
<color=black>•</color> Attacks pierce all armor and split into 2 additional Napalm melons that target nearby zombies with the same damage.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Charging speed and max charging duration ×3
2. Inferno zone duration ×2</color>

plants.name: Kelptain Goldbeard
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Since sailin' back from the Abyss, Kelptain Goldbeard be a changed beast - fiercer, greedier, an' twice as hearted. Captain o' the cursed ship, the Raidin' Goldplant, he bears two hearts, one torn from his own breast, t'other plundered from a fallen rival, and clutches a gilded giftbox stuffed with plunder from the Seven Seas. Touch his hearts or his treasure, an' yer ship sinks straight to Davy Jones' Locker.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Greedy overlord of the seven seas, capable of squeezing every last drop of value from zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×3/1.5s + Insta-kill (Drown) × ∞</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Retains all traits of Hydra Kelp, but can drag zombies underwater an infinite amount of times (up to once per second).
<color=black>•</color> Zombies hit by its projectiles turn golden—when they die, they grant ×3 Odyssey points. Max bonus: +2000 points per wave.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Plants deal 5% more attack damage for every 1000 points owned (up to +300%)
2. The Odyssey shop now has a 30% discount on Modifiers</color>

plants.name: Buck-shroom Squad
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Buck-shrooms' worst fear finally came true—they really did get stuck to a Magnet-shroom, and no one's been able to pull them off. But maybe it’s a blessing in disguise. With all the materials the Magnet-shroom collected, they've upgraded their gear and become a true "Steel Battalion."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A multi-purpose squad skilled in rapid fire, anti-air, and sniping!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>6000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80×4/1s (Machine gun); 240/2s (Flak cannon); 400/3s (Sniper)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant. 
<color=black>•</color> Machine gun rounds knock back targets and deal additional damage based on the current HP of their Type 2 armor.
<color=black>•</color> The flak cannon targets only air units in its lane, dealing knockback and same-tile splash damage.
<color=black>•</color> The sniper attack shares the same traits as Snipea.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Sniper always headshots with a 1/3 chance to trigger rapid-fire, but attack CD increased to 7.5s
2. Flak cannon knockback ×2, splash damage ×3 | Buck-strike Squadron Subspecies Unlocked</color>

plants.name: Quantum McCornics
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>He was born at the dawn of the universe, his age beyond reckoning. From the primordial void, he plucked three stars to orbit him as moons—treasures not even black holes could steal. Now, the old one finds joy in toying with this cosmic keepsake, as ancient as he is.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hurls ultra-dense black holes that collapse into explosions, releasing all the absorbed energy.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/2 s (Mini Butter)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant.
<color=black>•</color> 75% chance to launch Mini Butter, shrinking non-miniboss zombies' size and HP to 70%. If shrinking fails, the target is stunned for 1.5s. Instantly kills imp-class zombies.
<color=black>•</color> 25% chance to launch an Ultimate Black Hole that lasts 2s, slows nearby zombies, and absorbs Quantum McCornics' projectiles in a 3×3 area.
<color=black>•</color> Each bullet absorbed adds 2s to its duration, up to 7.5s. When it vanishes, it triggers a large explosion (Cherry Bomb-sized) that deals 320 + 60% of stored damage. If it lasted over 5s, the explosion radius significantly increases.</color>
<color=black>Main Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Ultimate Black Hole can absorb all projectiles
2. Ultimate Black Hole's absorption radius ×2</color>
<color=black>Maelonstrom Synergy Modifier:</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You must have unlocked all Quantum McCornics and Maelonstrom's modifiers before this synergy becomes available in the shop for 15k.
<color=black>•</color> Hail melons from Maelonstrom's Nebula Rifts now deal 6× damage and create Singularities, and Quantum McCornics always lob Ultimate Black Holes.
<color=black>•</color> Singularity: Lasts for 3.5s and deals 1800 Cremator damage in a 1.5-tile radius when it collapses.
<color=black>•</color> When an Ultimate Black Hole collapses, it also detonates all Singularities to further increase its own damage.</color>

plants.name: Tesla Magnet
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Tesla Magnet commands iron with thunder and thunder with magnetic fields. He grants his people eternal magnetism and built a kingdom of electricity. Yet beyond his military conquests and political achievements, he still suffers headaches in the search for a queen with the opposite charge.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Extremely magnetic, quickly absorbs metal objects and turns them into explosive cherries.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Inherits the traits of Lumos Magnet, metal object absorption CD: 0.5s.
<color=black>•</color> Can pull the pogo sticks from Clown-on-the-Pogo Zombies and convert them into Jack-in-the-Boxes; also pulls (insta-kills) Kirov Drones and converts them into Jack-in-the-Boxes.
<color=black>•</color> Deals 300 damage every 0.5s to 1 Giga Trident-nut Zombie or Giga Football-nut Zombie within range.
<color=black>•</color> Launches absorbed metal after 3s, dealing the same damage and AoE as explosive cherries; with full-map targeting and anti-air capability.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Attack Range ×2 | Dyson Magnet Subspecies Unlocked
2. Absorbs 3 Metal Objects at once, damage to Giga Trident-nut Zombies or Giga Football-nut Zombies ×3</color>

plants.name: Astro-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Astro-nut journeys through countless parallel worlds of the multiverse and has seen numerous wonders — from a Sphinx that plays eerie music in forgotten deserts, to a skybound ruin where a three-headed idol once stirred; from the glowing meteorites near the Tiberium shores to armored strongholds stamped with Z-Tech. He wanders through dreams, just beyond the grasp of memory. The past fades — but here, he's quite ready for another adventure.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cosmic Wall-nut with time rewinding and extraordinary invulnerability abilities.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Quantum McCornics</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>16000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Quantum McCornics, anti-crush and takes no more than 1000 damage per hit.
<color=black>•</color> Rewinds to HP from 3s ago after taking 4000 damage and becomes invulnerable for 2s. Within 10s after a rewind, each rewind beyond the third time costs 500 HP (Rewinds within this 10s window do not reset the timer).
<color=black>•</color> 33% chance to ignore incoming damage. Has a 25% chance to teleport biters to the rightmost tile in his lane (10s cooldown).
<color=black>•</color> If HP falls below toughness, restores HP equal to 1× Toughness after 30 consecutive seconds without taking damage.</color>

plants.name: Apeacalypse Railgun
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>He left behind the ceaseless minigun for a railgun that fires with precise, silent power—channeling electromagnetic force sharp enough to remind some of Academy City's famed Railgun and a certain relentless shooter cloaked in black.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Consumes HP to fire pulse rays with infinite penetration.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Apeacalypse Minigun</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300×5/3s</color>
<color=black>Search Range: </color><color=#8B0000>±10° Horizontal Sector</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Apeacalypse Minigun, attacks pierce infinitely and can target air.
<color=black>•</color> If Toughness is greater than 500, each attack consumes 100 Toughness. Other plants cannot absorb damage for Apeacalypse Railgun.
<color=black>•</color> Attack power scales linearly as Toughness drops, up to a max of 900.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Lv1: Defense increases as Toughness decreases. Below 500 HP, becomes immune to damage under 1k; Lv2: Below 500 HP, base damage ×2
2. Increases projectile damage and knockback ×3</color>

plants.name: Boreal Lifereaver
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>At the heart of the tundra stands the Boreal Lifereaver, guardian of the frozen wilds. For years, it has endured unyielding winters, its branches heavy with frost, crowned with delicate lotus blooms. Even when playful newcomers etch runes across its bark, it remains steadfast and unshaken.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cold gathers on spruce leaves, and lotuses bloom in the trees.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60/0.02s (lasts 5s)</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15/60 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom/blizzard respectively. Passively gains 1 ice charge every 5s.
<color=black>•</color> Fires a boreal reaper saw every 1.5s that turns into a homing shot on hit, with each instance of attack applying Deep Chill, adding 1 Cryo Point, and granting 1 ice charge.
<color=black>•</color> When ice charge exceeds 50, it depletes to 0 every 5s to heal all plants in a 3×3 area for (ice charge ÷ number of plants)×(0.3×shield + 0.7×HP).
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Boreal reaper saws now last for 15s
2. Healing is no longer split among plants</color>

plants.name: Infernal Sparkwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Infernal Sparkwood may burn brighter than any flame, but it was futuristic cuisine that truly lit up the competition. At the Culinary Clash's grand finale, he shared his trophy with Astro-nut, whose time-travel snacks left the judges starstruck. Even the judge McCornics called it "out of this world."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Torchwood blazing with Starfruit flames, boasting extreme ignition power and granting star projectiles homing capabilities.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Infernal Squashwood</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Infernal Squashwood.
<color=black>•</color> No longer spawns Spicy Squashes. Every 51 projectiles affected spawns a Spicy Starfruit in front.
<color=black>•</color> Ignites star projectiles (except spicy stars) for ×2 damage, but with original traits removed (except Magnetar stars), granting global homing with anti-air priority.
<color=black>•</color> Explosive cherries become Explode-o-Stars: ×2 damage, global homing with anti-air priority.
<color=black>•</color> Affects other projectiles like Infernal Squashwood. Triggers Jalapeno effect on death.</color>
<color=black>Main Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Projectiles required to spawn a Spicy plant are halved
2. Ignites the lane immediately when spawning a Spicy plant is not possible</color>

plants.name: Atomheart Plantern
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After witnessing the how much destructive power she could bring with her nuclear detonation and the nuclear winter that followed, Atomheart Plantern decided to restrain her core reactor and applied for a quieter role as an electricity-free street light. Her constant Cherenkov glow was perfect for it. Unfortunately, zombies kept showing up, and she turned out to be very qualified for emergency use.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Plantern sealed with radioactive frost, releasing cold fusion reactions that become stronger with Lumos.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Shroomageddon</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>600/3s</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000>3×5, can target air</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Attacks apply Deep Chill and add 30 Cryo Points.
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000> Damage increases by 100% × Lumos level.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Shroomageddon. Switching form does not trigger on-death effects.
<color=black>•</color> Inherits traits of Plantern.
<color=black>•</color> Refracts passing Apeacalypse Railgun beams into 3 beams with the same damage as the initial beam.
<color=black>•</color> On death, triggers Ice-shroom effect and grants 10 Lumos levels to all plants for 10s.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Lumos addition on death ×3
2. Now immune to Cherry and Jack-in-the-Box explosions. After resisting 10k points of explosive damage, triggers a Doom-shroom explosion</color>

plants.name: Radiant Pad
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Her devotion to the Sun God flows louder than a raging river. Radiant Pad was eventually dismissed from the Sun Guard for being way too noisy—but that hasn’t stopped her from preaching His glory to every creature beneath the waves. So deep in her zeal, she hasn’t noticed one thing: she’s been blocking all the sunlight from reaching the lakebed.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Golden Lily Pad that can quickly produce copious amounts of Sun and Coins.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection with Radiant Pot</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Produces 50 Sun and 300 Coins every n=(Current Sun/1000) Seconds, where 3 ≤ n ≤ 15.
<color=black>•</color> Inherits Golden Pot's Ultimate-syncing ability.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
2. Coins exceeding the maximum amount will be converted into Sun at a rate of 2:1</color>

plants.name: Tyrannoflora Lux
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Tyrannoflora Lux wasn't sure how he ended up on land after a deep-sea haul, but he's made himself right at home. "Why go back to the sparse, dark depths when zombies are always on the menu?" he growls. Legend says his appetite is so huge, the gourmet contests could no longer afford their electric bill—guess he's their new emergency power source.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A giant chomper attracting zombies with light—a master of luring, devouring, and digesting.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Digestion Time: </color><color=#8B0000>5 + (Sum Toughness of Zombies)^0.33s</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000> Each Lumos level reduces digestion time by 10s to a minimum of 5s.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Anti-crush.
<color=black>•</color> Can swallow all non-miniboss zombies in a 1.5 tile range.
<color=black>•</color> Using a Chomper seed packet on it reduces digest time by 10s.
<color=black>•</color> Upon successful digestion, pulls nearby zombies from adjacent lanes to its lane and heals to full HP.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Attack range ×2
2. Provides 2 Lumos levels to a 5×5 area during digestion</color>

plants.name: Rot-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Big brother, big sister, am I not cute?" Rot-pult winks at every passerby. "Buy a garlic, please." He works hard at his sales pitch. Why would such a small child be out selling garlic? "Grandpa's movies are too boring, and our house is so full of garlic we can't even store it anymore," he explains.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs mini garlics, which split on impact, with a chance for rapid-fire or spread-fire.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Wither-pult</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60/2s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Inherits rapid-fire and spread-fire chances from Wither-pult.
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles no longer do splash damage, and each splits into a mini-garlic-cabbage, a mini-garlic-kernel (1/4 chance for mini-garlic-butter) and a garlic-melon slice.
<color=black>•</color> These projectiles behave like their non-garlic mini counterparts (See Popcorn-pult, Slice-pult and Sprout-pult) and each grants 1 Poison point, boosting damage by (5×Poison points).</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Spread-fire is now guaranteed
2. Lv1: Stacking Poison points will immediately poison the zombie and Poison Value Cap → 120; Lv2: Poison Value Cap removed</color>

plants.name: Vulcannon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Born from the fire that forged the stars, Vulcannon burns as creation once did — not to spread without end, but to end all things. When his final blaze fades, only the silence after the first spark will remain.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches cobs of pure lava and heat.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>3600 (3×3)/36s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Infuses all plants in the blast area (3×3) with Cherry Bomb (prioritized)/Jalapeno (except Pumpkins and Flower Pots).
<color=black>•</color> Blasts inflict Enflamed Debuff and then does damage.
<color=black>•</color> Blasts split into multiple volcanic bombs on impact, the number increases with more zombies hit (at least 6). Volcanic bombs deal splash damage at half the power of the main blast.</color>
<color=black>Main Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Volcanic Bombs Damage ×3
2. Now triggers Thermonuclear Detonations when main blasts strike Cherry Bombs or Jalapenos (Cherry Bomb: Releases 10 Cherry Bomb effects in the surrounding area; Jalapeno: Releases 10 Jalapeno effects across the entire field. Each deals damage equal to (blast damage × 18))</color>

<color=black>Epic Twin Inferno-nut Synergy Modifier:</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You must have unlocked all Twin Solar-nut and Vulcannon's modifiers before this synergy becomes available in the shop for 20k.
<color=black>•</color> Click on a reloaded Vulcannon while holding an Epic Twin Inferno-nut with the Glove to make all reloaded Vulcannon on the field perform a synergized attack towards the sky. This shot does not cause Vulcannons to reload. Every 8th shot calls down an Inferno Meteor that repeats the following cycle 11 times: deals 80× the Vulcannon's blast damage and applies Enflamed to all zombies on screen, and triggers a Jalapeno effect with the same damage on all lanes.</color>

plants.name: Princess Solarnova
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Solarnova is princess of the Solaria Kingdom and a world-famous pop idol. Her hit single Dance of the Blazing Sun is so popular that even Dr. Edgar is rumored to own a copy. Despite her fame, she's approachable and loves meeting her subjects and fans, but just don't get too close, or her warmth might burn you.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates sun at extreme speed while melting down nearby projectiles. When active (eyes open), she unleashes searing solar flares; when inactive (winking), she stores radiant energy to be released later.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>50/3s</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Generates Sun and consumes nearby plant projectiles to absorb energy (1 damage = 1 energy). Energy is capped at Attack damage ×4; excess energy is converted to Sun (1 projectile = 5 Sun).
<color=black>•</color> When energy exceeds Attack damage, fires a solar shot that explodes on impact, dealing 100% Damage in a small area.
<color=black>•</color> Using a Coffee Bean toggles active/inactive modes. Does not attack in inactive mode.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. When a solar shot hits a zombie, it causes nearby projectiles to explode as well, dealing 10% attack damage
2. Energy cap ×3, Sun storage amount ×3</color>

plants.name: Selene Cabbage
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>She is the Moon Goddess, embodiment of calm and healing. Wherever her light falls, wounds quietly mend and all things are bathed in gentle restoration. Hanging high above the night sky, she balances yin and yang with tidal power, granting endless vitality.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Periodically summons mini-Moons to heal the battlefield. By the light of the Moon.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Helios Cabbage</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300×5/1.5s</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Projectiles +100 Damage per Lumos Level (bonus damage up to +500).</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Helios Cabbage.
<color=black>•</color> Summons a Mini Moon every 30s. The Mini Moon lasts for 15s and heals all plants for 50×(number of Selene Cabbages on the lawn) HP per second. This effect is tripled on the plant with the lowest HP percentage.
<color=black>•</color> If a Mini Sun is also present, healing effects are doubled.
<color=black>Main Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Damage increased by 3× per Lumos Level
2. Mini Moon heals 3×</color>
<color=black>Magnetar Synergy Modifier:</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You must have unlocked all Magnetar and Helios Cabbage's modifiers before this synergy becomes available in the shop for 15k.
<color=black>•</color> With at least 10 Magnetars and 10 Selene Cabbages on the field, the Mini Moon from Selene Cabbage no longer disappears. Each Magnetar and Selene Cabbage channels a beam into the Mini Moon, which merges them into a single concentrated beam.
<color=black>•</color> Beam Damage: 100 × (channeling plants) every 0.02s, always locking onto the zombie with the highest max HP. Damage scales linearly over time when focusing a single target up to 5×.</color>

plants.name: Grim Arbiter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Grim Arbiter stands as judge at the end of all things. In his jaws every offering is measured: the unworthy are stripped away, the pure are given new form, and the balance is upheld without mercy; from his maw comes a verdict no soul can escape.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Click to channel destruction into rebirth for the plants ahead, while turning curses back upon their casters.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800×2/30s (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Does not target zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Manual activation. Triggers a Jalapeno blast and a craterless Doom explosion in the tile directly ahead.
<color=black>•</color> If there is a plant (excluding pots and drones) in the tile in front, it is destroyed with a 50% chance to drop its seed packet. If the plant is cursed, the drop is guaranteed and the curse caster loses 15% max HP.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Seed packet drop is now guaranteed
2. When destroying non-insta Odyssey plants with on-death effects, the effect is triggered an additional 4 times</color>

plants.name: Vortenita
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Vortenita e obsedata de recrearea nebulelor cosmics in gradina. Deci daca vedeti una care se formeaza, fugiti. Asta nu e o nebula, e un cumulonimbus imens de lubenite care asteapta sa cada.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Arunca rapid crio-lubenite prin vortexuri temporale si, atunci cand e incarcat, poate invoca o fisura nebuloasa care da cu ploaie nenumarati altii.

<color=#4A2900>Conditii de Utilizare: Modul Odisee | Deblocabil</color>
<color=black>Daune: </color><color=#8B0000>300/0.35s (fara daune prin stropire)</color>
<color=#0077b6>Sistem Crio: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Atacurile aplica Frigul, adauga 20 de Puncte Crio si provoaca daune x4 zombilor inghetati.
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Nu mai e o planta catapulta.
<color=black>•</color> Fiecare lovitura directa de atac de baza ofera 1 cumul de energie.
<color=black>•</color> Cand metrul de energie depaseste 50, faceti clic manual pentru a consuma 30 de pincte de energie si a invoca o fisura nebuloasa; daca metrul de energie depaseste 100, fisura nebuloasa isi dubleaza eliberarea proiectilului.
<color=black>•</color> Poate exista o singura fisura nebuloasa activa simultan. Fiecare dureaza 10s, plutind de la stanga la dreapta si plouand cu lubenite de grindina.
<color=black>•</color> Daca crio-lubenita loveste un zombi care e deja in cronoschimb, aplica cronoschimbul pana la alti 2 zombii din zona de stropire (3 daca e imbunatatit de Ghiveciul de Lubenita), prioritizand tintele fara cronoschimb.</color>
<color=black>Modificatori de Odisee de Baza:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Pentru primele 5s, fisura nebuloasa se concentreaza pe zombiul cu cel mai redus HP, restrangandu-si raza de atac la 3 coloane in jurul tintei
2. Daunele Crio-Lubenitelor lobate ×6, dar Raza de Stropire -50%</color>
<color=black>Modificator de Sinergie cu Porumb-pulta Paradox:</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Trebuie sa fi deblocat toti modificatorii Porumb-pultei Paradox si Vortenitei inainte ca aceasta sinergie sa devina valabila in magazin.
<color=black>•</color> Lubenitele de grindina din Rifturile Nebuloase ale Vortenitei provoaca acum daune 6x si creeaza Singularitati, si Porumbul-Paradox lobeaza mereu Gauri Negre Supreme.
<color=black>•</color> Singularitatea: Dureaza 3.5s si provoaca 1800 de daune Cremator intr-o raza de 1.5 piese cand se distruge.
<color=black>•</color> Cand o Gaura Neagra Suprema se distruge, distruge si toate Singularitatile pentru a isi mari propria dauna.</color>

plants.name: Prometheus Liontail
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The river is her carefully arranged stage, each ripple a string on her instrument. When zombies wade into the water, Prometheus Liontail begins her performance, fireballs as prelude, heatbeams as climax, and ashes as the finale, composing a requiem for her foes.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Holds the power of the everlasting fire, the kindler of fireballs and heatbeams that blast zombies into ash.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable (River Route)</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300×2/0.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Attacks home in on targets across the screen and prioritize flying zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Attacks inflict Enflamed and then cause single-target knockback and explosive cherry explosions.
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1 energy stack per round of attack. Gains 60 HP and 60 energy stacks when affected by Jalapeno or Cherry Bomb.
<color=black>•</color> At 240 energy, consumes all energy to fire piercing heatbeams at ±15° that deal damage every 0.15s, each hit applying the same effects as her homing shots but with 6× damage and half knockback. Lasts 3s; cannot gain energy during this time.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Heatbeam damage frequency ×2
2. Regular shots' damage ×3</color>

plants.name: Big Bang Cherry
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The quarrel between two hot-tempered cherries finally ended with theoretical advancements. The brothers agreed that "annihilation" was the most fitting term. "What an explosive annihilation…" "No, it's not supposed to be an explosion but an expansion!" Oh well, the argument started again.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Unleashes a massive big bang, spawning debris that deal piercing damage and leaving behind nuclear radiation.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>3600 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Explodes into 36 nuclear debris of equal damage and creates a Radiation Zone of the same size as a Doom-shroom explosion.
<color=black>•</color> Only one Radiation Zone can exist at a time. Lasts 7s, dealing (attack × remaining duration) damage every 0.5s; damage ×3 against unarmored zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Nuclear debris pierce twice. On hit, cause Doom-shroom explosion (no crater) and Cherry Bomb explosion of equal damage.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Radiation Zone initial duration increased from 7s to 10s
2. Doom Peas, Explosive Cherries, Explosive Squashes, Explosive Stars, or Ultimate Doom Shells have a 1% chance of transforming into Nuclear Debris when they hit zombies | Big Crunch Squash Subspecies Unlocked</color>

plants.name: Scylla Leviathan
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>It rises from the bottomless abyss, bringing tides to the surface. Its followers span sky, land, and sea. Plants praise it as the battlefield’s ruler; zombies forewarn it will drag the world into darkness. Its own thoughts, however, remain unknown.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A resilient ocean overlord whose summoned minions drag zombies into the deep.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable (River Route)</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Anti-crush, received damage is capped at 200.
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1 energy stack per projectile hit. Gains 5 when fed a Sea-shroom.
<color=black>•</color> Consumes 1 energy when damaged, reducing that damage to 1.
<color=black>•</color> Every 15s, knocks back nearby zombies and inflicts 1 Tangle point.
<color=black>•</color> Every 15s, summons 1 Tangler minion that grabs zombies and instantly drowns them; against mini-bosses, deals (5% of their max HP * remaining grabs) as damage.
<color=black>•</color> Changes form when certain seed packets are used on it, restoring 1k HP and gaining 5 energy stacks; after 2s, summons the corresponding minions: 
<color=#0077b6>	- Ice-shroom Form:</color> Base damage cap is now 20. Every base attack/every time it's affected by an Ice-shroom, grants a Shield worth of 300 HP to all other plants in its lane.
<color=black>	- Doom-shroom Form:</color> Single-use. Summons a Doom Tangler that strikes the highest-HP zombie for damage equal to 50% of its max HP, then triggers a craterless Doom-shroom explosion.
<color=#ff10f0>	- Hypno-shroom Form:</color> Hypnotized zombies on the field now absorb damage for it. Summons Hypno Tanglers that only target Hypnotized zombies, drowning them and transforming them into Hypnotized Bombelugas.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Tangler minions can grab and drown up to 3 zombies (or deal ×3 damage) and reward 10 energy stacks for each zombie drowned
2. Fires 3 base attack projectiles at once</color>

plants.name: Buck-strike Squadron
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After installing the latest magnetic suspension devices, the Buck-strike Squadron finally became a precision strike team. Due to technical limitations, they can no longer use heavy weapons and must rely on machine guns, but their resolve to hit zombies with speed and freedom remains unchanged.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A highly mobile Buck-shroom unit, ready to follow orders and strike across the field.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Buck-shroom Squad's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>6000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80 (240 after unlock condition Modifier)×3/0.16s</color><color=#8B0000></color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Buck-shroom Squad.
<color=black>•</color> Clicking the Blover Controller allows deployment of a Buck-strike unit in any chosen tile to its left. Hold Ctrl to deploy all units simultaneously.
<color=black>•</color> When there are zombies in the chosen tile or its adjacent tiles, the Buck-strike unit fires small Iron Peas, causing knockback and additional damage equal to the target's Type 2 armor HP.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Attack damage ×3
2. Attack damage ×3 | Buck-strike Squadron Subspecies Unlocked</color>

plants.name: Phoenix Drone
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>"It's time to live up to my name," said the Phoenix Drone. For years he was trapped on the ground, but now he can finally soar like a true phoenix. Though slightly frustrated that the Cherrybomber Drone beat him to it, conquering the skies is still a joy.

-Written by Medineer Gaming</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spreads wings like a phoenix and rides the wind.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Phoenix Threepeater's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>160×3/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Phoenix Threepeater.
<color=black>•</color> Flying plant. Projectiles inflict the Enflamed debuff and pierce 2 times.
<color=black>•</color> On death, triggers Jalapeno effect in the same lane and 2 adjacent lanes.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Enflamed damage bonus 50% → 150%, and regular ignited projectiles can now inflict the debuff
2. Phoenix peas can now pierce infinitely and cause Enflamed explosions | Phoenix Drone Subspecies Unlocked</color>

plants.name: Epic Twin Solar-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>To push photosynthesis research even further, Epic Twin Solar-nut began a deeper study of chloroplasts. "Clearly, chloroplasts do far more than most plants imagine," says Epic Twin Solar-nut. "They not only increase photosynthetic efficiency, but also promote the growth and mitosis of bowling balls."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Stores energy from Sun, using heavier Nuts to drop massive amounts of sun and snowball the profit.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Auto-Unlocked After Obtaining Twin Solar-nut's 2 Modifiers</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Promotion of Twin Solar-nut, inherits its other traits.
<color=black>•</color> Tapping on it:
- Spends 500 Sun.
- Restores his Toughness to full.
- Gains 10 Solar charges.
- Summons 2 Bowling Solar-nuts that roll at ±45° angles forward and ricochet on hit. These each deal a one-time damage equal to the summoner's HP and drop 5 sun n times, where n equals the number of hits so far.
- Summons a Giant Solar-nut 1 tile ahead.
- Improves an existing Giant Solar-nut by enlarging its size, knockback and damage (higher base damage yields less bonus, down to 60%).
- After not tapping for 1s, the existing Giant Solar-nut will roll forward, crushing and knocking back zombies. Damage per 0.02s is 600/1200/1644 for 1/2/3 taps respectively. Also drops 15 Sun each time it hits a new zombie.
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1 Solar charge every time your Sun increases.
<color=black>•</color> When Solar charge meter reaches 100, automatically consumes 100 Solar charges to summon a Giant Solar-nut improved 5 times.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Click Cost 500 → 200 Sun | Effects also apply to Epic variants
2. Twin Solar-nut: Toughness reduces by 10 for each hit instead of 50 | Twin Inferno-nut Subspecies Unlocked | Effects also apply to Epic variants</color>

plants.name: Panmelonium
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Panmelonium represents the peak of cold ordnance design: distributed warheads, guided escorts, and relentless frostfire. He advances without haste, ending battles not with fury, but with absolute zero.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches bone-chilling clusterbombs for saturated bombardment.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Cob-literator</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator) ×40</color>
<color=black>Reloading Time: </color><color=#8B0000>36s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Cob-literator.
<color=black>•</color> Conversions between Panmelonium and Cob-literator reset remaining reloading time of both to 36s.
<color=black>•</color> Manually click to fire 4 Oblivion Clusterbombs which spawn 36 additional Minishells. Minishells prioritize targeting zombies on the field, with a higher chance to strike zombies near the aimed position.
<color=black>•</color> Oblivion Clusterbombs damage the full-screen; Minishells' splash radius is 1.5 tiles. On hit, both apply Freeze for 5s before dealing damage, and permanently reduce zombie speed by 0.005×, up to a maximum reduction to 0.9×.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Damage ×4
2. Reload Time → 12s</color>

plants.name: Big Crunch Squash
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Big Crunch Squash always glares straight ahead with a scowl, wearing the same bad temper even while eating or sleeping. Though this makes his allies uneasy, compared to those two noisy brothers, he is actually quite friendly.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Holds the immense power of universe-contraction, but while on standby, its potential gradually decays to zero.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Big Bang Cherry's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>3600 (Squash)</color>
<color=black>Detection Range: </color><color=#8B0000>2 tiles to the left; 3 tiles to the right</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Big Bang Cherry.
<color=black>•</color> On landing, triggers a Doom-shroom blast with 3600 damage, with the crater remaining at the jump-off position, releases a ring of 36 pieces of Nuclear Debris each dealing the same damage and creates a Radiation Zone lasting [7 - 0.25 × (Big Crunch Squash's time on the lawn)] seconds, down to 0s.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Radiation Zone initial duration increased from 7s to 10s
2. Doom Peas, Explosive Cherries, Explosive Squashes, Explosive Stars, or Ultimate Doom Shells have a 1% chance of transforming into Nuclear Debris when they hit zombies | Big Crunch Squash Subspecies Unlocked</color>

plants.name: Kaledera Eruptor
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Kaledera Eruptor is a cosmologist. Unlike his colleagues, he believes the universe is not a fire that burns out and collapses, but a continuously active existence. To prove this theory, he created high-heat cabbages that can be preserved long-term on Umbrella Kales as a model. The model failed to convince his peers, but achieved unexpected success on the battlefield against zombies.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs cabbages for explosive and incendiary damage.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Vulcannon</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300×n/0.75s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Vulcannon.
<color=black>•</color> Conversion to Vulcannon resets remaining reloading time to 36s.
<color=black>•</color> When attacking, lobs one Pyro Cabbage at each zombie (up to 10) in the forward area of his lane and the 2 adjacent lanes.
<color=black>•</color> Pyro Cabbages apply Enflamed on hit, then trigger an explosion with a 1-tile radius, identical to that of Explosive Cherries.
<color=black>•</color> Umbrella Kale or Midas Umbrella in front in of his lane can also intercept Pyro Cabbages that would have been thrown to adjacent lanes and boost them.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Pyro Cabbages Damage ×3
2. Attacks have a 10% chance to trigger Cherry Bomb and Jalapeno effects at the barrel position and ignore the target limit of 10</color>

plants.name: Captivator Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As zombie numbers continued to rise, how to stay popular among zombies became a hot topic.
