<color=black>•</color> Increases the storage limit of Starblover to 80, and Gravitron to 240.
<color=black>•</color> Allows Solarfruit to use Sun to shoot automatically.</color></size>

plants.name: Split Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Split Pea brothers always argued over the best direction to fire—forward or backward. But now they've found a clever solution: just let the peas rebound. Problem solved!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Split Peas shoot peas forward and backwards.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special:</color><color=#8B0000> Peas shot backwards will rebound upon reaching the edge of the screen.</color></size>

plants.name: Windy Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>For Windy Pumpkin, looking good is a top priority. He never leaves home without first spending a solid half hour perfecting the leaves on his head, ensuring his style is flawless.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Every so often a Blover will spawn to blow away the fog.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces a Blover every 30 seconds.</color></size>

plants.name: Pumpkin Morph
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Dining out sends shivers down Pumpkin Morph's spine. He's always fearful that the iron cutlery will magically stick to his face, turning an enjoyable meal into an awkward experience.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can fuse with iron materials from zombies to absorb their properties.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=#666699>Magnetic System: </color><color=#8B0000>This plant will deal:
(20 * Amount of Magnetic Plants in System * Zombie Speed) to specific zombies every 6s. Only Zombies with magnetable materials OR mechanical vehicles can be damaged this way. Also, they must not be on the sky or underground. This trait carries into further fusions.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant.</color></size>

plants.name: Starmorph
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Starmorph harbors a lifelong dream: to suck the stars from the sky. He spends every night staring at the starry heavens, imagining the day when his dream becomes reality.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can fuse with iron materials from zombies to absorb their properties.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×5/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Deals double damage to iron zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Jokestar
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Jokestar often bore the burden of being seen as a circus clown, which left him feeling discontented. "I may appear comical, but I am, in fact, a superhero," he declared. "I commandeered the zombie's Jack-in-the-Box and put on the hero suit inside!" Perhaps the Magnet-shroom who aided him in the heist never mentioned where the box came from.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots out stars that explode on contact.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×5/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Stars explode on contact, dealing low splash damage with no falloff.</color></size>

plants.name: Starpick
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"It's remarkably pickaxe-like," Starpick commented, a hint of amusement in his tone. "I can feel part of myself nestled in the ground, and it's quite pleasant—unless you're bothered by insects like centipedes." With a cheeky smile, he challenged, "Why not take off my hat? You'll find I'm even more pickaxe-like than you!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Starpick hides underground: zombies will not attack it.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×5/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Cannot be attacked and does not block zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Iron Star
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>People often use the headshots of Iron Star and Starmorph to hype up their relationship, which greatly troubles both of them. In fact, Iron Star just wants to be himself - a star with a heart of stone that is hard to rust.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires stars lined with a metallic coating.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80×5/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Breaks Type 2 armor instantly (before damage reduction).</color></size>

plants.name: Steel Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I wish I were stronger," Steel Pumpkin muses. "Maybe if I were made of diamond..." Iron Star smirks and replies, "Even that wouldn't be enough! You'd need to be netherite!" In their spirited banter, they forget a vital truth: they can enchant their own strengths.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Protects your plants with sturdy iron.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Can be fed corresponding metal objects to restore 500 Toughness. Receives half the damage from explosive cherries.</color></size>

plants.name: Joker Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Whenever I emerge, it signals the arrival of the clown. Everyone wonders what lies within his box, but the outcome remains a mystery. I caught a glimpse once, and that moment changed everything for me."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can block explosions caused by Jack-in-the-Box zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Nullifies Jack-in-the-Box explosion damage, protecting the plant inside.</color></size>

plants.name: Miner Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pumpkin is frequently used to protect the plants in the back from being attacked by miners. Curious about stopping the miners from drilling into the ground, he picked up their pickaxes and studied them. Ultimately, he developed new technology that forces miners to dig their way out of the ground in advance.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can block mining attempts by Digger Zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Forces Digger Zombies to unearth prematurely.</color></size>

plants.name: Lumos Magnet
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Honestly, I wish I could be a simple Magnet-shroom," Lumos Magnet confessed. "That way, I wouldn't have to be in the spotlight constantly or feel the pressure of using one magnet to do the work of two."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attraction range and cooldown time improves depending on the Lumos Level.

<color=black>Magnet Interval: </color><color=#8B0000>15 Seconds (LL0) → 11 Seconds → 7.5 Seconds → 5 Seconds (LL3)</color>
<color=black>Magnet Range: </color><color=#8B0000>+1 (LL1) → +2 → +3</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Higher Lumos Levels will significantly shorten the attraction interval and increase the attraction range. When it's Lumos Level 2, the attraction will cause 200 damage to zombies near the attraction target.</color></size>

plants.name: Anchor-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The other sea-shrooms couldn't comprehend why Anchor-shroom could absorb iron to become bigger and taller. "It's simple: E=mc²," he explained, even if most of the energy was lost in the air and went completely unused.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>That's weird... Why does the magnet get bigger as well when he grows?

<color=black>Magnet Interval: </color><color=#8B0000>15 Seconds → 10s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Grows after attracting 3 times.
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).</color></size>

plants.name: Magnet Blover
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The plants often call Magnet Blover "Magneto." He confidently casts his favorite spell, "Disarmament!" at the zombies, even though he has no idea how the conversion of wind energy to magnetic energy works behind the scenes.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sucks away all the iron objects present.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attracts up to 10 metal objects across the whole field. Takes 1 second to process each. Lasts for 10s before disappearing.</color></size>

plants.name: Magnethorn
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Magnethorn spent some time studying communications jamming at the Air Force Academy, often bragging to his friends about his stellar grades. What he doesn't realize is that his success was mostly thanks to his father, a high-ranking Air Force commander pulling strings behind the scenes.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can cause high damage to flying objects.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Deals double the damage to metallic armor.
<color=black>•</color> Deals 500 damage to Bucknut-copter Zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Dealing a certain amount of damage to Airships can cause it to crash, dealing 1000 damage to zombies near the crash site. Zomppelin = 10 Hits | Kirov Drone = 3 Hits | Kirov Zomppelin = 20 Hits</color></size>

plants.name: Stardrop
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Stardrop's favorite nights? The ones where fog takes a break and lets him chat with the stars. "They totally get me," he says, convinced they're just as drawn to him as he is to them. One day, he's sure, one will drop down and say hello. Until then? He'll keep talking.
plants.info:
<size=36>Summons a meteor that deal devastating damage.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60×5/3s</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Lumos levels 1 to 3 has the same effect as Starglow. Upon reaching Lumos Level 4, summons a Lumos meteor that has a separate 50s cooldown from the original meteor. Lumos meteor does 1800 damage upon impact and splits into 180 homing lumos stars that each do 40 damage.</color>
<color=#666699>Magnetic System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each plant connected to the Magnetic System will increase the damage of the stars by 5%, up to a maximum of 120.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>For 1/4/7/10/13 Stardrops on the lawn, a meteor spawns every 50/40/35/30/25 seconds, dealing 1800 damage and breaking into 180 stars that each deal 20 damage.</color>

plants.name: Snow Repeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Whatever happened to you?" a curious plant asked Snow Repeater. He chuckled softly and said, "I'm still a Repeater at heart. I just forgot to snuggle under a blanket during winter nights."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots two snow peas in succession.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack adds 5 Cryo points.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Tap to auto-fuse with a free Peashooter 15s after planting.</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Snow
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"His hands are cold, his face is cold, his heart is cold, and even his blood is cold… Is he frozen?" someone wondered aloud. Gatling Snow shivered, reassuring the concerned plants, "I'm not frozen! The barrel of my machine gun is still burning hot!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gatling Snow shoots four snow peas at a time.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×4/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack adds 5 Cryo points.</color></size>

plants.name: Split Snow
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Don't let his icy facade mislead you; there could be a hidden warmth," someone suggested. But Digger Zombie sneered, "Don't make foolish assumptions. This guy has nothing but cold sides!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots snow peas forwards and backwards.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack adds 5 Cryo points.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Tap to auto-fuse with a free Peashooter 15s after planting.</color></size>

plants.name: Split Cherry
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cherryshooter crawled out of the trench, bewildered. "Who threw that bomb?" he demanded. "Sorry, brother," Split Cherry replied sheepishly, "I saw you pointing your gun at us and thought you were a zombie."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Split Cherry shoots cherries forward and backwards.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Tap to auto-fuse with a free Peashooter 15s after planting.</color></size>

plants.name: Snipea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Admired for her sharp vision and robust strength, Snipea is cherished by her Pea comrades. However, during their formation marches, her gun barrel often finds its way into the backs of their heads, making for some tense moments along the way.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Snipes zombies all over the map to deal massive damage.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>500/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Headshot once every 6 attacks, insta-killing zombies. You can glove a Gatling Pea onto a Snipea to create another Snipea seed packet.</color></size>

plants.name: Carrier Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Carrier Pumpkin always kept three books on its shelf, their titles concealed from the curious eyes of the other plants. One day, a Cactus Drone's curiosity led it into the study, where it uncovered the titles: "Guide to Succulent Plant Cultivation," "Postpartum Care for Pumpkins," and "30-Second Cactus Quick Flight Tutorial." The Cactus Drone chuckled at the unexpected collection.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spawns a Cactus Drone that moves around the field to attack flying zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×2/1.5s (Drone), 30×2/1s (Wingman)
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits Thorny Pumpkin traits. Always has a Cactus Drone wingman with him when he appears. Generates a Cactus Drone on top of a 3×3 area every 30s (first time 10s).</color></size>
plants.cost: <size=36>Fusion Formula: <color=#8B0000>Cactus > Blover > Pumpkin OR Blover > Cactus > Pumpkin</color>

plants.name: Solar-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Some people ask why Solar-pult's little Suns disappear when thrown over the roof's right side. Solar-pult just smiles: "Where do you think the front yard's Suns comes from?"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches solar cabbages to attack zombies and can also generate Sun.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>50/5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Returns 100 Sun upon fusion. Each shot bounces once after hitting a zombie. For every 200 Sun, it can bounce one more time; each bounce drops 5 Sun.</color></color>

plants.name: Cabbage Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm not just a pot to hold cabbages, and Cabbage-pult is not the weakest plant! Cabbage-pult and I are best buddies," Cabbage Pot says confidently. Their friendship might have come to be because... one of them is balding, and the other is already bald.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Provides attack speed bonus to Cabbage-type plants above it.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Lowers the attack intervals of Wither-pult and Helios Cabbage above it by 25%, other Cabbage plants by 33%.</color>

plants.name: Taco-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Taco-pult always wonders why, despite learning skills from Kernel-pult and performing well on the battlefield, Dave finds it hard to look at him and even avoids him. In truth, it's because Taco-pult resembles a taco too much, and every time Dave sees him, he just wants to pick him up and eat him.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches tacos that can bounce once, and can also throw butter.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Projectiles bounce once. Has a 1/4 chance to throw butter, dealing 60 damage and immobilizing zombies for 4s.</color>

plants.name: Butter Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Butter Pot believes he's more than just delicious. In his view, buttered corn provides more nutrients than soil, especially for fungi. Butter Pot's favorite plant is the Kernel-pult, his favorite food is butter, his favorite container is a cup, and his favorite song is "Buttercup."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Increases the butter chance of all Kernel-type plants above it from 25% to 50%.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Raises the butter chance from 1/4 to 1/2.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Husk
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Protecting the plants around me is my duty." As a professional cosplayer, "Umbrella Husk" is so skilled that no one realizes he's actually a corn cob with a butter wig, who loves to stand on his head.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Knocks back zombies that try to approach and immobilizes them with butter.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Knocks back nearby zombies, dealing 40 damage and immobilizes them with Butter for 2s at the cost of its Toughness. 
<color=black>•</color> 1 Zombie: -100 Toughness
<color=black>•</color> 2~4 Zombies: -150 Toughness
<color=black>•</color> 5 or more Zombies: -250 Toughness</color>

plants.name: Winter Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Winter Melon once confessed to Melon-pult, "I wasn't always this frosty. I just went into the freezer for a popsicle one day, and… well, here we are." </color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches frosty melons that slow zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Applies 50 Cryo points to zombies hit. Zombies hit in the splash area gain 5 Cryo points. Deals 4x damage to Frozen zombies.</color>

plants.name: Clove-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"In the 90's, people widely believed that the best way to deal with zombies was with cornmeal and black dog blood. For us plants, garlic is a strategic resource," Clove-pult says with a wise demeanor.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Throws small cloves at the zombies; sometimes they're buttered.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3s</color>
<color=#5E1675>Poison System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Each attack deals an additional 5×(target Poison value) damage and then accumulates 1 Poison point. 
<color=black>•</color> At 5 points, the Poisoned Debuff is applied.
<color=black>•</color> Has a 1/4 chance to throw garlic butter with 60 damage, immobilizing zombies for 4s, immediately poisoning the zombie for 9s and raising the Poison value cap to 30 points.
<color=#5E1675>Poisoned Debuff: </color>Zombies lose (20×Poison point) Toughness per second while poisoned.</color>

plants.name: Garbage-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The combination of cabbage and garlic is fresh, delicious, and healthy, and it's simple to make. Adding a few cloves of garlic before serving enhances the flavor," explains Chef Garlic. Eating garlic is also said to have some effect on preventing hair loss.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches stinky, garbage cabbages at the zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3s</color>
<color=#5E1675>Poison System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> See Clove-pult for details on the Poison System.
<color=black>•</color> Each time it hits a zombie with Poison Points greater than 0, it can bounce again. There is no limit to the amount of times it can bounce.
<color=black>•</color> Each hit deals an additional 5×(target Poison value) damage and then adds 1 Poison point.
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Launches a projectile that bounces once.</color>

plants.name: Garlic-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Few dare to put on airs in front of Garlic-pult. Most take a detour when they see him, though he doesn't intend to be intimidating. He no longer seeks the popularity he had as a chef, but he does hope to make friends who appreciate the benefits of allicin. Now, plants finally embrace his unique charm, garlic and all.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs large garlic melons that break on impact.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>100/3s</color>
<color=#5E1675>Poison System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> See Clove-pult for details on the Poison System.
<color=black>•</color> Direct hits deal an additional 20×(target Poison value) damage. Splashes deal an additional 5×(target Poison value) damage. Accumulates 1 Poison point for all zombies within the garlic melon's splash radius.</color>

plants.name: Cob Cannon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cob Cannon is quite the intellectual powerhouse—rumor has it that it studied at Harvard and once worked at a prestigious law firm in New York. Known for its immense power, a single shot from Cob Cannon can decimate a large area of zombies. However, the true source of its formidable energy remains a mystery.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can be manually operated to launch deadly corn cobs that cause cremator damage.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Reloading Time: </color><color=#8B0000>36s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Must be planted on two side-by-side Kernel-pults.</color>

plants.name: Cob-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cob-pult is often seen frowning. When asked why, he says nothing. "People keep asking me if Buttered Corn is sticky or sweet," Cob-pult sighs. "Why ask me? I don't eat it. Only the zombies would know."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Throws large corns at the zombies; sometimes they're buttered.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 1/4 chance to throw a Buttered Corn with 140 damage, immobilizing the main target for 4 seconds and zombies in the splash range for (4 / total splash spread) seconds (minimum of 0.5).</color>

plants.name: Pyro Cannon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pyro Cannon has a booming popcorn business. The fiery aroma sends zombies running, adding a sizzle to any event. It's even considering a hot pot session with Jalapeno soon.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Use manually to fire an explosive, high-damage flaming projectile that scorches zombies and infuses nearby plants with Jalapeno.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>3240 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inflicts Enflamed debuff and then does damage, and infuses plants in its blast radius with Jalapeno.</color>

plants.name: Cryo Cannon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Despite his icy exterior, Cryo Cannon is warmhearted, especially to friends. In his free time, he enjoys skiing, drumming, and exploring caves. His best party trick? A cold joke to "chill" the crowd.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Use manually to fire a freezing projectile that damages zombies and infuses plants with Ice-shroom.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>3240 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inflicts Chill and infuses plants in its blast radius with Ice-shroom (except Flower Pots).</color>

plants.name: Overripe Melon
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Peel away the green exterior, and you'll find a heart of roses within." This phrase means don't randomly walk into an unfamiliar barber shop—it will be a mind-blowing decision.
Melon Pot: "After finishing a watermelon, wearing its rind on your head is something everyone did as a kid." Flower Pot remarks, "Honestly, it's kind of silly."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires melons that bounce once.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Projectiles bounce once.</color>

plants.name: Melon Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Frugal Melon Pot can't stand to see Melon-pult throw melons without a thought for cost, so after defeating the zombies, Melon Pot secretly collects the shattered melon fragments scattered on the ground. "This is called soilless cultivation," Melon Pot explained. "Not just any plant can be grown in the ground here; every inch of soil is precious."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Enhances melon-type plants.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Returns an extra 150 Sun on fusion.
<color=black>•</color> Doubles the splash damage of Melons above it, with no falloff; damage remains at 2/3 of base damage.</color>

plants.name: Salad-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"When I was little, everyone asked what kind of Pult I wanted to be," says Salad-pult. "They thought you couldn't have it all. But I decided I wanted everything—even back then."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can catapult mixed projectiles in rapid succession.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>140/5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>42% chance of rapid-firing. Projectiles split into a mix of corn on the cobs (1/4 chance for buttered corn) and Overripe Melons upon hitting zombies.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Clove
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Come, give Umbrella Clove a hug. You focus on opening the door; let Umbrella Clove handle the rest! The RV doesn't matter; it's the brains inside that count!" Umbrella Clove says. "And one more thing—fight zombies with zombies! And pour some tea for Umbrella Clove while you're at it! Zombies, zombies, go away!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Knocks back zombies and forces them to switch lanes.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Knocks back nearby zombies, dealing 40 damage, at the cost of Toughness, forcing them to change lanes. See Umbrella Husk.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Kale
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>When asked about her secret to success, Umbrella Kale replied, "Actually, I just really enjoy letting balls rest on my head." She paused, "But the other plants all praise me as a top-notch protector."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can bounce catapult-type projectiles to increase their damage. 

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Prioritized by catapults for targeting. Increases projectile damage by 75%.
<color=black>•</color> If there are no zombies, it can store projectiles for a while.
<color=black>•</color> Knocks back zombies at the cost of Toughness. See Umbrella Husk.</color>

plants.name: Mecha-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Some may not realize it, but Wall-nuts have inventors in their community. Inspired by zombie weaponry, they built their own war machines. "Zombie technology, ironically, only destroys itself," says Mecha-nut.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can receive attributes from Jalapeno or Ice-shroom, with effects upon death.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Changes form when affected by Ice-shroom or Jalapeno, healing 3000 Toughness upon transformation.
<color=black>•</color> Releases the current form's effects upon death.
<color=black>•</color> Absorbs damage for other plants in a 3×3 radius but with the damage doubled.
<color=black>•</color> Healing can exceed maximum Toughness (up to 4×).
<color=black>•</color> Recovers 1k HP when fed metal objects. When metal objects on the lawn disappear and no Giga Mecha-nuts are present, every Mecha-nut restores (1k / total number of Mecha-nuts) HP. </color>

plants.name: Garlic Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Garlic Pot has long wanted to help the plants in its pot get a thorough sterilization, especially those on the front lines in direct contact with zombies. However, it seems only garlic-type plants are willing to grow in its pot. "Some plants would rather face zombies than catch my garlic smell," Garlic Pot sighed. "Now I can only use garlic to disinfect garlic, and they just say it's a perfect match."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Reduces the biting damage taken by garlic-type plants on top, and has a garlic effect itself.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Forces zombies to move towards the middle row.
<color=black>•</color> Reduces the biting damage taken by garlic-type plants on top  to 10.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Rind
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Give me a melon; I'll repay you with kindness." Umbrella Rind has always admired this saying from ancient poetry. Plants don't need to bribe him for help—whatever they give, he returns. Well, except basketballs. He's a total basketball fan.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Deflects basketballs and returns a catapulted melon.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Can reflect zombie projectiles except tridents (return as melons if they are lobbed projectiles); loses 200 HP for reflecting projectiles that explode; loses 50 HP for reflecting Snow Balls.
<color=black>•</color> Each reflection of projectiles stores energy equal to the projectile's damage, releasing it all on zombies for extra damage when the next knockback occurs.
<color=black>•</color> Knocks back and deals 80 damage to zombies at the cost of Toughness. See Umbrella Husk. </color>

plants.name: Melon Mortar
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Melon Mortar is a fervent advocate of the "overwhelming firepower" doctrine: "If one shot doesn't do it, try two, three, or even four!" This approach has made it a powerhouse on the battlefield—and a hit at summer parties.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Use manually to launch a barrage of melons from above.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>200/Melon. Up to 40 melons in a 3×3 area without splash falloff. Randomly hits within a 5×3 area.</color>
<color=black>Reloading Time: </color><color=#8B0000>36s</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Pot
plants.introduce: Other flower pots are puzzled by the dense foliage of Umbrella Pot, but Umbrella Pot simply says, "I just read the book The Pot's Guide to Hair Care."
plants.info:
<size=36>Enhances umbrella-type plants.

<color=black>Umbrella Husk:</color> <color=#8B0000>+2 Seconds immobilization, +50% knockback distance</color>
<color=black>Umbrella Clove, Umbrella Ultimate moves:</color> <color=#8B0000>Knockback distance ×2</color>
<color=black>Umbrella Rind, Aegis:</color> <color=#8B0000>Damage of reflected projectiles ×2</color>
<color=black>Umbrella Kale, Midas:</color> <color=#8B0000>Can attack zombies on adjacent lanes
<color=black>Other Umbrellas: </color><color=#8B0000>Knockback distance +50%</color></color>

plants.name: Silver Cabbage
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Besides a shiny silver exterior, Silver Cabbage also has a heart of silver. Silver Cabbage dreams of becoming a teacher and already has a catchphrase in mind: "Silver Cabbage Instructor, at your service."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches silver cabbages to attack zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60/3s</color>

plants.name: Golden Cabbage
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Golden Cabbage isn't just about its dazzling appearance—it has a heart of pure gold. It relishes fighting alongside plants against zombies and dreams of one day being honored as the "Heroic Cabbage of Gold."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attacks zombies by throwing golden cabbages. Its ultimate move unleashes cabbages on all zombies!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 1000 Coins, Cooldown: 2s; throws a Golden cabbage with 160 damage at every zombie, instantly killing those with Toughness below 300.</color>

plants.name: Silver Pot
plants.introduce: "People are always saying 'gold this, silver that,' as if we have a hierarchy," Silver Pot said. "Marigold is silver, yet it's still called a Marigold." His words might have been more convincing if his gaze weren't fixed on the coffee bean by the roof's edge.
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates extra Coins for you.

<color=black>Coin Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>

plants.name: Golden Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Many wealthy folks treat money like dirt, but I'm different," Golden Pot explains. "That's how I became rich in the first place."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates extra Coins and amplifies the ultimate ability of any golden plant above it.

<color=black>Coin Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When you trigger an ultimate of a Golden Plant above it, all Golden Plants on other Golden Pots with an equal or less ultimate cost trigger their ultimates too. </color>
plants.cost: <size=36>Upgrade Cost: </color><color=#8B0000>2000 Coins; each existing Golden Pot will double the cost</color>

plants.name: Silver Kernel
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Why throw silver coins at zombies? Why, why? Even if zombies are just game data, we still ought to show them some final respects." Silver Kernel was once an usher in a theater, but after discovering his knack for lecturing, he entered the world of public speaking, bringing along his butter and corn kernels.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires silver kernels and silver money bags to attack zombies, with a chance to earn Coins.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 1/4 chance to throw a silver money bag, dealing 60 damage, immobilizing the zombie for 4 Seconds, and dropping 25 Coins.</color>

plants.name: Golden Kernel
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Golden Kernel ponders words like "golden phrases" and "precious gems." But maybe true treasure lies in imported butter and gold missiles... or "Just Gold."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Throws golden kernels and butter at zombies, with a chance to generate Coins. Its ultimate fires golden poppin' popcorns at zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>25% chance to throw a money bag, dealing 80 damage, stunning zombies for 4 Seconds, and dropping 100 Coins.</color>
<color=black><color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 3000 Coins, Cooldown: 2s; launches four golden corn bombs, each dealing 450 damage in a 3×3 area without damage falloff.</color>

plants.name: Twin Marigold
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"It's time to make gold coins!" one of the Twin Marigold sister declares. But the other sister insists, "Now's the perfect time for a silver coin!" Since they can never agree, they each produce their own share independently, which might actually be for the best. "Double opinions, double efficiency—isn't that right?"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces double the amount of Coins!

<color=black>Coin Output: </color><color=#8B0000>Generates Coins twice every 20 seconds, otherwise identical to Marigold.</color>

plants.name: Silver Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Silver Melon sometimes considers itself the most valuable melon—until it remembers the more prestigious Golden Melon. "A melon is a melon, whether it's silver, gilded, or made with garlic or gold," Silver Melon chuckles. "We all have our place in the soil."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches silver melons to attack zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>100/3s</color>

plants.name: Golden Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Golden Melon doesn't mind questions about its golden rind and seeds, but never ask if it's seedless—it has no patience for that question.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hurls golden melons at zombies; its ultimate rains golden melons across the screen.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/3s</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 3000 Coins, Cooldown: 2s; launches 60 golden melons, each dealing 120 damage with no falloff, landing randomly across the screen.</color>

plants.name: Silver Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Silver Umbrella is always anxious about someone stealing his money when he's away, so he carries his fortune with him everywhere—even into battle against zombies. He thinks this keeps his wealth safe, but it only adds new risks. "That's my money; you can't take it!" he complains, though no one ever listens.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates extra money for you when it deflects basketballs.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Drops 25 Coins each time it activates and knocks back approaching zombies, dealing 40 damage, at the cost of Toughness. See Umbrella Husk.</color>

plants.name: Golden Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Golden Umbrella doesn't like this place—after a mishap in the water, it was shipped here alongside Silver Umbrella. The memory still frustrates him. "It's unfair! Why am I the freebie here?"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Deflects basketballs, generating extra Coins, and its ultimate move can knock airborne imps and repel all nearby zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Drops 50 Coins every time it deflects a basketball; knocks back approaching zombies, dealing 40 damage, at the cost of Toughness. See Umbrella Husk.</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 2000 Coins, Cooldown: 7.5s; knocks back all nearby zombies, drops 25 Coins/zombie, restores 1000 Toughness, yeets airborne imps, and drops 3 diamonds.</color>

plants.name: Silver Garlic
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Does a garlic made of silver still smell like garlic? Probably not, but neither the plants nor the zombies were eager to test it. However, zombies soon regretted their curiosity after a taste!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Possibly an even more pungent garlic? Maybe.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>600</color>

plants.name: Golden Garlic
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Beneath its dazzling exterior lies an unbearable garlic scent. Golden Garlic muses, "True value is only in appearance, not in the details." But everyone knows this "golden" garlic is just a regular garlic with a shiny coat.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A stronger, gold-scented garlic that can force all zombies in front to switch lanes with its ultimate move.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>900</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 1000 Coins, Cooldown: 2s; forces all zombies in its lane to change lanes.</color>

plants.name: Hypno-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hypno-nut has a soft spot for zombies: "There's something oddly pleasant about the way they nibble on me. It's not like scratching an itch… let's just call it affection from prolonged contact," it says, philosophically.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hypnotizes zombies and summons a Hypnotized Mystery-box Zombie every 30 Seconds!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Each time it's bitten, there's a 4% chance to hypnotize the zombie.
<color=black>•</color> Recovers 100 HP when hit by a Trippy-shroom spore, and stores one spore of that color each time it's hit (up to 3).
<color=black>•</color> When it collects 7 different spore colors, it consumes one of each and summons a Hypnotized Golden Mystery-box Zombie, then fully heals.</color>

plants.name: Alchemist Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Alchemist Umbrella is a tycoon among plants, providing jobs for zombies and plants alike. "I maximize their value," it declares with a gilded flourish to its spectacles.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>High-risk, high-reward!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Has the traits of both Umbrella Clove and Golden Umbrella.
<color=black>•</color> Prioritized by Trident Zombies.</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 3000 Coins, Cooldown: 7.5s; inherits traits from Golden Umbrella; knocks back all nearby zombies, turning those with less than 25% Toughness into silver statues worth 1000 Coins, or gold statues worth 3000 Coins if below 10% Toughness. Zombies without statues drop Coins directly.</color>
plants.cost: <size=36>Fusion Formula: <color=#8B0000>Golden Garlic + Umbrella Leaf / Golden Umbrella + Garlic</color>

plants.name: Summer Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The plants always feel that red-rinded watermelons carry the festive vibe of New Year, crackling and popping with excitement. But Summer Melon explains, 'I didn't put firecrackers in the melon! It's just that sealed food explodes when heated—and you can't rush eating a hot watermelon!'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs blazingly hot melons!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inflicts the Enflamed debuff.</color>

plants.name: Gold Magnet
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After working countless hours at an accoutant firm, the Gold Magnet realized its terrifying attracting potential and switched careers to become a fighter. 'Honestly, this is way more fun than counting money,' it remarks. 'After all, money doesn't grow on trees, but they do somehow from crops.' That said, its plant companions often end up suffering from its antics.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attracts projectiles!

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attracts straight-shooting projectiles from adjacent lanes and produces a 25 Coin for every projectile attracted.</color>

plants.name: Giga Mecha-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Giga Mecha-nut has always been passionate about environmental protection. 'I have a love-hate relationship with zombies—they pollute the environment, but they also bring me wealth. Isn't owning property and a trailer the hallmark of success? The lawn is clean all thanks to me!'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can store up Toughness and protect your plants.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant. Anti-crush. Max damage received is capped at 8k.
<color=black>•</color> Healing can exceed maximum Toughness without any cap. Spawns with 80× Toughness as initial HP.
<color=black>•</color> Redirects damage to itself in a 3×3 area.
<color=black>•</color> Recovers 4.8k HP when fed metal objects. When metal objects on the lawn disappear, every Giga Mecha-nut restores (4.8k / total number of Giga Mecha-nuts) HP.
<color=black>•</color> Using a Wall-nut on it restores 8k HP instantly and summons a Sharkmarine (stationary if on land with 1/3 the HP of the Giga Mecha-nut).</color>

plants.name: Buck-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Buck-shroom has a constant worry: he's terrified of Magnet-shroom accidentally pulling him in. 'Where did my screws go?' As Crazy Dave walks up, it seems he is about to have a brand-new concern.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Buck-shrooms can knockback zombies too.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/2.25s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Short plant. Projectiles knock back zombies and instantly destroy Type 2 Armor (before damage reduction).</color>

plants.name: Split Pea-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The front head declares, 'My turn to use the eyebrow!' The back head replies, 'Guess we'll have to split it.' Born just two minutes apart, their eternal battle over the eyebrow shows no signs of stopping.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots small peas both forward and backward.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/2.25s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant. Backward peas rebound if no zombie is hit.</color>

plants.name: Magnet Solar
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Ai auzit? Magnetul Solar straluceste de bogatie in ultima vreme! 'Eu nu produc fier; fac doar livrarea,' spune el asta cu mandrie. 'Toate astea sunt rezultatul anilor de munca asidua.' Se zvoneste ca si-a deschis chiar si o afacere dincolo de gazon! </color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produce obiecte metalice si transforma obiectele metalice in Soare.

<color=black>Soare eliberat: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Produce un obiect metalic aleatoriu la fiecare 30 de secunde (10 secunde pentru productia initiala). Trage un obiect metalic pe el si va produce 25 de Soare. Obiectul metalic produs este dat automat Magnetului Grenadier, Hipno Magnetului sau Farmecatronului aflat direct in fata.</color>

plants.name: Buruiana Tepoasa Prajita
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Dupa testul de foc, inca este vechea Buruiana Tepoasa, doar mai inteleapta, mai stralicitoare, si gata sa le ofere zombilor o primire calduroasa!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>O Buruiana Tepoasa Fierbinte? Care e diferenta dintre ea si Buruiana Tepoasa mai super?

<color=black>Duritate: </color><color=#8B0000>300</color>
<color=black>Daune: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1 Secunda</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Nu poate fi folosita in fuziuni.</color>

plants.name: Alge Prajite
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Gestionarea unui izvor termal nu este usoara, dar Algele Prajite se mandresc cu faptul ca nu are nicio reclamatie din partea clientilor.. De fapt, par sa se bucure putin prea mult de baie, pana in punctul in care nu se mai intorc niciodata..</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Se zvoneste ca aceasta Alga a prosperat si in lava.

<color=black>Duritate: </color><color=#8B0000>300</color>
<color=black>Daune: </color><color=#8B0000>Omor-insta (Scufundare)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Nu poate fi folosita in fuziuni.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Magnet
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After countless days and nights of research, Hypno Magnet finally mastered the art of the magnetic charm field. 'Now I can better persuade zombie friends to fight alongside us,' he said. 'Some think I threaten them with metal tools, but one day, the truth will come to light.'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Consumes metal objects and summons the corresponding zombies to fight for you.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Uses metal objects to spawn hypnotized zombies with 40% HP.
<color=black>•</color> Auto-uses metals generated from Solar Magnet behind itself and those consumed by Magnet-shrooms in the same Magnetic System.
<color=black>•</color> When bitten, hypnotizes the attacker, then reverts to a Magnet-shroom.</color>

plants.name: Morph-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>'I used to ferment bread,' Morph-shroom explained, 'but now I collect metal to build the bread ovens.'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Putting an Iron Bucket on him might have interesting results.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals ×2 damage to Metal Zombies.</color>

plants.name: Rust-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>'I got canned again!' cries Rust-shroom, who was Morph-shroom just a moment ago. 'All I did was accidentally make a coffee maker instead of an oven!'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>There could be another twist if you give him a Football Helmet?

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>50/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals ×3 damage to Type 1 armors.</color>

plants.name: Football-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I've always dreamed of being a Football player, and now I've finally got this hat of glory," said Football-shroom proudly. "But today, I've decided to take a break on the sidelines." In reality, he's just a stadium security, keeping the overenthusiastic fans out with his spores.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sprays fumes that penetrate all kinds of armor!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>3000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>100/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Counts as an Advanced Fusion. Deals damage to armor and the zombie in the armor at the same time.</color>

plants.name: Titan Pea Turret
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As one of the ultimate weapons of the Pea family, the Titan Pea Turret is always taught not to lie down without reason. "But my head is really heavy!" Sometimes, when being scolded, he complains like this. Of course, he doesn't know that the Pea elders tell him not to lie down just because it's actually kind of cute when he does.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Unleashes pure pea hell onto zombies!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>(20×3×2.25)/0.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Fires 3 peas at once.
<color=black>•</color> Firing speed increases the longer the turret fires and has 3 stages. After shooting 100 rounds, attack speed is increased by 50% (to 150%). After shooting another 200 rounds, attack speed is increased by another 50% (to 225% the original).
<color=black>•</color> Firing speed returns to normal when its attack resets.
<color=black>•</color> Peas may miss Imps due to the turret's height.</color>

plants.name: Explode-o-tato Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Explode-o-tato Mine is a top chef, and his "hash cherries" and "potato jam" are highly praised in the plant world. If he runs out of ingredients, he will cheerfully say: "I'll go buy some."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Splits into 8 Potato Mines in surrounding tiles.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Spawns Potato Mines that only need 5s to arm themselves in a 3×3 range upon defeat.</color>

plants.name: Chip Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Chip Mine is a capable assistant to Explode-o-tato Mine, but most of her dishes are given low ratings by customers. "What's going on—" Chip Mine feels really guilty but doesn't know why. The truth is, she is not sensitive to spicy flavors and always adds too much chili.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Splits into 7 Potato Mines in her lane. 

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Spawns up to 7 Potato Mines that only need 5s to arm themselves in her lane upon defeat.</color>

plants.name: Cherry Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cherry Pumpkin is a distant relative of Cherry-nut, but every time Cherry Pumpkin meets Cherry-nut, he is always late. "I want to come early too," Cherry Pumpkin says, "but I can't resist jumping to anything red."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A pumpkin that cannot be exploded by cherries!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Absorbs explosive cherries and heals 200 Toughness instead.</color>

plants.name: Blizzard Commando
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As the general commander of the Pea family, Blizzard Commando has an aura that makes plants and zombies shudder even from miles away. But regarding his proud freezing ability, Blizzard Commando always keeps quiet about it, until one day a small pea accidentally opened his diary: "If I had known, I wouldn't have bet against the Blazer Snipea. Not only did I almost freeze to death in the ice fields, but I also ended up like this. Tonight, I'll make that gal eat three big bowls of chili—"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots snow peas at zombies, with a small chance of shooting a massive barrage!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×6/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/0.02s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>2% chance to shoot a barrage of snow peas each attack, lasting 5s.</color>

plants.name: Grenadier Magnet
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Selling well is also a skill." said Grenadier Magnet. Only Magnet-shrooms can turn hate into love. He once hated cherries the most. Actually, he still does, but perhaps he has discovered a business opportunity?</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Transmutes metal objects into explosives!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attracts metal objects and turns them into explosives. Each object can be turned 5 times before consumption. Metal objects can be actively given to the Grenadier Magnet for it to initiate an attack.</color>

plants.name: Blazer Snipea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Other snipers envy Blazer Snipea for being a reliable assistant to the commander, even though she is still a little one. "Talent is one thing, but... I have to thank the commander for cultivating me!~"Blazer Snipea says, but in reality, it's because Blizzard Commando is naturally cold and always keeps Blazer Snipea as a warm-up buddy.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Marks and blows up zombies anywhere on the map!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks inflict the Enflamed debuff and deal 100 damage to nearby zombies.</color>

plants.name: Pea-storm Commando
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Faced with the crazy zombies and powerful teammates, Pea-storm Commando, who came to the yard for more challenges, feels immense pressure, and his temper is getting worse... However, the plants are always shocked by the extreme violent tendencies of the Pea-storm Commando, who fires peas madly from a distance. Gatling Frenzy-shroom has already decided to ask for his contact information.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots peas at zombies, with a small chance of shooting a massive barrage!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×6/1.5 Seconds
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>?×3/0.02s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>2% chance to shoot a barrage of random peas (regular peas, ignited peas, snow peas, hypno peas, but all flattened to 20 damage) each attack, lasting 5s. You can switch between Pea-storm Commando and Snipea with Peashooter.</color>

plants.name: Pumpkin Bunker
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once, a pair of pumpkins dreamed of joining a circus. But after a magnetic mishap left them stuck together, they discovered a better calling: standing their ground as an impenetrable shield. The circus can wait.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Protect two tiles at once!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>12000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Heals when affected by Cherry and Jack-in-the-Box explosions. Can only be placed on Titan plants or other 2-tiled plants.</color></color>
plants.cost: <size=35>Fusion Formula: <color=#8B0000>Joker Pumpkin ∞ [Magnet-shroom] ∞ Cherry Pumpkin < Jicamagic (Place On Middle)

plants.name: Nugget-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Some plants asked: "Why is the top of Nugget-shroom red?", to which he replied, "Well, let me ask you first..."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can reproduce itself!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant. Spawns a new Nugget-shroom in the same tile after 20 Seconds. Each Nugget-shroom can only reproduce once. Upon death, it deals 300 damage to nearby zombies</color>

plants.name: Spuddy-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Why does Spuddy-shroom explode after a few attacks? His explanation is quite touching: "Every attack I make is burning my life!" But the truth is—he's just a magician who doesn't want to do much work. After a few attacks, he decides to use a potato firework to perform a grand "fungus" transformation.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Consumes Toughness to fire high-damage spores!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>600/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack costs 75 Toughness. If kept alive for 20 seconds after being planted, his red light will turn off with attack power reduced by 90%, but attacks will no longer cost Toughness. Upon death, it deals 600 damage to nearby zombies.</color>

plants.name: Foul-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>With a pale skin, a hairstyle that could rival a cathedral dome and a grin full of crooked teeth, Foul-shroom looks like it's auditioning for the villain in a fairytale. Ironically, he usually gets the role of a vampire.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sprays poison gas at zombies!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30/1.5s (Piercing)</color>
<color=#5E1675>Poison System: </color><color=#8B0000>Attack adds 1 Poison point to zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies that bite it are forced to switch lanes.</color>

plants.name: Spicicle
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cold on the outside, fiery on the inside. This is how other plants describe Spicicle. "Don't be fooled by my calm appearance, my explosive energy is beyond your imagination," murmurs Spicicle. Oh, by the way, he's also quite skilled at making ice-cream.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Has both the properties of Ice-shroom and Jalapeno!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>32000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Loses 20% Toughness every 3 seconds. While present, absorbs damage for all plants. Upon death, triggers Jalapeno in his row and fullscreen Ice-shroom.</color>

plants.name: Chomper Maw
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Chomper Maw won the grand prix in an Gourmet king contest, finishing 10 giga garg cakes in 44 seconds — with 3 of those seconds wasted because he didn't hear the starting whistle. "If there's another event like this, please call me. The buffet near the garden won't let me in anymore," said the Chomper Maw during the interview.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Swallows all zombies that get too close!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Digestion Time: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> 8 + 3ln(Sum Toughness of Zombies)s</color>
<color=black>•</color><color=#8B0000> For reference: Zombie - 24.8 Seconds | Buckethead - 29.9 Seconds | Giga Gargantuar - 34 Seconds | 10 Giga Gargantuars - 41s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Can swallow all zombies in a 1.5 tile range, including Gargantuars. Unable to swallow other zombies that have immunity to Chompers. </color>

plants.name: Kraken-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sailors whisper of the Giant Kraken of the Northern Sea, its name alone enough to turn the bravest hearts cold. But Kraken-shroom? He's got no time for legends. He didn't come to terrify—he came to play. And his favorite game? Pushing zombies around like driftwood.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can repel zombies in front.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=#006400>Tangled Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000> Adds 1 Tangle Value per hit, dealing additional damage based on the Tangle Value.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Repels approaching zombies (single target) and deals 100 damage.
plants.cost: <size=36>Fusion Formula: <color=#8B0000>Tangle Kelp ∞ [Sea-shroom] ∞ Tangle Kelp < Jicamagic (Place On Middle)</color>

plants.name: Mind-blover
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Plants are always curious why Mind-blover pulls the zombies back. Mind-blover explains: "Since Blover always pushes zombies to the opposite direction they face, I believe it's only natural for me to do the same to hypnotized zombies."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can pull back hypnotized zombies!

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Pulls all hypnotized zombies back, lasting for 5s, but reduces their HP by 10% max Toughness (except for zombies in the leftmost column).</color>

plants.name: Twin Saw-me-not
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Twin Saw-me-not's two heads are constantly arguing — one swears spinning is the best approach, while the other insists launching saw blades is superior. Somehow, their teamwork still cuts through the competition.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attacks nearby zombies with its blades and can also strike at a distance!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>8/0.02 Seconds (Melee); 16/1.5 Seconds (Ranged)</color>
<color=black>Special:</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> The front head attacks like a regular Saw-me-not, while the back head targets all zombies on the screen (prioritizing flying zombies).
<color=black>•</color> Gains 5 points of Shield every 0.5s, up to 300 max.</color>

plants.name: Boomwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Boomwood's Afro bounces rhythmically, as if dancing to a beat only it can hear. Some say his groove inspires his fiery creations, while others just appreciate the spectacle — both the style and the explosions leave a lasting impact.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spawns explosive cherry drones that seek out zombies.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Generates a homing cherry drone for every 30 peas that pass through.
<color=black>•</color> Converts any explosive cherry that passes through into a cherry drone.
<color=black>•</color> There can be up to 3 cherry drones at once.
<color=black>•</color> Upon death, it triggers a Cherry Bomb explosion.</color>

plants.name: Iuciracheta
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Afacerea infloreste pentru Iuciracheta(de la ardei Iute + Cireasa si cu racheta ca rezultat), dar zombii nu sarbatoresc. De fiecare data cand pocneste o petarda, ajung sa fie parliti, ametiti si fumegand la propriu. "Oh, reveniti-va," ii tachineaza Iuciracheta. "Aratati bine in negru precum carbunele.
plants.info:
<size=36>Se propulseaza spre zombi, provocandu-le daune si impingandu-i inapoi.

<color=black>Daune: </color><color=#8B0000>300</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Dupa ce este plantata, asteapta 1 secunda inainte sa zboare in linie dreapta pe aleea ei, respingand zombii pe care-i intalneste si provocand 300 de daune pe suprafata la impact.
<color=black>•</color> Provoaca daune ×15 zombilor Nian.</color>

plants.name: Iceweed
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Breaking news from the first Plants vs. Zombies Hockey Tournament! Iceweed skated to victory, leaving the Bobsled Zombies scrambling. But now, they're calling foul! "I did nothing wrong," Iceweed insists, adjusting their icy spikes. "And these springs? Just a little pre-game safety gear."
plants.info:
<size=36>Iceweed can slow down zombies that walk on it.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1 Second</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Iceweeds can be upgraded to Icerocks using a Fertilizer.</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each hit inflicts Chill and adds 10 Cryo points.</color>

plants.name: Suflustravitor
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Suflustravitorul(Sufloi + Usturoi, planta avand proprietati Otravitoare) obisnuia sa aibe o simpla viata, lucrand la un restaurant animat cu gratar, unde afacerile erau infloritoare. "Ah, acelea au fost zilele," ofta planta. "Clientii obisnuiau sa plece cu o stralucire verde de fericire dupa ce suflam usturoiul coplesitor. Acum? Lucrurile pur si simpl nu mai sunt la fel."
plants.info:
<size=36>Suflustravitorul poate otravi zombii.

<color=#5E1675>Sistem de Otrava: </color><color=#8B0000>Provoaca 5 Puncte de Otravire fiecarui zombi neotravit de pe ecran si aplica debuff-ul Otravit. Provoaca 1 Punct de Otravire aditional si mareste efectul Debuff-ului ramas cu inca 5 secunde.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Forteaza zombii sa schimbe benzile. </color>

plants.name: Frostburn-wood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"One input, one output. That's the rule." Frostburn-wood prided himself on his structured logic. "That's why I counteract Torchwood's flames with pure, unyielding frost." But put them together? Things got... messy. Fire and ice, heat and cold—sometimes they balanced, sometimes they clashed, and sometimes, well... physics just gave up.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can turn normal peas into snow peas or polar ice peas, and water orbs into ice blocks.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Turns the normal peas that pass through into snow peas, and the snow peas that pass through into polar ice peas for ×2 damage and ×2 Cryo points.
<color=black>•</color> Turns the water orbs from Spruce Sprayshooters into ice blocks.</color>

plants.name: Twinkle-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Twinkle-shroom would be all over Dave's house, on the floor, on the table, on the dinner plate - Dave always forgot about the Doc's reminder - who cares, Daisy loved the gummy vitamins anyway!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A small mushroom that shoots mini-stars.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×5/2.25 Seconds (Equivalent to the DPS of 10 Peashooters) </color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).</color>

plants.name: Solar Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"What do you guys think 'flower pot' means, huh?" Solar Pot snapped. "Is it a pot for growing flowers? Or is it a pot that is a flower? Either way, let's get one thing straight—I am a flowerpot. End of discussion."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates extra Sun for you.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>15/25s</color>

plants.name: Lumos Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Beyond the fog, she watches, a prophet untouched by mortal blindness. When God willed light into existence, she stepped forth. "By decree of the Almighty, I have come to the land of Seth. The fire looms, but with this sacred light, I shall protect the lost from its grasp."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>It can dispel fog and block bullets.

<color=black>Energy Limit: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Shield & Light Range: </color><color=#8B0000>3×3</color>
<color=black>Special: <color=#99582a>Lumos System</color></color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Provides 1 Lumos Level and dispels fog like a Plantern.
<color=black>•</color> Consumes Energy to block projectiles. Each block consumes Energy based on the damage of the projectile (excluding basketballs). Tridents cannot be blocked.
<color=black>•</color> Restores (25 x Lumos Level) Energy every second, pausing to rest for 5 seconds when it is completely exhausted.
<color=black>•</color> Reduces Energy first to absorb damage, where 5 Energy = 1 Toughness.</color>

plants.name: Spinul Umbrela
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spinul Umbrela si-a lansat cea mai recenta piesa, "Cactusul intepator." Cu o stralucire de speranta in ochi, a meditat, "Poate ca intr-o zi, oamenii ma vor placea la fel de mult cum iubesc trandafirii. Stiu ca nu se va întampla peste noapte, dar voi continua sa incerc tot ce pot."</color>
plants.info: <size=36>Poate dobora zombi zburatori si respinge dirijabile.

plants.name: Floarea-Soarelui Argintie
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Who says sunflowers only bask in the sun? Silver Sunflower has a knack for more than just growing—she's a master silversmith! With techniques passed down from her brewer, she forges dazzling silverware and jewelry, each piece shimmering with history. As they say, "A brewer's legacy lives on, and elegance never goes unnoticed."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates Sun faster.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/15s</color>

plants.name: Floarea-Soarelui Aurie
plants.introduce: Standing guard over a trophy had been so last season. Now? She was ready to shine—and not just under the sun. "Look, I love a good tan, but let's be real... I was made for the fight!"
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates Sun faster... faster!

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Every 10 seconds, 50 Sun is accumulated, up to 10,000.
<color=black>•</color> The Sun limit in the level is adjusted to 50,000.
<color=black>•</color> The excess will be stored in the available Golden Sunflowers.
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 1000 Coins; makes all Golden Sunflowers release their stored Sun.</color>
plants.cost: <size=36>Upgrade Cost: </color><color=#8B0000>3000 Coins; each existing Golden Sunflower will double the cost</color>

plants.name: Frost Wall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Frost Wall-nut huffed as he hit the ground again. "Do the janitors ever remember to put up 'Caution: Slippery Floor' signs!?" he grumbled. But in his frustration, he failed to realize something very concerning—he was shrinking.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Zombies that bite him are slowed down.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies that chew it will be slowed down and will accrue Cryo points. Frost Wall-nuts can be upgraded to Frost Tall-nuts using a Fertilizer.</color>

plants.name: Pumpkin Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once a chip shop owner, Pumpkin Mine had a simple business model: cut the fries in half but keep the price the same. The customers disagreed. Now in the Garden, he's offering a different kind of deal—one that ends with a bang. Yet, for some reason, people still bring up his old menu.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A shorter Pumpkin.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles). However, non-"short" plants inside it will be hit. Each time it is damaged, a small explosion will occur, causing 500 points of damage to zombies.</color>

plants.name: Doom Cactus
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doom Cactus is a firm believer in the Art of War of Plants: bide your time, strike hard, and leave nothing standing. Whether it's zombies shambling through the battlefield or armored rats scurrying for cover, one well-placed explosion is all it takes to turn the tide.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires destructive thorns.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack has a 0% starting chance of unleashing an Ultimate attack. If it fails, the chance is increased by 5% for the next attack.</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Shoots a large number of thorns forward, which can hit airborne units.</color>

plants.name: Doom Chomper
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>In the Chomper's Big Eater Championship, Doom Chomper was a force to be reckoned with—until he took things a little too far. "He didn't just eat his cake—he incinerated mine!" a fellow contestant recalled. Unsurprisingly, he was disqualified for excessive destruction.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Devours a zombie to produce a Doom explosion.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Digestion Time: </color><color=#8B0000>60s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each time it successfully bites a zombie, a Doom-shroom explosion is released, causing a crater to appear in front of it (does not trigger explosion if in the rightmost column).</color>

plants.name: Flame-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As the head chef of the restaurant, performing a fiery dragon dance on the teppan is a must-have show for every dinner. But every time, at least one guest ends up getting burned. Word has it that to make up for it, the Flame-shroom gave them an encore performance.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Flamethrower incarnated.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>33/1.5s (Piercing)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals fire damage and inflicts Enflamed debuff. Flame-shrooms can be upgraded to Flame Gloom-shrooms using a Fertilizer.</color>

plants.name: Doom Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doom Pea and Frenzy-shroom are great friends—one's a hothead, the other’s laid-back. But together, they're the perfect pair. "We may be opposites, but we bring out the best in each other."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A damage-scaling Peashooter and the perfect partner for Frenzy-shroom.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks penetrate Type 2 armor. Damage increases by 1 each attack, up to 60. If a Frenzy-shroom is planted 1 tile behind it, Doom Pea gains Frenzy-shroom's attack speed and Frenzy-shroom gains Doom Pea's attack damage.</color>

plants.name: Lumos Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Lumos Pot always emits a warm glow, so it is often used as a nightlight. If you look closely, you will also find a small inscription on the edge of the pot that says, "Firefly habitat, please do not disturb."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Flower Pot that can be used as a small Plantern, providing 1 Lumos level for its tile.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Dispels a small patch of fog, providing 1 Lumos level for its tile.</color>

plants.name: Spring Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Holding your breath, focusing, and striking with precision!" Spring Melon is very patient, always waiting for the perfect moment to make a move. If you ask him how he manages to stay calm, he will always mention his mentor, Imitater.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A big shroom with coiling vines that lob watermelons after charging.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/4s</color>
<color=black>Range:</color><color=#8B0000> 4 tiles ahead</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Charges when not attacking for at least 4.5s to increase damage to (1 + charge time × 0.5) times the base damage. Maximum charge time: 30s.</color>

plants.name: Sparkwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After graduating from university, Sparkwood returned to the mountainous region to teach. "From the moment I received an education, I understood that knowledge is meant to be passed on like a 'spark'!" The flame of knowledge ignited the students' enthusiasm and also the zombies.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Torchwood shaped like a Starfruit, ignites star projectiles.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Ignites passing star-shaped projectiles (except thorn stars and jack-in-the-box stars), adding 20 damage and removing their other traits. Ignited stars do splash damage in a similar way to ignited peas.</color>

plants.name: Spicy Starfruit
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spicy Starfruit silently glares, while the other starfruits keep their distance: "He looks too scary." But Spicy Starfruit doesn't care; he is focused on creating an ultimate piece of art. He firmly believes that when he finally blooms, everyone will take notice.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Explodes and releases high-damage spicy stars.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>100 × 25</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Does not trigger the Jalapeno effect Immediately when fused. Explodes instead 1 second after fusion, releasing Jalapeno effect and exploding into 25 spicy stars.</color>

plants.name: Doomwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Whenever someone asks Doomwood, "What's the secret to grilling?" he just silently collects and repurposes the embers. It's not that he's indifferent; if he spoke, you'd just end up with a face full of ash.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Doomwood keeps burning even after a Doom-shroom explosion and it takes burning to the next level.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> When its Ember value is 0, it behaves the same as Torchwood.
<color=black>•</color> When the Ember value is not 0, turns peas and regular ignited peas into ember peas, with +30 damage and a no falloff 1/3 splash damage. Ember peas inflict the Ember debuff.
<color=black>•</color> Can also use 10 Ember values to strengthen Doom peas or Mini Doom-shroom projectiles, ×2 or ×6 their damage respectively, and to enhance their splash effect to be the same as an Ultimate Doom Shell.</color>
<color=#7303fc>Ember value: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Initial: 60, Maximum: 60, 1 point is lost per second.
<color=black>•</color> Gains 60 points when affected by Doom-shroom explosions, and 10 points when any zombie within a 5×5 area dies with the Ember debuff. After igniting 60 projectiles, instantly restores Ember points to 60 the next time it reaches 0.
<color=black>•</color> Ember can coexist with the Chilled, Enflamed and Poisoned debuff:
- Chilled: Ember adds another 10% to the slow factor.
