- Enflamed: Ember adds another 10% to the extra damage.
 - Poisoned: Ember makes Poison lasts indefinitely.</color>

plants.name: Scareless Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Trust me, it's very safe inside." Scareless Pumpkin gently reassures Scaredy-shroom, as the built-in phonograph and fairy tale books help them no longer worry about the zombie horde.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A pumpkin with the color of the Scaredy-shroom. Scaredy plants inside the pumpkin will not be afraid.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Scaredy plants inside the pumpkin will not be afraid (Frenzy-shroom and Gatling Frenzy-shroom will not self-destruct).</color>

plants.name: Starry-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Guys in the distance, no matter who you are, except for the circus people, don't come over!" The Starry-shroom, trembled, "I, I am very powerful!" He kept attacking, thinking that this would scare off those with ill intentions, but he didn't notice that his bullets weren't even hitting straight ahead.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Starry-shroom shoots stars faster and in 5 directions, but also gets frightened more often.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×5/0.75s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Keeps shooting stars in 5 directions like Starfruit, but becomes afraid and stops if there is a zombie in its range.</color>

plants.name: Squash Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Squash Pumpkin has never met a match in arm wrestling, has diligently learned various techniques for skipping stones, and is very good at selecting stones—his only bane is that he is very afraid of water and can only watch others skip stones.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>The cozy nest of Squashes. When there are specific plants in the shell, it can spawn squashes.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>225</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Squash plants in Squash Pumpkins lose their ability to detect enemies.
<color=black>•</color> When there are Squash or Squashwood plants in Squash Pumpkin, a baby squash with a maximum jump distance of 1.5 tiles is spawned and jumps forward, damaging zombies when it lands. It disappears after 6 jumps and regenerates 3s after the last baby squash disappears.
<color=black>•</color> Depending on the type of Squash inside it, the baby squashes have different effects:
- Squashes and Squash-nut: Baby squash does 1/8 the original damage.
- Gourd-pult: Baby squash drops a melon on landing that does the same damage.
- Squashwood: Baby squash does 225 damage.
- Butternut-pult: Baby squash has a 25% chance to drop a butter on landing that does the same damage.
- Infernal Squashwood: Baby squash does 1800 damage and releases a Jalapeno effect each time it lands.
- Big Crunch Squash: Baby squash releases a Cherry Bomb effect each time it lands and also a ring of 12 pieces of Nuclear Debris the last time. Both do 1/8 the original damage.
<color=black>•</color> Abilities do not work in water lanes.</color>

plants.name: Popcorn-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The results of this experiment: dense planting is not conducive to plant growth, and the corn ears have obviously shrunk." Dave bent down, took out a magnifying glass, and looked at the Popcorn-pult, "Not suitable for making corn rolls anymore." Popcorn-pult said angrily, "The results of this experiment show that the concentrated ones are all the essence!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A tiny Kernel-pult, with a chance to throw a small butter that shrinks zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant. Has a 25% chance to throw a small butter that deals 40 damage, which shrinks the size and health of non-shrunken zombies by a factor of 0.7, otherwise it will be stunned for 1.5s, while Imps are killed instantly. Prioritizes zombies that are not shrunken.</color>

plants.name: Hoverleaf
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After resigning, Hoverleaf embarked on a journey around the world. "Sailing with the wind to the places your heart desires, isn't that very romantic?" He compiled his experiences into a book, which received praise from all walks of life.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A smaller floating Umbrella Leaf that can only protect the 1 tile below.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Hovering plant. He shares the same traits as Umbrella Leaf, but can only protect the plant right below it.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Many plants were curious about how Hypno Pumpkin had only subdued one zombie. "I'm a dedicated person, so of course I need a dedicated zombie," Hypno Pumpkin said, scratching his head.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hypno Pumpkin makes a hypnotized zombie stay by your side.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 4% chance to hypnotize zombies eating him. Forces up to 1 hypnotized zombie to stay in his tile, and uses that zombie as a shield first when under attack.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Shell
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Umbrella Shell is the trendiest hairstylist in the garden, known for its ability to create cool hairstyles on hard nut shells. Although the lifespan of this hairstyle is short, it doesn't stop people from loving it—and the opening of the sixth nut hair salon chain.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Umbrella Shell has the traits of both his fusion ingredients.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has the characteristics of Umbrella Leaf and Wall-nut. Can repel approaching zombies, dealing 40 damage every time.</color>

plants.name: Bombrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Bombrella has changed to a new hairstyle, making it look even more rebellious and irritable, like a delinquent wandering the streets. But don't be fooled by its appearance; it actually has a soft heart and even helps the barber clean up the fallen leaves.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>When repelling, it causes small-scale cherry explosions, and harnesses the power of cherry explosions to protect surrounding plants.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>600</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Inherits the traits of Umbrella Leaf.
<color=black>•</color> Repel approaching zombies and release a small-range cherry explosion with a damage of 300. 
<color=black>•</color> Immune to explosive basketballs.
<color=black>•</color> For every instance of Cherry-fused defensive plants or Cherry Pot healing through cherry explosions in the surrounding 3×3 area, it gains 1 level of energy, up to 100 level. 
<color=black>•</color> Bombrella uses 2 levels to absorb any damage in the surrounding 3×3 area.</color>

plants.name: Chrono Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Nothing has been born earlier than the universe, and nothing will perish slower than the universe. But for life, his/her body is not as enduring as the death of a star; his/her spirit is even more eternal than the universe. Cherish the present, seize the future, even if it's just for a day or two, that is still a mayfly's life." — "Chronicles"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Peashooter with the power to warp space and time, firing neutron peas that inflict the Chronoshift effect, erasing every trace of the target from the time continuum.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks deal no damage but apply Chronoshift for 1.5s, or extend the duration by 1 second if the target is already affected. Deals only 100 damage to Mini-bosses.</color>
<color=#00008B>Chronoshift: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies under this effect receive a countdown of (HP / 30) seconds, after which they are instantly erased. If the effect ends early, they take 30 × (elapsed seconds) points worth of damage.</color>

plants.name: Kernel Morph
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The elderly also need to learn to keep up with the times," the Kernel Morph said, "This new force of magnetism has truly opened my eyes." Of course, there is a small problem; it always makes the neighbors think he's a scrap collector.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>The Kernel Morph can fuse with metal objects and changes into the corresponding form based on the type.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 25% chance to throw a magnetic butter with 80 damage, and stuns the target for 4 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Portal-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"You've seen Interstellar, right?" Portal-pult often brings up his favorite sci-fi movie. "The male protagonist drives into a cornfield at the beginning and then pilots a spaceship into a black hole at the end. There must be some connection between the two!" Portal-pult insists.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Portal-pult has a chance to throw a neutron butter that generates a mini black hole.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Has a 25% chance to throw a neutron butter with 100 damage, which generates a mini black hole when it hits. The mini black hole massively slows zombies down and explodes after 2 seconds, causing 100 damage and reducing the countdown of zombies with the chronoshift effect by 30s.</color>

plants.name: Bolt-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Bolt-pult has been considering buying some anti-rust paint lately, as his butter always ends up with a bit of a rusty taste, which seriously hinders his ability to make butter cakes for his brothers. "Butter with a rusty taste might only be good for fighting zombies."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Bolt-pult throws Iron kernels or Iron butter that is miraculously effective against Type 1 armor.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Has a 25% chance to throw an Iron butter with 100 damage, which stuns the target for 4 seconds and removes their Type 1 armor instantly.</color>

plants.name: Frozen Cherry
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The plants all say that Frozen Cherry is calm, introverted, and taciturn. "I occasionally confide in the other cherries," Frozen Cherry said, "they call it 'explosive news.'"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherry mold made of ice, he absorbs cherry projectiles from plants to generate Cherry Bomb seed packets.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Absorbing cherries, ignited cherries, and explosive cherries grants 1, 2, and 10 energy points respectively. For every 100 energy points collected, a Cherry Bomb seed packet is generated. Upon death, unleashes a Cherry Bomb explosion and freezes all zombies in its range for 10 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Dormant-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Using magnetism to confine nuclear energy is a topic that Dormant-shroom has been researching for a long time. This is a difficult task, and timing is crucial; numerous laboratories of his are now in ruins. However, it seems that the zombies are more eager for him to succeed than the plants.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Dormant-shroom is stabilized by magnetic force and can be fused with metal to transform into a corresponding form.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Does not explode until further fusion.</color>

plants.name: Doomwarp-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Time travel personnel have passed through, complete. The time tunnel has exited the target world, complete. Observed impact is within the expected range, complete. Proceed to the next step, destroy the tunnel to prevent use by others or organizations." — "Time Planning Bureau"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Doomwarp-shroom possesses the power of hyperspace bending. Its explosion inflicts chronoshift to any foe unfortunate enough to be caught in its effects.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator) </color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Doom-shroom. Explosion applies the Chronoshift effect for 30s or resets the remaining duration to 30s.</color>

plants.name: Chrono-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Other plants often hear Chrono-nut recount the mysteries on his adventures — like a Sphinx with a zombie’s head, a minivan that only beeps, and the 1001 kinds of machines developed by GFishtus Corps.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Wall-nut with spacetime powers. He has a chance to teleport back attackers and can rewind health once when near death.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> 25% chance to teleport biters to the far right of the same row (10s cooldown).
<color=black>•</color> When taking lethal damage, rewinds HP to what it was 3s ago and becomes invulnerable for 3s (single use ability).</color>

plants.name: Pea Drone
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pea Drone sees himself as the future of garden warfare. "Support-type aerial drones — a weapon of a new era." Unfortunately, he has little time to promote his ideas — he works three jobs to pay off his soilless cultivation loan.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A peashooter drone that enhances firepower when coordinating with straight-shooting plants below.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Hovering plant. If the shooter directly beneath it attacks faster than once every 1.5 seconds, Pea Drone syncs its attack rate to match.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Sawshooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>In the snowy plains, it’s said that the taller the Christmas tree, the happier the next year will be. So who can place the star on top? That's a job for the Spruce Sawshooter and his unmatched aim.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires piercing saws that leave spinning spruce needles on zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s; 1×75/1.5s (Spinning spruce needle)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles pierce once (including ice blocks) and leave spinning spruce needles on the first zombie hit.
<color=black>•</color> Spinning needles deal 1 damage every 0.02 seconds for 1.5 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Soak-me-not
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After equipping a high-pressure water jet, Soak-me-not greatly improved her cutting efficiency. But there's one downside — flowing water is hard to come by on the snowy plains.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cold-resistant, deals more damage when it's sufficiently cold and applies chill when there are ice charges.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>8/0.02s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15 ice charge when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom respectively.
<color=black>•</color> With ice charges, attacks deal double damage, inflict Deep Chill and add 1 Cryo Point, but have an 1/9 chance to use up a charge. </color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Sprayshooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Can an archer compete without a bow? Spruce Sprayshooter shrugs: "It's just waterbending."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Bends and shoots water orbs; consumes ice charges to launch ice blocks instead.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>50/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Uses 1 ice charge to shoot an ice block with double the damage that inflicts Deep Chill and adds 40 Cryo points, dealing ×4 damage to Frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Supershooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spruce Supershooter is stern, cold, and strict—perfect traits for a top-tier coach.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots spinning hydro-needles that cling to zombies. Consumes ice charges to shoot spinning cryo-needles instead.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>5×75/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Spinning hydro-needles deal 5 damage per 0.02 seconds and last 1.5 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Uses 1 ice charge to shoot spinning cryo-needles with double the damage that inflict Deep Chill and adds 1 Cryo points, dealing ×4 damage to Frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>

plants.name: Snowbloom Spruce
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"People talk about iron trees blooming or old trees flowering," Snowbloom Spruce murmurs. "But I’m neither iron nor old. I just... never mind." He stops talking to admire his blossoms.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spruce with snow lotus blooms and a reduced cost for healing nearby plants.

<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1 ice charge passively every 10 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/60 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/blizzard respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Awakens at 5 charges, firing an ice orb that deals 100 damage with 3×3 splash (no falloff) and inflicts Deep Chill.
<color=black>•</color> While awake, consumes 1 charge per sec to heal a 3×3 area by 50 HP. Returns to sleep when charge is exhausted.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>

plants.name: Shield Lotus
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Her bunny ears are so cute!" "She’s adorable even when asleep!" "Like a rose!" Shield Lotus sleepily swats away the fans that lack a sense of personal space—yes, she's thorny like a rose, but that hasn’t stopped the admiration.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A steel-leaved Lotus that heals nearby plants and gives them shields.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits Snow Lotus traits. Healing also grants 50 points of Shield to each plant. See Saw-me-not for shield mechanic explanation.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Firnace
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spruce Firnace always carries dry spruce leaves. He claims they're excellent "green" fuel—flammable and easy to collect. Right now, he's sun-drying a batch.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An upgraded Firnace that absorbed Spruce Sharpshooter, with an expanded protection range.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Firnace but with range expanded to 3×3. Reverts to regular Firnace after 210s.</color>

plants.name: Saw Firnace
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Using potassium as fuel not only provides ample heat, but also gives off beautiful flame colors," Saw Firnace enthusiastically explains. "And this fan, modified from a circular saw, helps blow hot air right to you." As a top employee of the snowfield sauna, he's always committed to providing the best service.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An upgraded Firnace that absorbed Saw-me-not, with an expanded protection range.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Firnace but with range expanded to 3×3. Reverts to regular Firnace after 120s.</color>

plants.name: Lotus Firnace
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I was born extraordinary," claims Lotus Firnace. He thinks he glows from phosphorus fire — but actually, it’s just fireflies hiding from the cold inside him.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An upgraded Firnace that absorbed Snow Lotus, with an expanded protection range.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Firnace but with range expanded to 3×3. Reverts to regular Firnace after 60s.</color>

plants.name: Aloe Firnace
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Aloe Firnace has upgraded its air system to better regulate temperature in small areas. The only problem: the water dripping from the condenser tends to freeze quickly in the snowfield.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An upgraded Firnace that absorbed Aloe Aqua, with an expanded protection range.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Firnace but with range expanded to 3×3. Reverts to regular Firnace after 90s.</color>

plants.name: Aloe Alba
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doctor Aloe Alba is the most beloved young doctor in the hospital. It's not just due to his diligence and skill — it might also be his mustache-like leaves. After all, patients tend to trust older-looking doctors.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Throws aloe extract upwards; upon falling, it heals surrounding plants and temporarily boosts their attack speed.

<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1 ice charge passively every 5 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15/60 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom/blizzard respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Every 5 seconds, consumes 5 charges to heal all plants in a 3×3 area for 50 HP and boost their attack speed by 30% for 5 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>

plants.name: Icy Squash
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>To tame its hot temper, Icy Squash locked itself in the freezer for three days and nights. Now it keeps the mood ice-cold — so cold that the other plants don't dare say a word to 'set it off.' As for zombies… let's just say, no one's allowed to 'break the ice' with it.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Squash imbued with freezing power.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Squash) + 600 (3×3)</color>
<color=black>Detection Range: </color><color=#8B0000>0.5 tiles to the left; 1 tile to the right</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Upon landing deals additional 600 damage to zombies in a 3×3 area and freezes them for 4s.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Squash
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I've finally realized zombies really are our friends,"said Hypno Squash, who quickly joined the Zombuddies Club. The only problem: his extremely radical way of showing friendship turned all the other members into conservative ones.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Squash that overwhelms zombies with charm.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Squash)</color>
<color=black>Detection Range: </color><color=#8B0000>0.5 tiles to the left; 1 tile to the right</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Hypnotizes the zombies he crushes, deals 1800 damage instead if the zombie cannot be hypnotized.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Garlic
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hypno Garlic doesn't quite fit in with the rest of the garlic family — he's far too popular for that. Loved and envied by his kin, he pays them no mind. All he wants is to pull his hat low over his eyes and enjoy a peaceful nap whenever he can.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Garlic with a shroomy hypno-cap mushroom on its head.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Causes hypnotized zombies that touch him to switch lanes.
<color=black>•</color> When bitten, hypnotizes the attacker, forces it to switch lanes, then reverts to a regular Garlic.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hypno Mine isn't one for rushing. It believes every zombie deserves a second chance — preferably before it explodes. Contradictory? Maybe. But it's perfectly in line with its five personal principles, which it refuses to share.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Potato Mine with an explosive charm.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Hypnotizes the zombies exploded, deals 1800 damage instead if the zombie cannot be hypnotized.</color>

plants.name: Tangle Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Originally a naval mine tossed ashore by a powerful tsunami, this fella now lies half-buried in the soil. Though the kelp outside has withered, the explosives inside remain deadly.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Potato Mine tangled with kelp.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Drown)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> When armed, insta-kills the first approaching zombie and triggers a Potato Mine explosion.</color>

plants.name: Kelp Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Beware, ships — reefs ahead!" Kelp Mine serves as the river's safety officer, signaling danger with a red light. He does a solid job, since wherever he appears, danger is never far behind.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Tangle Kelp that's as explosive as Potato Mine.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Drown)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Insta-kills the first approaching zombie and deals 600 damage to zombies in a 3×3 area.</color>

plants.name: Firnurse
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Firnurse brings warmth and life to the frozen wilderness. Despite his odd appearance, the local kids adore him. "Sugar cube, anyone?" he offers cheerfully. "Helps keep the heat in!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Stable high-temp Firnace that periodically provides charges or healing to nearby plants.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Inherits traits of Firnace, with a 3×3 protection range.
<color=black>•</color> Cannot be placed near other Firnaces.
<color=black>•</color> Provides 1 ice charge to protected Snow plants every 3s.
<color=black>•</color> Heals protected plants for 50 HP every 15s.</color>

plants.name: Flame Wall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Always wear a smile"—that’s rule number one for Flame Wall-nut, the ever-patient restaurant server. Even when half-melted Frost Wall-nut is slipping all over the floor yelling about the lack of a 'Wet Floor' sign, he just keeps smiling. And sizzling.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spicy-flavored nut that scorches biters.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals 20 damage to biters and inflicts Enflamed debuff. Flame Wall-nuts can be upgraded to Flame Tall-nuts using a Fertilizer.</color>

plants.name: Doom-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doom-nut is a huge fan of Batman. He rarely speaks, preferring to lurk in shadows, and only shows up at the occasional Comic-cons. One time, he startled McCornics in a hallway. "When did Doom-shroom get... this bulky?" the old corn muttered.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Wall-nut with nuclear potential. 

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to non-physical explosions. 
<color=black>•</color> Prevents Doom-shroom Zombies in a 3×3 area from exploding. 
<color=black>•</color> Heals for 100 HP when a zombie with Ember debuff dies in a 5×5 area.
<color=black>•</color> Triggers Doom-shroom effect on death.</color>

plants.name: Spike-kelp
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spike-Kelp always felt like the runt of the spikeweed family—small, unnoticeable, and half-submerged. The others tried to cheer him up: "Hey, at least you're still more popular than that prickly old Spike-nut."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spikeweed but aquatic and tangly.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks add 1 Tangle Value. Takes 10 damage every time he attacks a vehicle.</color>

plants.name: Tangle Weed
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Founder of the now-famous aquatic foot massage empire, Tangle Weed has redefined spa therapy. With branches in every biome and a new line of vehicular massage lanes, business is booming—especially with traffic this bad.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spikeweed that tangles zombies even on land.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks add 1 land Tangle Value (1/3 the efficacy of aquatic Tangle Value).</color>

plants.name: Doomplate-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Boom! A reality-defying burst of high-speed nuclear fission tears zombies apart, breaking down their atoms and rearranging them into the most stable form known to plantkind: iron. "Why iron buckets?" Doomplate-shroom pauses, then replies, "Because I was born that way."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Powerful Doom-shroom that turns the ashes from his explosion into Buckets.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>3240 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Every zombie he kills drops a Bucket.</color>

plants.name: Threetato Mine
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>Threetato Mine loves playing tricks underground. It shoots out surprises not once, not twice, but thrice—like a cheeky prankster with a never-ending stash of boom. Watch your step, or you might get a triple whammy that’ll blow your boots off.

- Written by Mrs. Draco</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Threetato Mine resurfaces after exploding and fires potatoes across three lanes.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Attacks faster as zombies get closer (down to 0.5s per attack).
<color=black>•</color> When armed, explodes on contact, dealing 5400 damage, knocks back for 1 tile and retreats into the ground.
<color=black>•</color> Re-emerges 15s after exploding. Explodes and disappears immediately upon contact with vehicles.</color>

plants.name: Lumos Angler
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>They say Lumos Angler has never gone hungry—not once. Every chomp lands a juicy zombie. He even published a book sharing his secrets: "Wiggle... wiggle... zombies love a gentle glow." — From his work Lantern.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lures in zombies to snack on with his lophos.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Digestion Time: </color><color=#8B0000>40s</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000> Each Lumos level reduces digestion time by 10s to a minimum of 10s.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Upon successful digestion, pulls a nearby zombie from adjacent lanes to its lane.</color>

plants.name: Doombox-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Hey clowny!" the zombies jeer. Doombox-shroom just glances their way in silence. He doesn’t need to argue: his masterpiece will speak for itself. Too bad none of them will be around to see how it ends.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Doom-shroom with enhanced explosive powers able to cause chain explosions.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>3240 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>For every zombie eliminated, creates a Jack-in-the-Box explosion that deals 1800 damage at its position.</color>

plants.name: Cherry Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cherry Pot would rather give up her pay at the Zen Garden than be mistaken for a plant."Those lunatics can't get real cherries, so they're out here trying to eat anything cherry-flavored!" Just talking about it makes her shudder.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A pot with a passion for cherry explosions, using them to heal the plant on her own tile and briefly empower cherry-type shooters.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to cherry explosions.
<color=black>•</color> Heals the plant on herself by 20 HP when affected by cherry explosions.
<color=black>•</color> While healing, also grants an attack speed boost (50%) for 5s to cherry shooting plants.</color>

plants.name: Cherry Drone
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cherry Drone always cares about appearances—whether or not anyone's watching. Ground or air, if you mess up his hair, you’ll get blasted. Hard.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A cheeky cherry delinquent that floats through the air and dive-bombs zombies in style.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Every 15s, targets one zombie in a 3×5 area and dive-bombs them, causing a cherry-style explosion in a 1-tile radius.</color>

plants.name: Sunrise-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>A seasoned sunlight banker, Sunrise-shroom offers high interest on your deposits."You chose a time deposit," he says sternly to a frustrated Twin Solar-nut. "Withdrawals aren't allowed just yet."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A visionary sun producer that absorbs and multiplies nearby sun, paying out in bursts.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/20s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Absorbs dropped Sun within a 5×5 area, multiplies their value by ×1.3, and stores them.
<color=black>•</color> Releases as much Sun as possible in batches of 25 along with the next production.</color>

plants.name: Sunny-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sunny-shroom's been working on a new breathing method to quickly vent all that awful sunlight. But… "Ahh! Zombies!!" And just like that, he's curled up, trembling, forgetting everything. As for the breathing method? He'll figure it out when the zombies walk away.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A timid sun producer that tries to work faster until it panics.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Production interval gradually shortens to 10s.
<color=black>•</color> Cowers in fear when zombies approach, resetting interval back to 25s and producing 25 Sun immediately.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Ballista
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pulling a giant ballista is exhausting, so even Spruce Ballista needs a vacation. Thanks to Astro-nut's help, he found a job in another world: Helping to launch angry avians at some very green, very smug pigs.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires giant spruce bolts that pierce through zombies and detonate with a short delay.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Must be planted on two side-by-side Spruce Sharpshooters.
<color=black>•</color> Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.
<color=black>•</color> Bolts pierce up to 2 times (can pierce ice) and explode 0.3s after hitting a zombie, dealing AoE damage in a small area.</color>

plants.name: Doomflower
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Garden games sometimes come down to pure luck. That's when Doomflower steps up."Why always me?" "Because you're destined. Or doomed."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Sunflower that plants Doom-spores around herself, which grow and detonate remotely.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Every 50s, plants one Doom-spore randomly in a 3×3 area around herself.
<color=black>•</color> Doom-spores take 30s to grow and once mature, if a zombie enters their blast radius, they detonate like a Doom-shroom.</color>

plants.name: Doom-spore
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Quietly growing on the lawn, Doom-spore hums the lullaby taught by Doomflower, dreaming of becoming a rising sun... and of no longer being mistaken for a rusty bolt.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A dormant spore radiating destructive power — just give it some time.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Takes 30s to grow and once mature, if a zombie enters his blast radius, detonates like a Doom-shroom.</color>

plants.name: Squash-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Dragged from a kids' playground by his stem and dumped on the lawn, Squash-nut was rejected for being a deformed rubber ball. Now, furious and bumpy, he bounces wildly, yelling: "I'm gonna play all I want! ALL I WANT!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A bouncy nut who's all tantrum and impact.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>160/1.5s  (Squash)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Bounces in his tile when a zombie gets close, dealing splash damage on each landing. Does not block zombies while airborne.</color>

plants.name: Silver Doom-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Silver Doom-shroom turned destruction into a money-making venture — and a lucrative one at that. Of course, he spent his first fortune immediately... on a fancy new skin.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Doom-shroom that swapped bang for bling.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Does not explode.</color>

plants.name: Golden Doom-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Ahem, eyes over here." That's how Golden Doom-shroom begins every Wall-nut Street summit. The other tycoons fear him—not just for his wealth, but for his power to erase their wealth in one glorious blast.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Turns money into ruin.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Does not passively explode.</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 3000 Coins, Cooldown: 30s; releases a Doom-shroom effect that does not leave a crater.</color>

plants.name: Iron Squash
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Iron Squash armored up in cold steel, harder, heavier and packs more harm. Just don't mention the "rivets" on his face. He insists they're structural... not acne.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A metal-plated Squash with terrifying weight.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>3240 (Squash)</color>
<color=black>Detection Range: </color><color=#8B0000>0.5 tiles to the left; 1 tile to the right</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Can be fed corresponding metal objects to restore 500 Toughness. Receives half the damage from explosive cherries.</color>

plants.name: Atlantis Ballista
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Atlantis Ballista once served proudly atop the castle walls, convinced his power was like a roaring tsunami. Turns out, everyone was just talking about the screech his strings made when reloading. Embarrassed but undeterred, he found salvation in aloe juice. Now his bolts are smoother, deadlier, and most importantly, much quieter.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires tidal bolts with a tsunami's force; targets struck become more vulnerable to chill.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/1s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.
<color=black>•</color> Fires 4 bolts in quick succesion before resting for 3s.
<color=black>•</color> 90% chance to fire Tidal Bolts. Applies Soaked for 5s. A soaked zombie will be frozen instead of chilled when hit by any cryo-system attack. The status is then cleared and cannot be reapplied for 10s.
<color=black>•</color> 10% chance to fire Ice Bolts. Applies Deep Chill.</color>

plants.name: Drone-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Some claim zombies have mastered the martial arts to be able to harm plants with falling petals. Most plants dismiss it. But Drone-nut disagrees. "It's true," he says, floating overhead. "I've blocked such blows. Three times."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A hovering nut that shields his tile from damage.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Absorbs damage for his own tile.
<color=black>•</color> If undamaged for 10s, regenerates 50 HP per second.</color>

plants.name: Thorn-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Thorn-nut proudly insists he's the true Spike-nut. "Look at these spines! This color!" he declares constantly. One day, someone finally asked, "Wait… who's Spike-nut again?"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A cactus-covered nut that punishes attackers and disables balloon zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Reflects 50 damage back to zombies biting it.
<color=black>•</color> Can pop Balloons.</color>

plants.name: Star-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Star-nut lives under a rock and rarely moves. It's not because he's lazy, but because he's got standards. He'll only act if invited by a certain square friend to jellyfishing… or to prank a cephalopodic neighbor.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A reactive defender that counters with little stars.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Fires five 20-damage stars in all directions when damaged.</color>

plants.name: Bamblotus
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Every winter, Bamblotus tries to impress potential mates with a dazzling petal display. But his performance often goes… too fast. And too cold. The girls walk away before he even finishes blooming.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A self-healing barricade that grows stronger with nearby allies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1500</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.
<color=black>•</color> Heals himself by 50 HP when charged.
<color=black>•</color> Recovers 40 HP every 1.5s. This HP recovery is increased by 100% for each adjacent Bamblock-type plants.
<color=black>•</color> Resilience (defaults to 1): Incoming damage is divided by resilience. Max HP is treated as multiplied by resilience. Resilience is increased by 0.3 for each adjacent Bamblock-type plant.</color>

plants.name: Bambloe
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Bambloe loves to travel and promote his snowy hometown. But no one ever seems interested. "They always think the pack on my back is just a bump from getting whacked," he complains. "No wonder they think the tundra's an unforgiving place."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An ice-hardened barricade that thrives against cold-based zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1500</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.
<color=black>•</color> Gains ice charges like Aloe Aqua.
<color=black>•</color> Resilience (defaults to 1): Incoming damage is divided by resilience. Max HP is treated as multiplied by resilience. Consumes 1 charge to raise resilience by 2. Gains 1 resilience when fighting chilled/frozen zombies (not stackable with previous ability).</color>

plants.name: Bamboo Shooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The zombies thought they could avoid any road accidents by steering clear of Bamblocks. But ever since the Bamboo Shooter arrived, sharpened shoots started flying their way. Scattering in panic, they fled while shouting, "Shoot! Shoots!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires piercing bamboo shoots!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.
<color=black>•</color> Shots pierce like Spruce Sharpshooter's.
<color=black>•</color> When a shot hits a zombie: If HP is higher than the zombie's, deals damage equal to the HP difference to self and the zombie is instantly killed. If lower, HP is reduced to a minimum of 300, and the zombie takes damage equivalent to the difference. This ability does not activate if HP is 300 or lower.</color>

plants.name: Melon-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Whenever zombies come to buy watermelons, the melon stand owner Aloe Alba always sells them the biggest one—the Melon-nut. After the zombies crack their teeth on it, Aloe Alba refers them to a nearby dental clinic to get them fixed, and, naturally, that clinic also belongs to Aloe Alba.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Grows a temporary shield and retaliates with a melon after taking a certain amount of damage.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> When taking damage, stores 1.5× the damage taken as Retaliation Charge. If the damage exceeds 100/500/1000, stores 3/4.5/6× the damage instead.
<color=black>•</color> Retaliation Meter is capped at max HP.
<color=black>•</color> When the Retaliation Meter exceeds 1000, consumes all charges to launch a watermelon dealing the same amount of damage and gains a shield of equal value that fully decays over 5s.</color>

plants.name: Cabbage-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Every year, Cabbages can't wait to sprout, but Cabbage-nut is always the exception. He wraps himself up tightly before stepping out. "Zombies don't have the patience to peel layer after layer. Trust me."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Grows a temporary shield and retaliates with a cabbage after taking a certain amount of damage.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> When taking damage, stores 1× the damage taken as Retaliation Charge. If the damage exceeds 100/500/1000, stores 2/3/4× the damage instead.
<color=black>•</color> Retaliation Meter is capped at max HP.
<color=black>•</color> When the Retaliation Meter exceeds 1000, consumes all charges to launch a cabbage dealing the same amount of damage and gains a shield of equal value that fully decays over 5s.</color>

plants.name: Butter-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"They're terrifying, just like in disaster movies." Butter-nut trembles as he hides his face behind butter. But the chance to observe zombies up close fills him with curiosity, and in the end, he can't help but peek out from behind the butter, studying these creatures frozen in the last frame of their lives.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Zombies are immobilized each time they bite - now that's what you call a "head-butter awakening."

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When bitten, immobilizes the attacking Zombie with Butter for 2s.</color>

plants.name: Bamblade
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"We're supposed to be barriers, yet zombies always gnaw on us like we're snacks," Bamblade laments. Determined, she sets out to master tougher parrying and counterattack skills. Whether she's succeeded is unclear, but she sure looks tastier than ever.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Bamblock that steadily generates a protective shield.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1500</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Generates 60 points of Shield every 1.5s, up to (max HP×1 + 60) points.</color>

plants.name: Bamboo Firnace
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As the tallest bodyguard from the Bamblock Security Company, Bamboo Firnace stays hidden yet alert. Across all his zombie encounters, he's never got injured—not even once. That's a pretty dazzling record.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An upgraded Firnace that absorbed Bamblock, with an expanded protection range.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Firnace but with range expanded to 3×3. Reverts to regular Firnace after 60s.</color>

plants.name: Jugger-nut
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>The plants always complain that Jugger-nut is an obstacle to the view, and that despite being so large he does nothing to get rid of the zombies in front of him. "He's lazy, I don't think he got here on his own," some said. "He rolled down a mountain and ended up here," others mocked. But Jugger-nut had no intention of answering them because like his shell, his will was hardened to protect the plants that needed him, after all.

-Written by Ultra Badlander</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>The more types of defensive plants are on the field, the higher its own defense.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>32000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Tall plant.
<color=black>•</color> Anti-crush, damage received is capped at 1/3 Toughness.
<color=black>•</color> After Damage Cap, damage is reduced by dividing it by (1 + 0.1×number of defensive plant types on the field).</color>

plants.name: Hypno Pea
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Simply making Zombies into our allies isn't enough. We need to equip them with a little extra firepower, and have them look more like us in the process!" Hypno Pea says in an alluring tone.

-Written by Mr. Etc.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots hypno peas that turn killed zombies into friendly Hypno Pea Zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Summons a Hypnotized Hypno Pea Zombie upon killing a zombie.
<color=black>•</color> Abilities do not work in water lanes.
<color=black>•</color> Hypno Pea Zombie: 270 HP, fires a 20-damage Hypno Pea every 1.5s.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Repeater
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hypno Repeater talks fast and finishes most sentences before anyone else starts speaking. "Reality's a loop! I've fired this shot before, twice!"

-Written by Ocean Soul</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Repeater that fires Hypno Peas.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×2/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Summons a Hypnotized Hypno Pea Zombie upon kill.
<color=black>•</color> Tap to auto-fuse with a free Peashooter 15s after planting.</color>

plants.name: Split Hypno
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I feel dizzy!" "Actually it's not that bad." "No, I'm totally disoriented." "But your head's in the back." "That's just a figure of speech." "And I'm being literal." "These two brothers are arguing again," says Hypno Pea, "probably their 3,682nd time."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Split Pea that fires Hypno Peas.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Summons a Hypnotized Hypno Pea Zombie upon kill.
<color=black>•</color> Tap to auto-fuse with a free Peashooter 15s after planting.</color>

plants.name: Gatling Hypno
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Gatling Hypno is a star in the Zombuddies Club. "There's nothing wrong with my eyes. I know which zombies can be redeemed." He harshly criticizes the radical Hypno Squash: "He's too violent, we should be friendlier with our potential collaborators." Their debate is now so intense that only the two of them remain in the club, besides the one who started it all.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gatling Pea that fires Hypno Peas.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×4/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Summons a Hypnotized Hypno Pea Zombie upon kill.</color>

plants.name: Tri-phoon Commando
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>This trio in particular showed serious dedication at the Pea Squad Bootcamp, always firing in unison, and settling arguments with each other in record time. They earned the title of First Tri-phoon Commando, and had the 3 stars split across each of their helmets.

-Written by Mr. Etc.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires copious amounts of peas in three lanes.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>(20×6)×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>60×3/0.02s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>6% chance to shoot a barrage of peas each attack, lasting 5s.</color>

plants.name: Reaper Snipea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Ever heard plants whisper in the dead of night?" He wipes his old rifle. "She's slow, but she's never let me down…" A dark light cuts the air. "Time to beat my 48 out of 50 hit record."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Piercing shots and rapid fire; charged shots deal massive area damage.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>100/0.3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Unlimited pierce; +1 Doom & Frenzy charge per hit.
<color=black>•</color> Consumes 300 Doom charges to trigger a Doom-shroom blast (72× base damage) at the location of the first zombie hit.
<color=black>•</color> Consumes 100 Frenzy charges for double the fire rate, lasting for 8s.
<color=black>•</color> 10% chance to crit for 6× damage (crit is guaranteed against zombies with the Ember debuff).</color>

plants.name: Camo-shroom
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>Camo-shroom cares for his friends. Even though he can fly away from the danger of zombies, into the clouds of high above, he can't simply abandon his roots. In an attempt to protect them, he covers them with his leaves and begs the zombies not to hurt them. And the zombies, for some reason, listen.

-Written by Ultra Badlander</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Floats above ground, providing camouflage to nearby Scaredy-shrooms hiding from zombies.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Hovering plant.
<color=black>•</color> Zombies won't eat hiding Scaredy-type plants in a 3×3 area around the Camo-shroom.</color>

plants.name: Blasty-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The meekest Cherry in the family, no tantrums, no shouting, and loved by many. "I… kinda want to swear sometimes," she admits. "But… I'm afraid someone might yell back."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Frightened easily, but causes an explosion when it happens.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When scared, hides and sets off a Cherry Bomb blast that deals 600 AoE damage.</color>

plants.name: Fallout Blover
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Nyan Squash just wanted a stronger fan… but not even nuclear power can seem to meet her requirements. "This is a terrible model," Zomboss noted. "All that heat and waste product? Blasted straight out."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Blasts zombies with high-temp wind laced with ash and nuclear fallout.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Lasts for 10s before disappearing.
<color=black>•</color> Every second, deals 180 Cremator damage to all zombies on the lawn. Damage is doubled against zombies with the Ember debuff.</color>

plants.name: Breeze Blover
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Breeze Blover is a -4°C air conditioner. When his chilly breeze blows, it feels like stepping straight into winter. Even Snow Pea is frozen, the cold wind actually froze his own projectiles. What could possibly be colder than that? Answer: The atmosphere after Coldsnap Bean's told one of his totally tone deaf jokes.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Blover of a freezing breeze that constantly applies chill.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Lasts for 10s before disappearing.
<color=black>•</color> Every second, deals 1 damage and applies 20 Cryo points to all zombies on the lawn.
<color=black>•</color> Converts all snow peas on screen to polar ice peas.</color>

plants.name: Death Star
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I could destroy almost the entire planet if I wanted to," boasts Death Star, "and they'd all blame it on the biggest star in the sky..."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Transforms himself into a Doom Meteor and crashes into the ground.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Disappears after 3s and summons a Doom Meteor that deals 1800 area damage on impact and splits into 180 spore stars each dealing 20 damage.</color>

plants.name: Foul-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Foul-nut believes even zombies deserve a balanced diet. He'll always stand between them and your brains, gently nudging them toward healthier options like Cabbage-nut.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A tough nut with garlic properties, poisonous and hits instantly.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When bitten, poisons attacker for 10s and gives them 1 Poison point.</color>

plants.name: Mag-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Everyone knows magnets attract metal, but Mag-nut? People wonder why he's no longer doing that. Mag-nut himself claims to prefer the security of a orbiting shield of projectiles over pulling nails and screws.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pulls friendly straight-shooting projectiles nearby and makes them orbit him.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attracts nearby plant straight-shooting projectiles, making them orbit at a radius of 1.5 tiles; can hold up to 100 projectiles at once, each lasting up to 20s.</color>

plants.name: Slice-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Slice-pults love to share, even with zombies. They chop their melons into small slices and toss them over. Strangely, zombies are terrible at catching them…</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Melon slices lose the ability to do splash but are now twice effective against shrunken zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Melon slices no longer do splash damage but deal double the damage to shrunken zombies.</color>

plants.name: Sprout-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>People say Sprout-pult holds the magical power to shrink zombies. And the secret, they claim, is in the bounce. But only Popcorn-pult knows the real reason: there's a tiny pat of butter hidden inside. The cabbage leaves are just too thick for it to pop out… so of course it needs to bounce first to shrink a zombie.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs sprouts capable of passing on the shrinking effect.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Shots bounce twice. If a shot hits a shrunken zombie, it gains the ability to shrink the next zombies hit.</color>

plants.name: Nutwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Today's menu features roasted nuts." Even Nutwood can't help but smile at the thought of having made such a treat. It's the perfect picnic snack, except that no actual Wall-nuts are around. The "roasted nuts" are bread replicas, so realistic that they make real Wall-nuts uneasy.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Capable of producing Roasted Wall-nuts.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>For every 50 peas lit, a Roasted Wall-nut is spawned in front.</color>

plants.name: Nuca-Perete Prajita
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Lumina, da-mi caldura, da-mi putere." zambeste Nuca-Perete Prajia, radiind o stralucire delicata… si parfum de chimen. Proaspat venita de la o petrecere la gratar, carapacea sa crocanta atrage privirile flamande ale tuturor, inclusiv ale zombilor..</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>O Nuca-Perete s-a format la temperaturi intense, dar nu mult diferita.

<color=black>Duritate: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Nu poate fi folosita pentru fuziuni.
<color=black>•</color> Poate fi transformata într-o Nuca-Perete normala folosind un Ghiveci de Gheata.</color>

plants.name: Nuca-Argintie
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm a valuable item," says Silver-nut, "Handle me with care." After quitting his job at the bowling alley, he thought about starting the "Nonferrous Metal Protection Association," but nothing came of it, as he'd spent all his money keeping his silver paint in perfect condition.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Wall-nut made of silver, with higher toughness.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>6000</color>

plants.name: Nuca-Aurie
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Zombies just can't resist biting into Golden-nut's shell to see what's inside. It's not magic; there's simply a rumor among zombies that he's a chocolate truffle wrapped in gold foil.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Wall-nut made of gold, with even higher toughness; can use Ultimate to boost max HP and restore health.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 1000 Coins, Cooldown: 5s; Increases max Toughness by 1000 and restores health equal to its full Toughness.</color>
plants.cost: <size=36>Upgrade Cost: </color><color=#8B0000>1000 Coins, 1 instance of Ultimate included</color>

plants.name: Hypno Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hypno Melon loves making friends, painting, and mixing drinks. She's the star bartender at a bar, and her iced hypno melon juice is even more popular than classic cocktails. Some of her more eccentric fans have even dressed up as zombies just to get a taste.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs hypno melons capable of hypnotizing hordes of zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Both direct hits and splash damage have a 25% chance to hypnotize zombies with less than 50% max HP.
<color=black>•</color> When bitten, hypnotizes the attacker, then reverts to a Melon-pult.</color>

plants.name: Ice Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Summer is when Ice Pot is most active. "Heehee, feeling hot? Want to come cool off here?" he says. "Just be careful not to slip on the ice. And if you're a watermelon seeking shade, watch out! Once you turn into a chilled watermelon, someone might just eat you!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can materialize plants forged in fire.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Every 10s, transforms a specific Roasted plant on its tile into its base form usable for fusion.</color>

plants.name: Pumpkin Brazier
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pumpkin Brazier dislikes loud, showy gestures. He's calm, reserved, and quietly helps any peas in need. Even at a barbecue, if he's served half-raw food, he won't complain; he'll just tuck it inside himself and take it home. It'll be perfectly cooked by then anyways.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can ignite peas and produce Roasted Pumpkins.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>For every 50 peas lit, a Roasted Pumpkin is spawned in front.</color>

plants.name: Roasted Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Happy Halloween!" calls Roasted Pumpkin, handing out bags of candy to mischievous little plants. And when the candy's gone, don't forget to come see his stage play—he might just play the Headless Horseman himself!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Pumpkin formed in intense temperatures, but not much different.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Cannot be used for fusions.
<color=black>•</color> Can be converted to a regular Pumpkin using an Ice Pot.</color>

plants.name: Snipea-shroom Squad
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As the Snipea-shroom Squad say: "In the great tides of history, what's long divided must unite, and what's long united must divide… you included." In downtime, they love reading Romance of the Three Kingdoms. "The past is just old tales. Right now We're the sharpest shot there is!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Splits for pinpoint snipes, merges for explosive crowd control.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>500×3/3s (Split), 1500/0.5s (Merged)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> In split mode, every 6th shot is a headshot dealing 1M damage.
<color=black>•</color> After 15 shots, merge for 15s before splitting again.
<color=black>•</color> In merged mode, attacks do AoE splash damage in a 1-tile radius.</color>

plants.name: Shark-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I come from the vast ocean,"  Shark-shroom boasts. "With this shark mimicry, I can scare off any predator. It's an evolution only possible in the deep sea." He loves telling tales of his past to Sea-shrooms, but never reveals why he left the ocean: the disguise often attracts real sharks.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A cannibalistic Fume-shroom that "feeds" on Sea-shrooms, borrowing the menace of Kraken-shroom to drive away enemies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Using a Sea-shroom seed packet on him extends his range to the full lane for 10s.
<color=black>•</color> Knocks back zombies knocked back by Kraken-shroom within the last 3s.</color>

plants.name: Brainstorm Commando
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Brainstorm Commando is hopelessly smitten with zombies. She painstakingly paints every pea pink and admires the bright flash when they ignite. "It's a gift for the zombies," she says, eager to send as many as possible.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Constantly fires loads of Hypno Peas.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×6/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>30×3/0.02s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>2% chance to shoot a barrage of hypno peas each attack, lasting 5s.</color>

plants.name: Sea-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sea-nut loves spending time with the Water Beads, watching them soak up water and grow, its round body shimmering with rainbow light, reflected in innocent eyes. "Time is like a blue butterfly fluttering past the stream~ Once it's gone, you'll never see it again~"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Grows bigger by absorbing water, then rolls forward to crush zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000 (initial), 6000 (max)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Grows at 10s and 20s after planting, increasing HP and durability by 2000 each time. At 30s after planting, turns into a bowling nut rolling forward, dealing 600 damage every 0.02s on contact.</color>

plants.name: Hermit-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hermit-shroom drifts like a hidden reef, timid, still, but dangerous to the unwary. When the surrounding water shifts, he rouses and ferociously defends himself, then settles back beneath the waves as if nothing happened.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Too shy to attack until he sees a Sea-shroom dive.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/0.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Hides himself by default. Using a Sea-shroom seed packet on him makes him attack for 10s, after which he cowers again. Is short when hiding.</color>

plants.name: Three-nuts
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Three ordinary nuts together are smarter than Zhuge Liang!" Three-nuts joined forces, becoming inseparable companions and unleashing unimaginable potential. These three have a knack for physics, and apparently fluid dynamics is their strongsuit.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Three small-nuts stacked on top of each other.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> (12-8k HP) 80, pierces twice;
<color=black>•</color> (8-4k HP) 60, pierces 4 times;
<color=black>•</color> (4k-0 HP) 40, pierces 6 times</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Tall plant. Has 12k HP in total. Each Small-nut has 4k HP. Losing one Small-nut permanently reduces max HP by 4k.</color>

plants.name: Marigold Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Beneath the ground lie treasures… and zombies? "So my treasure-hunting garden is actually a graveyard?!" Marigold Mine only wants to dig for treasures, but Dave buried zombies to make the hunt more exciting, which complicates things.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Always busy digging for treasures.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant. Digs up a treasure every 30s: 1% chance for a random zombie, 10% for a random seed packet, otherwise produces 25 Sun and 100 Coins.
<color=black>•</color> On Beach maps, Marigold Mines placed on Treasure Spots gain 50% faster production; seed packet chance rises to 33% while zombie chance drops to 0%.
<color=black>•</color> Disappears after finding 3 seed packets.
<color=black>•</color> On death, triggers a Potato Mine explosion with 1800 damage.</color>

plants.name: Swell-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Hey, stay away from me! Let me be alone quietly, or I'll stab you with ice spikes!" Swell-shroom inflates to scare approaching enemies. Watching the ice spikes protruding out towards the zombies, the other plants can't help but wonder: who's really approaching whom?</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Inflates after consuming Sea-shrooms, emitting cold air around himself.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles). Loses the ability to attack. Using a Sea-shroom seed packet on him makes him swell up and freeze all zombies in a 3×3 area, applying chill and dealing 20 damage.</color>

plants.name: Rush-shroom
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>"To pea or not to pea?" for Rush-shroom, that is the question. From a young age he rejected shooting peas. He stated he would rather help other plants. when asked where his desire to help others came from, he said, "Plantern has been a huge role model for me growing up."

-Written by Berfy Boy</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Long-range sprayer; his fume can also give projectiles extra momentum.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has full-lane range. While emitting fumes, boosts straight-shooting projectiles ahead, increasing their speed and +1 damage every 0.02s. The boost is stackable.</color>

plants.name: Nut Shell
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>For the Nut Shell, all that matters is creating a good internal environment for the smaller Nuts to grow. He ignores the outside noise and even zombie bites. The only thing he cares about is other plants crowding his internal space, a space he reserves specifically for the Mini-nuts.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Continuously grows helpful Mini-nuts inside.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Spawns a Mini-nut every 50s. When the Mini-nut is fully grown, it is consumed to heal a nearby damaged Pumpkin-type plant for up to 1000 HP or to produce a Wall-nut seed packet if no such plant exists. A single Nut Shell can produce at most 3 Wall-nut seed packets.</color>

plants.name: Brood-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Can mushrooms grow on mushrooms? According to Professor Cherryz, Brood-shrooms are rare large composite colonies, but they refuse to admit they are a collection of many individuals. To prove this, they try with all their might to eject extra spores.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Dominates an area with fumes and spores.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>(20+20×8)×4/1.9s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Emits an extra long-ranged spore in 8 directions each attack.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Cap
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Like other Umbrellas, Umbrella Caps have great ambitions and are willing to sacrifice themselves to protect the world. Though not tall enough to protect other plants, they have found something else to protect, the land they live on and love so deeply.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Uses their small body to desperately fend off enemies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>300</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Repels the first zombie on contact, then vanishes.
<color=black>•</color> Against shrunken zombies, repels them and loses 50 HP instead.
<color=black>•</color> Spawns a new Umbrella Cap in his tile every 30s.</color>

plants.name: Minnow-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Reproduction and proliferation are life's instincts. Under certain conditions, Minnow-shrooms grow together, resisting waves, and swim in schools to confuse predators. In recent years, technology enabling compact breeding has finally been developed and immediately applied in aquariums.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Highly reproductive; an important part of the ocean fungal ecosystem.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2 (later ×3)/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Does not return Sun on fusion.
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Starts out as a school of 2.
<color=black>•</color> Grows into a school of 3 after 15s.
<color=black>•</color> Afterwards, feeds the plant directly in front with a Sea-shroom every 15s. If unsuccessful, drops a Sea-shroom seed packet.</color>

plants.name: Orca-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>They say this giant used to swim in the open seas of Sharktooth Ridge, the terror of all fish. But one fateful mishap with a certain Shrink Shroom bubble somehow left him tiny. His body's shrunken, but not his appetite, nor his penchant for explosive enthusiasm when a Sea-shroom drifts too close.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>After consuming Sea-shrooms, spits small Doom-bombs forward.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>600</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Launches a Doom spore that deals 600 damage in a moderate radius after consuming a Sea-shroom. Feeding has no CD, but each shot takes 1.5s to fire and only a max of 2 shots can register at the same time.</color>

plants.name: Torchflower
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Torchflower is always cheerful, even able to smile through her doctoral dissertation. "Become the sunshine you have always been looking for." she wrote in the acknowledgments at the end of her paper.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Melts nearby projectiles into Sun!

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each time she produces Sun, converts all plant (and hypnotized zombie) projectiles in a 1.5 tile radius into Sun at a rate of 5 Sun per projectile.</color>

plants.name: Jelly-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Am I a Jellyfish? Or a Mushroom? Guess wrong, and you'll have to work for me." The Jelly-shroom loves playing these games with brainless zombies and has never lost. The closest to the right answer was Professor Cherryz, who answered "I know Box Jellies are not true Jellies… Are you one of those?"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Summons grunt zombies to fight for you after consuming a Sea-shroom.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Summons a hypnotized Ducky Tube Zombie (browncoat) that fights for you after consuming a Sea-shroom.
<color=black>•</color> When bitten, hypnotizes the attacker, then disappears.</color>

plants.name: Football Gatling
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Foul play! You're out!" Football Gatling is the strictest and most hot-tempered referee on the field, upholding football rules. From start to finish, his mouth never stops, constantly trying to eject players who don't understand the game.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Occasionally fires red shots that lure Football Zombies away.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>3000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80×4/2s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant. Counts as an Advanced Fusion.
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles knock back zombies and instantly break Type 2 armor (before damage reduction).
<color=black>•</color> Every 12th shot is a Football Pea that causes hit Red-colored Football Zombies to run away from your house.</color>

plants.name: Solarfruit
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm Solarfruit, not Sunny Five-fingers! Don't mix us up!" Solarfruit always tries to explain that he's different from Sunny Five-fingers, but his plant friends don't care.
