The only supporters he has are the zombies, since they think fingers are definitely more annoying to gnaw on than fruits.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Uses Sun to shoot high-damage stars.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>100×5</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Click on a Solarfruit to spend 25 Sun and make it shoot 5 100-damage Stars in 5 directions.
<color=black>•</color> Uses Sun and shoots automatically every 0.35s if placed in a Starry Pumpkin.</color>

plants.name: Solar Flare
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Why do so many plants feel distant from her? She can't figure it out: "I can both defend you and bring you sunshine!" She believes she's brighter and sunnier than Jalapeno, but other plants think she's more destructive.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Burns other plants to enhance her power.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Returns 25 Sun for every zombie hit.
<color=black>•</color> Also deals 1800 damage to all plants in her lane. Each affected plant drops 50 Sun and boosts Solar Flare's damage by 500. If a plant would be destroyed, it has a 1/3 chance to survive with 1 HP remaining.</color>

plants.name: Illumi-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Streetlights sometimes malfunction, and that’s normal. This is when my role as a backup streetlight becomes important, though everyone seems worried about me," said Illumi-nut. He didn't know that others worry not about his brightness, but that he might break the streetlight frame.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Wall-nut with Plantern properties; heals himself with Lumos level.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Provides 1 Lumos Level in a 3×3 area. Restores 150 Toughness per Lumos Level every 15s.</color></size>

plants.name: Sturdy-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sturdy-shroom was originally shy like other Scaredy-shrooms, until seeing distant relatives with "Mushroom Power" on TV — unafraid of zombies. He decided to learn from them, nicknamed himself "Mushroom Lee," and trained day and night to face zombies without fear.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Very slim defender, but will fight back when cornered.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000> After cowering for 10s, immediately stands up and knocks back nearby zombies, dealing 20 damage. For the next 5s, he will not hide himself again. While cowering, takes 50% reduced damage.</color>

plants.name: Nut Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Everyone speculated about Nut Pot's appearance: some said he was a broken nut, others that he was a damaged daruma doll. Whatever others guessed, Nut Pot didn't answer. Those boring past events were buried by lava. "At least now, I am a Pot," he said.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Heat-insulated defensive Flower Pot.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Reduces incoming damage to the plant on top by 20%.
<color=black>•</color> Immune to Lava tile damage and protects the plant on top.
<color=black>•</color> Lava tiles deal 50 damage per second to plants and zombies on them, prioritizing Flower Pots, dealing 10 damage to them instead.</color>

plants.name: Wallop-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Wallop-shroom trained a batch of Nut-shrooms but didn't teach them combat. When asked, "How do we defend against zombies?" he replied: "With a hard shell and do-or-die determination!" Then he launched them at the zombies. "This is a technique I learned from baseball," he announced proudly.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Picks up nearby Nut-shrooms to attack.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000> Picks up Nut-shrooms within a 3×3 area and bats them forward as projectiles. Projectile damage equals the Nut-shroom's HP and ignores Type 2 armor. If the projectile hits a zombie and deals enough damage to kill it, the shot pierces through, with its damage reduced by the amount dealt.</color>

plants.name: Tangle-nut
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>Everyone says Tangle-nut is very reclusive, with such tangled problems that it is difficult to unravel to reach such a hard heart. But who can deny his desire for solitude? No one, except Cattail, who sometimes mistakes him for a ball of string to play with.

-Written by Ultra Badlander</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Applies Tangle value as retaliation.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000> When bitten, inflicts 1 Tangle value on the attacker. When crushed, loses 50 HP every 0.02s and inflicts 1 Tangle value each time.</color>

plants.name: Melon Morph
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Melon Morph used to work at the Electromagnetics Research Institute and once proposed a conjectured model of magnetic poles, suggesting that magnetic poles are distributed like watermelon seeds embedded in a watermelon. However, his theory was ignored, because he was only the institute's watermelon supplier.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Stepping stone for other Metal Melon fusions, also deals heavy damage to helmeted zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000> Deals 2× damage to zombies with Type 1 Armor.</color>

plants.name: Metal-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Covering his body in iron saved the Metal-pult from ending up at the fruit stall, but he still faces many troubles, like spending heavily on rust-proofing and constantly answering other curious plants: "Are your leaves also made of iron? Can iron leaves be used as fruit knives?"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lumps heavy balls of pure iron at the zombies, dishing out heavy damage.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>200/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Deals 2× damage to zombies with Type 1 Armor.</color>

plants.name: Chrono Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm just standing on the shoulders of giants!" Chrono Melon humbly says. "I never had the power to reverse time; I only spread temporal chaos."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spreads Chronoshift effect via splash damage.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Splash damage is equal to main damage and has no falloff.
<color=black>•</color> If a zombie directly hit or in splash radius has Chronoshift effect, up to 3 splash targets (6 if buffed by Melon Pot) will also be afflicted with the effect.</color>

plants.name: M.A.D. Pepper
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm about to explode! Everyone in front of me better watch out, plant or zombie alike! This is mutual destruction, assured!" said M.A.D. Pepper. His slightly trembling body indicates a massive energy build-up, or maybe it's just from standing on tiptoes with an unstable stance.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Also burns your plants to trigger chain explosions.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Does not explode automatically; click manually to trigger a Jalapeno blast and a Doom-shroom explosion.
<color=black>•</color> In every other tile in the same lane that has a plant, releases a Doom-shroom explosion without leaving craters and destroys all plants in that tile; the destroyed plants have a 25% chance to drop as a Seed packet.</color>

plants.name: Pumpkin Pod
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Heard that some zombies brought a "tank"? Then show them the living machine-gun fortress — Pumpkin Pod! As for ammo… well, the designer forgot to include any! But no problem! Let the peashooters inside "share" some ammo!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Copies the behavior of the Pea-shooting plant inside it.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>?</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>If a Pea-family plant is inside, it copies the attack of that plant, matching that plant's projectile count, damage, and type and shoots at 50% the attack rate, with a min. attack CD of 3s and a max. of 6s. These shots are considered to be fired by the internal plant.</color>

plants.name: Blaze Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>This Peashooter loves roasted peas so much that even on the battlefield, he snacks between shots. "Ahh! My peas!" - looks like he accidentally spat out his snack again.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires Blaze Peas that inflict Enflamed.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000> Attacks inflict Enflamed debuff.

plants.name: Blaze Repeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Double firepower, double thrill, double fun! Compared to Blaze Pea, I like eating hotpot twice in a row!" He doesn't realize that Infernowood now has double the workload.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires Blaze Peas in pairs.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×2/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Attacks inflict Enflamed debuff.
<color=black>•</color> Tap to auto-fuse with a free Peashooter 15s after planting.</color>

plants.name: Split Blaze
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Damn it! Where's our support? Machine gunner on the left, move right!" Hot-tempered and easily enraged, this shooter often yells at teammates, though luckily, he hasn't started firing at them yet.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires Blaze Peas in triple bursts.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Attacks inflict Enflamed debuff.
<color=black>•</color> Tap to auto-fuse with a free Peashooter 15s after planting.</color>

plants.name: Gatling Blaze
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Tired of treating endless burn victims, this pea doctor now takes his proud invention of pyrotherapy to cure the problem at its source.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires 4 Blaze Peas at once.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×4/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000> Attacks inflict Enflamed debuff.</color>

plants.name: Stinky Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After countless revisions, Stinky Pumpkin is finally combat-ready. Compared to regular Garlic, it fixes issues like weak defense, space efficiency and inability to protect plants from projectiles. As for that smell… well, time to test everyone's endurance.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pumpkin with Garlic traits.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000> Zombies that bite him will be poisoned for 10s, forced to change lanes and accumulate 1 Poison point.</color>

plants.name: Sunny Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Recently obsessed with camping, Sunny Pumpkin beams: "Camping's the best! I get to shield everyone and be their little sun!" Rain or zombies, her teammates love having her around.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates Sun while reinforcing plants.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000 + ?</color>
<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000> Gives 50 HP as Shield to all plants in her tile every time she produces Sun. The total Shield value has no upper cap.</color>

plants.name: Sundae-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As rare as a polar sunrise, this frosty innovator spends all his time perfecting his craft of dessert-making. His signature sundae is the Sunny Orange Delight, loved by plants and zombies alike (even if it drains the last of their warmth).</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gradually melts, releasing cold and sunlight in stages.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> At each sun production, makes all frozen zombies drop 15 sun.
<color=black>•</color> For the first two sun production cycles, triggers Ice-shroom effects that inflict chill but don't freeze. On the third cycle, triggers full Ice-shroom effect, then disappears.</color>

plants.name: Comet-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Every year, she joins the garden darting contest - hitting zombies flying, snorkling, hypnotized, or even hypnotized with her sun-shaped darts. Despite her flawless precision, she never wins… the judges can never find her.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces Sun; upon being bitten, releases a Solar Comet that ricochets among zombies.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> When bitten, hypnotizes the attacker and summons a Solar Comet.
<color=black>•</color> The Solar Comet seeks out zombies (prioritizing hypnotized ones) and bounces between them, up to 10 times. When it hits a hypnotized zombie, it deals 200 damage and drops 25 Sun. When it hits a non-hypnotized zombie, it deals 100 damage and drops 15 Sun.
<color=black>•</color> After the Comet completes its bounces or disappears, it drops an additional 25 Sun.</color>

plants.name: Chompkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Chompkin opened a gym for Chompers, meant to help them digest better, burn fat, and stay in shape. It became wildly popular, but he's not happy. "They're not training, they're eating! My gym’s become a buffet!" he vents.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Provides digestive aids for Chomper-type plants inside his shell to speed up digestion.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Periodically uses a reserve Digestive Sac to help the Chomper plant in the same tile to instantly finish digesting (or to instantly recharge the Devour abilities of Chompzillas and its fusions).
<color=black>•</color> Generates 1 Digestive Sac every 40s, up to a maximum of 3 at the same time. First Digestive Sac takes 7.5s to generate.</color>

plants.name: Stench-spreader
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Ugh, your taste stinks! I hate you two!" cries the third head. Zombies think he's crying from his fellows' smell, but actually, it's just because of their terrible taste in music. "We don't even have noses," the first head explains.

-Written by silver fool</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots Poison peas; makes poisoned zombies release toxic clouds on hit.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×3/1.5s</color>
<color=#5E1675>Poison System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles add 1 Poison value to zombies on hit.
<color=black>•</color> If the zombie hit is already in a Poisoned state, creates a Toxic Cloud at the zombie's feet that lasts for 6s, applying 1 Poison value per second to all zombies caught within. There can be up to 1 active Toxic Cloud per lane.</color>

plants.name: Plaguebringer Snipea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>She doesn't actually carry viruses, but everyone avoids her - that strong garlic smell is enough. "The smell actually prevents viruses," she insists. The zombies don't buy it.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Snipes targets to spread an Infectious Cloud that multiplies like a virus.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>500/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000> Creates an Infectious Cloud at the target's location. Headshots create a Virulent Cloud instead.</color>
<color=#5E1675>Infectious Clouds: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Moves randomly across the lawn.
<color=black>•</color> Lasts 15s. Every second, inflicts Garlic Butter and 1 Garlic Point to zombies inside (Virulent Clouds have doubled radius and tick rate).
<color=black>•</color> When inflicting Garlic Points, deal (20×Garlic Points) damage. If the target is immune to poison, deals 300 damage instead.
<color=black>•</color> Targets that have lost their heads (HP below threshold) die instantly, spawning a new Infectious Cloud at their position.
<color=black>•</color> If 30 Infectious Clouds already exist, new ones won't spawn and instead expand the nearest Cloud's radius and increase its damage by 10%.</color>

plants.name: Cherry-spreader
plants.introduce: "Delicious cherries!" "Fresh cherries!" "Cheap cherries!" Cherry-spreader's three mouths shout tirelessly, yet their cherry business never seems to take off. Those who have tried them say these cherries are just too sticky.
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires half-ripe cherries across three lanes. They stick to zombies and mature after a short delay, then explode.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles attach to targets and explode after 6s with a 1-tile splash radius. Each zombie can only have one half-ripe cherry attached.
<color=black>•</color> While attached, half-ripe cherries absorb 25% of all cherry-type projectile and cherry explosion damage the zombie takes, adding that to its final explosion damage.</color>

plants.name: Dynamite Commando
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>At the 5th Annual Garden Quickdraw Championship, Dynamite Commando shared his secret to victory: "I use specially crafted cherry rounds. Their small size means I can store plenty, and the stickiness helps them cluster together for rapid bursts. Of course, keeping the barrel well-lubricated is absolutely essential."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots half-ripe cherries at zombies, with a small chance of shooting a massive barrage!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×6/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/0.02s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>2% chance to shoot a barrage of half-ripe cherries each attack, lasting 5s. These explode instantly and attach a half-ripe cherry to all zombies in the damage radius.</color>

plants.name: Black Cherry
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"You can't host a party in the garden without a permit." Black Cherry casually tells the unregistered zombies off. "The first time's just a warning. If they still don't leave after that, I'll take action. Well, some can't even handle the warning."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Unleashes a Cherry Bomb blast, then uses the resulting ash to trigger an even stronger Doom-shroom explosion.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Triggers a Cherry Bomb explosion on fusion, and explodes like a Doom-shroom after 1.5s.
<color=black>•</color> The Doom-shroom blast deals 1800 base Cremator damage, increasing by 300 for each zombie caught in the initial Cherry Bomb explosion.</color>

plants.name: Catalyst-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Catalyst-shroom was nearly expelled from the Zombuddies Club. The zombies she hypnotized always turned furious and destructive, which the club considered contrary to its peaceful values. She defended herself with a single sentence: "I'm merely helping my zombie friends vent their frustration toward Dr. Edgar."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>The catalyst for making zombies more explosive.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Upon being bitten, turns the zombie into a Hypnotized Explode-o-shooter Zombie and disappears.</color>

plants.name: Sea-shell
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once a star performer at the World Marine Life Festival and the pride of the Sea-shroom colony, Sea-shell can no longer float on water. Everything changed after that dreadful Halloween party. He wore a pumpkin head for the perfect performance, only to find he could never take it off again.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Regenerates itself using Sea-shroom seed packets.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Land plant. Can be fed Sea-shroom seed packets to heal by 1/3 max HP.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Chomper
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hypno Chomper looks down on his fellow Chompers. He thinks they're rude, picky eaters, and lazy freeloaders who produce nothing for the garden, unlike him, with his dazzling, radiant skin.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Devours hypnotized zombies and converts them into Hypno-shrooms.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Digestion Time: </color><color=#8B0000>40s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Also targets Hypnotized zombies and drops a Hypno-shroom seed packet on a successful devour of a Hypnotized zombie, then digests for 10s.
<color=black>•</color> When bitten, hypnotizes the attacker, then reverts to a Chomper.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Pepper
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm actually very harmless," said Hypno Pepper, adjusting his hat. "I help zombies find their hidden fragility, guiding them to drop their pretense and become open, honest friends." As for the blazing flames? "That's just the hypnotium doing its magic. It doesn't really hurt the fragile zombies."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Explodes with fiery charm, causing zombies to switch sides.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Hypnotizes all zombies with less than 900 HP in its lane. Deals 1800 Cremator damage to all other zombies in its lane.</color>

plants.name: Butterweed
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Unlike other Spikeweeds, Butterweed is exceptionally gentle. It has no sharp spikes, dislikes violent sports, and just wants zombies to try a slice of its homemade butter cake. Unfortunately, with his poor eyesight, he always offers the butter to the wrong spot.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sticky, buttery slow trap that doesn't deal damage.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>0</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Slows down all non-flying zombies that walk over it and Butters them for 1s every 3s.
<color=black>•</color> No longer pops tires and is ignored by vehicles.</color>

plants.name: Aurora Plantern
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Winter is the season for meditation. The cold sharpens the mind. With gnawing winds and silent nights, such a perfect time for reflection should not be wasted. For days on end, the night-watching Aurora Plantern has been pondering what he should be thinking about. Oh wait, that's it! Thinking about what to think about!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Freezes zombies with a cold aura and enables lasers to gain chilling effects.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Once per second, deals 20 damage and applies Chill to zombies in within a 1.5-tile radius, and prolongs the Freeze duration of the zombies already frozen by 1s (cannot be reapplied to the same zombie).
<color=black>•</color> Anti-ground Lasers from Lumos Cactus/Ray-shroom turn cyan and gain the ability to apply Chill after passing through.</color>

plants.name: Land-mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After lying in wait for a long time, Land-mine has drawn sufficient strength from sunlight and moisture, gaining power comparable to a Cherry Bomb. "Spudow!" he shouted, but the zombies were only surprised.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can grow twice.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>900 (Initial)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Starts in an armed stated. Grows 30s after appearance, doubling its damage.
<color=black>•</color> After another 30s, grows again and increases explosion radius to 1.5 tiles across lanes.</color>

plants.name: Sea-mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The moment he enters the pool, Sea-mine absorbs water like a little water baby, convinced this will greatly amplify his explosive power. While this does turn out to be true, he still cannot understand how it all works, just as he cannot understand why the pool is never completely filled with dead zombies either.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Aquatic and can grow twice.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>900 (Initial)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Starts in an armed stated. Grows 30s after appearance, doubling its damage.
<color=black>•</color> After another 30s, grows again and increases explosion radius to 1.5 tiles across lanes.</color>

plants.name: Blacklight Plantern
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>Blacklight Plantern doesn't consume darkness to create light. Their light is fueled by their contempt for the Zombies, and a couple grams of plutonium. "My light burns with rage. Pray you don't find it pointed at you."

-Written by Goober</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>His UV light re-ignites embers and grants lasers explosive effects.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Every 3s, supplies Doomwoods in a 3×3 area with 3 Ember value.
<color=black>•</color> Anti-ground Lasers from Lumos Cactus/Ray-shroom turn purple and gain the ability to trigger a 1-tile explosion dealing 10 damage on hit after passing through.</color>

plants.name: Cab-barrage
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>With a thunderous boom, bright-green shells soar into the sky. "A farewell gift," says Cab-barrage with a nod. "May their last meal be filling, even if it is not brains. Everyone gets a serving."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Bombards a wide area ahead with cabbages.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/0.75s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> When attacking, lobs one cabbage at each zombie in the forward area of his lane and the 2 adjacent lanes.
<color=black>•</color> Umbrella Kale or Midas Umbrella in front in of his lane can also intercept cabbages that would have been thrown to adjacent lanes and boost them.</color>

plants.name: Gourd-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Squash is heavy, but too soft. Melons are heavy too, but too fragile. Now those problems are solved. Or possibly combined.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Projectiles crush zombies like a Squash, then shatter like a Melon, dealing splash damage.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120 (Squash)/3s</color>
<color=black>Detection Range: </color><color=#8B0000>0.5 tiles to the left; 1 tile to the right</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Projectiles deal area crush damage on landing, then break shortly after, dealing splash damage with fall-off similar to Melon-pult.</color>

plants.name: Cherry Squash
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Even among Squashes, Cherry Squash is famously short-tempered and quick to explode. "Try carrying something that heavy on your back," he grumbles. Other Squashes are less concerned about the temper, and more curious how he could jump so high and so far with the thing on his back.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A very explosive Squash.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Squash) + 1800 (3×3, Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Detection Range: </color><color=#8B0000>2 tiles to the left; 3 tiles to the right</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Upon landing, triggers a Cherry Bomb explosion.</color>

plants.name: Doom Squash
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doom Squash rarely speaks to anyone on the lawn. It silently moves from place to place, leaving craters behind. Rumor has it that it was originally supposed to be deployed under "dire circumstances" but somehow escaped containment.

- Edited by cassidy</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An extremely explosive Squash, and prone to causing collateral damage.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Squash) + 1800 (5×5, Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Detection Range: </color><color=#8B0000>2 tiles to the left; 3 tiles to the right</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Upon landing, triggers a Doom-shroom explosion that leaves a crater on the landing spot; destroying all plants on that tile.</color>

plants.name: Blubber-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Come on, have a taste of my fresh butter!" Blubber-shroom says proudly, showing off his new recipe. "If you don't like it, just shake your head," he adds. Everyone seems to be diggin' it, or at least they are completely motionless.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sprays butter from the top of its cap onto nearby zombies.

<color=black>Attack Range: </color><color=#8B0000>An area within a 2.2-tile radius</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Does not actively target zombies. When damaged or manually tapped and if there are zombies within attack range, it performs an attack.
<color=black>•</color> When attacking, loses 30 max HP (and current HP), throwing one pat of Butter at every zombie in range, dealing 40 damage and immobilizing them for 4s</color>

plants.name: Multipeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"You two have already taken turns for three whole minutes, now it's my turn!" The three heads of the Multipeater have been competing for shared items since childhood, from marbles, to comic books, to a limited-edition commando badge carved from peas.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can switch between three attack modes, allowing flexible allocation of firepower.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×6(or n)/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has three attack modes that can be switched by tapping on it; targeting behavior changes accordingly:
<color=black>•</color> 1. Standard Mode: Fires 2 peas each into his own lane and the 2 adjacent lanes;
<color=black>•</color> 2. Spread Mode: Fires 1 peas each into every lane (if the map has fewer than 6 lanes, the damage from missing shots is evenly redistributed among the remaining shots);
<color=black>•</color> 3. Focus Mode: Fires 6 peas each into his own lane.</color>

plants.name: Solar Blover
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Solar Blover always wears a gentle smile, often saying, "Clear skies and a spring breeze filled with sunshine - how pleasant!" Sadly, zombies don't understand this beauty. What she blows out isn't a soft spring wind, it's pure solar wind.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Capable of blowing out a large number of Sun shots.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>10×72</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Spins its leaves and fires two spirals totaling 72 Sun Shots. Each shot drops 5 Sun upon hitting a target and can be buffed by Infernowood to deal 40 damage and drop 15 Sun instead.</color>

plants.name: Puff-kin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The three Puff-shroom Pumpkin brothers are well-loved, well-behaved kids: quiet, orderly, and never quarrelsome. Their only hobby is trying to piece together the pumpkin puzzle on top of their heads, though unfortunately, they have never quite succeeded.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>The more Puff-shrooms in the Puff-kin, the stronger the protection!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Restores 50 HP every 3s. Starts out at 1/4 max HP.
<color=black>•</color> At 1/3 max HP or more, gains a 50% incoming damage reduction.
<color=black>•</color> At 2/3 max HP or more, absorbs damage for the plant inside.</color>

plants.name: Fumy Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I can attack in both forward and backward directions," says Fumy Pumpkin confidently. "I'm a bidirectional Fume-shroom." However, he doesn't appear to have noticed that he's facing a different direction from everyone else.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can attack like a Fume-shroom… though the direction seems a little off.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/1.5s (Piercing)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000> Targets from his own tile, up to 3 tiles both above and below</color>

plants.name: Solar Squash
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Solar Squash's favorite thing to do is gently pat the petals on his head with his leaf, then boast proudly to other Squashes: "This is what Sun-powered shampoo does. Just look how smooth my hair is." Luckily for him, the other Squashes are all very serious and never tease him, so he still doesn't know he's sporting a classic receding hairline.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can consume Sun to remain on the lawn after squashing.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Squash)</color>
<color=black>Detection Range: </color><color=#8B0000>0.5 tiles to the left; 1 tile to the right</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Upon landing or dying, consumes 50 + (Number of previous revivals) Sun to remain on the tile of the landing spot/revive. If this fails, 50 Sun is refunded.</color>

plants.name: Melon Shell
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Ha ha! Guess where my eyebrows are!" Melon Pumpkin laughs at the audience. A famous rooftop magician, he excels at all kinds of tricks, including making half of his eyes disappear. Of course, his proudest illusion is the Great Melon Transformation. To this day, no one has ever seen how he hides a watermelon inside a Melon-pult's bucket.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Throws bonus watermelons when protecting a catapult-type plant.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/?s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each time the catapult plant inside attacks, it simultaneously launches an additional watermelon.</color>

plants.name: Potato Masher
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>You've seen Squashes growing on vines, but have you ever seen one sprouting from the ground itself? Don't be fooled, as Potato Masher is simply mashed potatoes shaped like a Squash. But don't you dare laugh at how short he is. If he hears you, he'll make you even shorter than he is.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces Potato Mashes that can squash zombies.

<color=black>Detection Range: </color><color=#8B0000>0.5 tiles to the left; 1 tile to the right</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Starts out armed by default. Generates a Potato Mash on the spot when a zombie enters his targeting range, then burrows underground for 15s to arm again.
<color=black>•</color> Potato Mash has the same effect and damage as Squash, but with a larger targeting range.</color>

plants.name: Potato Mash
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Don't let his small size fool you - his ambitions are anything but small. "I won't live under the Masher's protection forever. I'm jumping out to find my own life." With that, he leaps forward and crushes the zombie in his way. Maybe one day, he too will find a pit of his own, just like the Masher did.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Similar to Squash, but much easier to trigger.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Squash)</color>
<color=black>Detection Range: </color><color=#8B0000>1.5 tiles to the left; 2.5 tiles to the right</color>

plants.name: Doom Garlic
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>At one Zombie Garlic-Eating Championship, Doom Garlic was served as the final course. The result: three of the ten contestants withdrew, five were rushed to the hospital, and the remaining two exploded on the spot. With no remaining competitors, Doom Garlic himself was declared the champion of that year's event.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Causes the zombies that bit it to explode upon death.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Inflicts Ember debuff on zombies that bite it and curses them. Cursed zombies explode on death in a 1.5-tile radius for 300 damage.
<color=black>•</color> Inflicts Poison debuff and 1 Poison point on zombies that bite it.
<color=black>•</color> When Ember debuff and Poison debuff are active simultaneously on a zombie, the Poison duration becomes infinite.</color>

plants.name: Starburst-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>When Starburst-shroom's star-shaped cap hits a zombie, it releases star projectiles, greatly improving projectile efficiency. "Actually, if the backward-fired star were optimized as well, the efficiency could be even higher." One of his comrades commented while dodging the returning projectile.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires piercing star caps that split into five stars on contact.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>0 + 20×5×(0-3)/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>The Star cap itself deals no damage and can pierce twice. Each time it contacts a zombie, it releases 1 star projectile in each of 5 directions, each dealing 20 damage.</color>

plants.name: Scaredy Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>At school, Scaredy Flower Pot always curls up and avoids interacting with others. Because the mushrooms he grows are fewer than those of his classmates, he believes he is inferior. What his fear prevents him from noticing is that his classmates are actually envious - the mushrooms he grows are the most delicious of all.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Give boosts based on the value of the plant placed on top.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Grants the plant placed on top an attack damage bonus equal to [0.04 × (that plant's Sun cost)]%, up to 20%.
<color=black>•</color> If the plant on top is a Scaredy-type mushroom, the attack bonus becomes 2×(base bonus + 10%), up to 60%.
<color=black>•</color> Becomes frightened when zombies are present within a 3×3 area and stops providing attack bonus while frightened. After leaving the frightened state, the attack bonus gradually recovers over 3s.</color>

plants.name: Ray-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Every plant I see is wearing sunglasses," Ray-shroom grumbles. "It's ridiculous, so pretentious!" In the end, Ray-shroom chalks it up to some inexplicable trend, while the other plants agree that staring directly at an ultra-high-power laser emitter is obviously bad for your eyesight…</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires a piercing laser ray. Damage falls off with distance and increases with Lumos.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>10/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Fires across the entire lane with unlimited pierce.
<color=black>•</color> Each Lumos level increases damage by 0.5×.
<color=black>•</color> Damage increases by 1.6×(5 - column distance to the target). At Lumos level 3 or higher, this instead becomes 0.8×(10 - column distance).</color>

plants.name: Cabbage Dropper
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After years of mindlessly throwing cabbages, seeing the world at that height really makes you think. What if those cabbages had a life? Hopes and dreams? Families? Children? All of those questions run through Cabbage Dropper's leafy mind.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Provides close-range air support by dropping cabbages.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×3/3s</color>
<color=black>Attack Range: </color><color=#8B0000>Own tile and 2 adjacent tiles in the same lane</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Flying plant.</color>

plants.name: Butter Fly
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Butter Fly signed up for the Garden Variety Show, hoping to play a UFO on stage, but it never made the cut. He just kept dropping corn and butter everywhere, drawing fierce opposition from the ground crew, and even causing the director who supported him to take a nasty fall.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Provides close-range air support by dropping corn kernels or butter.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/3s</color>
<color=black>Attack Range: </color><color=#8B0000>Own tile and 2 adjacent tiles in the same lane</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Flying plant. Has a 25% chance to drop butter, dealing 40 damage.</color>

plants.name: Fall Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Other melons call him lazy, but Fall Melon insists he's efficient. "Just let gravity do the work! Throwing things is exhausting!" He seems to completely ignore the fact that this also shortens his range.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Provides close-range air support by dropping melons.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80×3/3s</color>
<color=black>Attack Range: </color><color=#8B0000>Own tile and 2 adjacent tiles in the same lane</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Flying plant.</color>

plants.name: Starch-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After accepting a brand partnership offer from Potato Mine, Starch-shroom quit his bakery job. "Joining the explosive-making industry was the best decision I've ever made," says Starch-shroom. "Spraying starch straight from your mouth is way more efficient than fermenting bread!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>The fume he sprays carries a strong potato scent, sometimes even explosive!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Every 10th attack, triggers a Potato Mine explosion that deals 300 damage at the position of each zombie hit.</color>

plants.name: Butternut-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Butternut-pult was never good at biology. He's always believed that the idea of "apical dominance" is wrong, but he's learned to keep that opinion to himself, not because he's embarrassed about his grades, but because he doesn’t want anyone to realize he's a corn with an underdeveloped tip.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Thrown projectiles slam zombies like a Squash, with a chance to butter the ones that get crushed.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60/3s (Squash)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Projectiles deal area squash damage when they land. Has a 25% chance to throw a Butter Squash, applying 4s of Butter stun to up to 3 damaged targets.</color>

plants.name: Crater-tot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As the head chef of a French fry restaurant, Crater-tot runs a tight kitchen and is known for his strict, no-nonsense management. But behind his successful spud career lies a personal struggle: his explosive temper means he can no longer make delicious fries.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shatters in a devastating explosion, scattering five Potato Mines that instantly arm on landing.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant. When it explodes, it also triggers a Doom-shroom effect, then throws potato chunks onto 5 empty tiles. Each chunk creates a fully armed Potato Mine as soon as it lands.</color>

plants.name: Zodiac-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Zodiac-shroom worries that the loose tuft of fuzz on top of his cap makes him look silly, though most zombies would never understand why that bothers him.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Zombies that bite him become hypnotized, turning into moving star launchers.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When bitten, hypnotizes the zombie and disappears, causing it to fire stars in a spiral: 60 volleys (300 total star projectiles).</color>

plants.name: Dovlecel Mazare
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Ar trebui sa sar si sa zdrobesc zombii, sau sa fiu impuscator propriu?" Acea intrebare l-a bantuit pe Dovlecelul Mazare toata adolescenta. In cele din urma, a ales stilul de viata de Dovlecel traditional, dar de fiecare data cand loveste pamantul, acele mici umflaturi verzi de pe corpul lui trag oricum mazare prin reflex.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Explodeaza intr-o furtuna de mazare cand zdrobeste terenul/zombi.

<color=black>Daune: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Dovlecel)</color>
<color=black>Distanta de Detectare: </color><color=#8B0000>0.5 piese la stanga; 1 piesa la dreapta</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Cand aterizeaza, elibereaza 3 inele de proiectile de mazare (108 mazare total).</color>

plants.name: Silver Ice-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Ruthless. Cold-blooded. Those are the labels people stick on Silver Ice-shroom, even other Ice-shrooms think he's too icy. Silver Ice-shroom doesn't care. His success comes from being cold-hearted; anyone who isn't ruthless enough simply can't survive in the cold-chain logistics business.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An Ice-shroom coated in silver frost.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Freezes for 1 second longer than a normal Ice-shroom.</color>

plants.name: Golden Ice-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>A monopolist of the cold-chain logistics industry, Golden Ice-shroom can sway the temperature of the market with just a light sprinkle of coins. After years in the business, his wealth and fame are beyond counting, and his life is complete… except for the fact that he still can't cure his facial paralysis. A monopolist of the cold-chain logistics industry, Golden Ice-shroom can sway the temperature of the market with just a light sprinkle of coins. After years in the business, his wealth and fame are beyond counting, and his life is complete… except for the fact that he still can't cure his facial paralysis.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A stable, gold-plated Ice-shroom that brings extreme cold through money.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Triggers an Ice-shroom effect once on appearance (does not disappear afterwards).</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 3000 Coins, Cooldown: 2s; repeats the following effects 4 times on targets within a 2.2-tile radius:
	-Deals 200 damage, applies Chill and 25 Cryo point, and reduces the target's Cryo cap by 100.
	-Deals 200 damage, applies Chill and 25 Cryo point, and reduces the target's Cryo cap by 100.
	-Fires an icicle at each target dealing 20 damage. Icicles deal 2× damage to Chilled zombies and 4× damage to frozen zombies.</color>

plants.name: Solar-shooter (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Actually, the Sunflower behind me is my sister," Solar-shooter explained to everyone. "We've been inseparable since birth. She loves producing Sun, and I destroy zombies on her behalf." But everyone knows the truth: the cheerful Pea brother is a total siscon. After all, every zombie that gets near his sister mysteriously ends up vaporized by sunlight.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar-shooter can fire Sun shots that occasionally produce Sun.

<color=blue>Reversible by pressing R</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Every third shot drops 5 Sun when hitting targets.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(80 Sun) Attack Damage & Speed +20%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(200 Sun) Attack Damage +200%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(200 Sun) Attack Speed +100%</color>

plants.name: Sunrise-shroom (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>A seasoned sunlight banker, Sunrise-shroom offers high interest on your deposits."You chose a time deposit," he says sternly to a frustrated Twin Solar-nut. "Withdrawals aren't allowed just yet."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A visionary sun producer that absorbs and multiplies nearby sun, paying out in bursts.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Absorbs dropped Sun within a 5×5 area, multiplies their value by ×1.3, and stores them.
<color=black>•</color> Releases as much Sun as possible in batches of 25 along with the next production.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(60 Sun) Sun Production Speed +50%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(150 Sun) Sun Production Speed +200%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(150 Sun) Sun Value Multiplier ×2</color>

plants.name: Explode-o-shooter (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Meet Explode-o-shooter, the ultimate plant killer. He's more irritable than ever—who would've thought the warm and friendly Cherryshooter would swallow another special cherry? Don't push your luck with him. That cherry stuck in his throat might just be his next shot—his face is already turning red!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots out explosive cherries that explode on impact.

<color=blue>Reversible by pressing R</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to explosive cherries and deals AoE damage.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(160 Sun) Attack Damage +50%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(400 Sun) Attack Damage +100%, Explosion Radius +50%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(400 Sun) Attack Speed +200%</color>

plants.name: Star-nut (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Star-nut lives under a rock and rarely moves. It's not because he's lazy, but because he's got standards. He'll only act if invited by a certain square friend to jellyfishing… or to prank a cephalopodic neighbor.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A reactive defender that counters with little stars.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Fires five 10-damage stars in all directions when damaged.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(80 Sun) HP and Max Toughness +50%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(200 Sun) HP +200%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(200 Sun) Regen +100% (100 HP/3s)</color>

plants.name: Solar Mine (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Stop at red lights, slow down at yellow lights, and obey traffic rules!" Solar Mine frequently warns zombies. But to the zombies, all they see is the disgusting green hue before them. He clutches his green leaves and pouts, wishing for more sunshine. "After all, sunshine is what fuels us all!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar Mine produces Sun until and after its explosion.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Drops 50 Sun on explosion.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(10 Sun) Explosion Damage +50%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(25 Sun) Explosion Radius +50%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(25 Sun) Explosion Damage +100%</color>

plants.name: Frost Gloom-shroom (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Dreaming of a career as a physicist, the Frost Gloom-shroom dedicates his days to unraveling the complexities of the world, avoiding contact with other plants. "Why do I have multiple strings of icicles sprouting from my head?" he muses, the latest question occupying his thoughts. He's oddly adamant about calling them "strings."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Releases cold fumes around that can freeze zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>5/3.8s (Piercing)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks apply Chill.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(80 Sun) Attack Speed +50%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(200 Sun) Attacks add 10 Cryo points
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(200 Sun) Chill Duration ×2</color>

plants.name: Cherry Chomper (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Ever since her drink with Cherry Bomb, Chomper has been constantly "buzzing." She turned into an absolute menace every meal. The sound of chewing transformed into explosive pops as plates and bowls flew everywhere, leaving everyone unwilling to dine with her. After a show of hands, Cherry Chomper ended up eating in the yard… at least she no longer has to buy new tableware.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces a cherry explosion upon eating a zombie.

<color=blue>Reversible by pressing R</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Digestion Time: </color><color=#8B0000>40s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Creates a 3×3 Cherry explosion with 1000 damage in the tile directly ahead on successful biting.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(200 Sun) Explosion Damage +20%, Digestion Time -10s
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(500 Sun) Explosion Damage +100%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(500 Sun) Digestion Time -50% (15s)</color>

plants.name: Amp-nion (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Amp-nion thought his moment had come — after all, who else had eaten lightning over a hundred times? Surely, he was destined to play the Frankenstein monster! But when he received the script, his dreams short-circuited. He wasn't a star. He wasn't even a sidekick. He was just Dr. Stanley's lightning rod...</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attacks approaching zombies with lightning rays!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Attack Range: </color><color=#8B0000>5×5</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Idle Amp-nions in range will channel power to the attacking one, each boosting the damage by 150%.
<color=black>•</color> Each shot can arc to other zombies to deal 1/3 the damage, up to a maximum of 3 zombies.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(120 Sun) Attack Damage +50%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(300 Sun) Arcing now deals full damage
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(300 Sun) Attack Damage + 300% but no longer arcs</color>

plants.name: Pea-shroom (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Don't let my size fool you; even a small body can contain a lot of energy," Pea-shroom cautions those who underestimate him. "We all began as tiny mushrooms, making progress a little at a time. With dedication to a sunny breakfast, you can become just like me."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pea-shroom shoots further than Puff-shroom.

<color=blue>Reversible by pressing R</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>10/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant, stackable.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(20 Sun) Attack Damage + 50%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(50 Sun) Attack Damage +100%, now fires ignited small peas
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(50 Sun) Attack Damage +200%</color>

plants.name: Sun-shroom (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sun-shroom hates sun. He hates it so much that when it builds up in his system, he spits it out as fast as he can. He just won't abide it. To him, sun is crass.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sun-shrooms give small sun at first and normal sun later.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>5→15/25s</color>
<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>120s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant, stackable.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(10 Sun) Sun Production Time → 16.67s
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(25 Sun) Grows immediately and produces Sun
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(25 Sun) Now produces 2 Suns at once</color>

plants.name: Soot-shroom (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Soot-shroom, the misanthropic workaholic, can't stand the sight of zombies—too much of a distraction. He's got a small stash of bullets, but they're more than lethal enough. "Don't bother me unless it's urgent. If you want them dead, just shoot them yourself." Still, his sharp efficiency keeps everyone looking up to him.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Soot-shroom can destroy most zombies in front of it.

<color=blue>Reversible by pressing R</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1000/60s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Click manually in the Upgrade Menu to attack all zombies in the row in front.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(200 Sun) Attack Damage +50%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(500 Sun) Attack Damage +200%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(500 Sun) Attack CD -50%</color>

plants.name: Grave Buster (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Despite Grave Buster's fearsome appearance, he wants everyone to know that he loves kittens and spends his off hours volunteering at a local zombie rehabilitation center. "It's just the right thing to do," he says.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Plant Grave Busters on statues to remove the statues.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can bust Statues.</color>
<color=black>Sun Statue Mechanic: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Statues block straight-shooting projectiles from plants and have 1000 HP each.
<color=black>•</color> Statues can only be damaged by projectiles or Grave Busters.
<color=black>•</color>Sunflower Statues drop 100 Sun when destroyed, Sun-shroom Statues drop 50.</color>

plants.name: Gutsy-shroom (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Courage fills me, no fear remains~ Whether it's spring, fall, winter, or summer~" Gutsy-shroom no longer shrinks in the face of zombies. "I used to tremble, but Senior Fume-shroom told me, 'If a zombie gets near, spray your spores. Hiding won't solve anything.'"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gutsy-shroom is ready to take on the zombies, near or far!

<color=blue>Reversible by pressing R</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/1.5s (Long range); 20/1.5s (Short range, piercing)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Shoots 2 spores at once. When zombies get within 4 tiles in range, sprays piercing fumes instead.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(80 Sun) Attack Damage & Speed +20%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(200 Sun) Attack Damage +200%, now permanently shoots spores
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(200 Sun) Attack Damage +100%, range for spraying fumes ×2</color>

plants.name: Breeze Blover (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Breeze Blover is a -4°C air conditioner. When his chilly breeze blows, it feels like stepping straight into winter. Even Snow Pea is frozen, the cold wind actually froze his own projectiles. What could possibly be colder than that? Answer: The atmosphere after Coldsnap Bean's told one of his totally tone deaf jokes.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Blover of a freezing breeze that constantly applies chill.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Lasts for 10s before disappearing.
<color=black>•</color> Deals 1 damage and applies 20 Cryo points to all zombies on the lawn.
<color=black>•</color> Converts all snow peas on screen to polar ice peas.</color>

plants.name: Death Star (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I could destroy almost the entire planet if I wanted to," boasts Death Star, "and they'd all blame it on the biggest star in the sky..."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Transforms himself into a Doom Meteor and crashes into the ground.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Disappears after 3s and summons a Doom Meteor that deals 1800 area damage on impact and splits into 180 spore stars each dealing 20 damage.</color>

plants.name: Drippy Pitcher (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Coach, I want to play basketball." Drippy Pitcher has always dreamed of becoming a basketball star. He practices shooting day and night without rest. He has two advantages: first, he kind of looks like a basketball hoop; second, he has an endless supply of basketballs to practice with. For heaven's sake, don't ask what those balls are made of.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs droplet shells that bounce between the zombie and other Drippy Pitchers.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3s</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000>Within 2 tiles in all four directions</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Projectiles rebound to nearby other Drippy Pitchers on hit, prompting them to immediately attack twice.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(120 Sun) Attack Damage & Speed +20%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(300 Sun) Attack Damage +200%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(300 Sun) Attack Speed +100%, projectiles can now rebound to self</color>

plants.name: Lily Pad (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Lily Pad never complains. Lily Pad never wants to know what's going on. Put a plant on top of Lily Pad, he won't say a thing. Does he have startling opinions or shocking secrets? Nobody knows. Lily Pad keeps it all inside.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lily Pads let you plant non-aquatic plants on top of them.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant. Non-aquatic plants can be planted on it.</color></size>

plants.name: Squash-nut (TD)
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Dragged from a kids' playground by his stem and dumped on the lawn, Squash-nut was rejected for being a deformed rubber ball. Now, furious and bumpy, he bounces wildly, yelling: "I'm gonna play all I want! ALL I WANT!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A bouncy nut who's all tantrum and impact.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/1.5s (Squash)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Bounces in his tile when a zombie gets close, dealing splash damage on each landing. Does not block zombies while airborne.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(30 Sun) Attack Damage +50%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(75 Sun) Heals 50% of damage dealt
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(75 Sun) Each target hit grants +50% extra damage</color>

plants.name: Threetato Mine (TD)
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>Threetato Mine loves playing tricks underground. It shoots out surprises not once, not twice, but thrice—like a cheeky prankster with a never-ending stash of boom. Watch your step, or you might get a triple whammy that’ll blow your boots off.

- Written by Mrs. Draco</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Threetato Mine resurfaces after exploding and fires potatoes across three lanes.

<color=blue>Reversible by pressing R</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> When armed, explodes on contact, dealing 3600 damage, knocks back for 1 tile and retreats into the ground.
<color=black>•</color> Re-emerges 15s after exploding. Explodes and disappears immediately upon contact with vehicles.</color>
<color=black>Upgrades: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>• Basic Upgrade: </color>(160 Sun) Projectile Damage +50%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 1: </color>(400 Sun) Projectile Damage +200%
<color=black>• Elite Upgrade Path 2: </color>(400 Sun) Now unleashes an Ultimate move every 60s, firing 250 shots straight ahead over 5s, plus 500 more in a 0-45° spread</color>

plants.name: Bobnetistul Bomberdier
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Un brutar faimos, renumit pentru placinta sa cu cirese - desi adesea uita cel mai esential ingredient: ciresele. Dar nu va faceti griji! Odata ce se descurca cu acest zombi, bam, placinta cu cirese, gata!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Creeaza explozii de cireasa la locatia tintelor.

<color=#4A2900>Conditii de Utilizare: Modul Odisee</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Creeaza explozii de cireasa la locatia tintelor lui la fiecare 2 secunde.
<color=black>•</color> Loveste la cap la fiecare 8 atacuri. 
<color=black>Modificatori de Odisee:
</color><color=#8B0000>Beneficiaza de Modificatorii =Cherrybomberului Mitraliera</color>

plants.name: Bobnetistul Mortii
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>E gardianul noptii, urmaritor in umbre. Lumina lunii e valul sau, iar cerul noptii e camuflajul sau. Sunt recunoscator destinului pentru ca mi-a acordat aceasta putere zdruncinatoare-impreuna cu incercarile pe care le aduce si poverile pe care le adauga.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Loviturile lui creeaza exploziile mortii!

<color=#4A2900>Conditii de Utilizare: Modul Odisee</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Dezlantuie o explozie a Ciupercii Mortii la locatia tintei sale la fiecare 8s.
<color=black>•</color> Loveste la cap dups fiecare 2 atacuri.
<color=black>Modificatori de Odisee:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. (Primul Modificator al Mitralierei Mortii) Interval de Atac → 4s
2. (Al Doilea Modificator al Mitralierei Mortii) Acum fiecare lovitura loveste la cap tinta.</color>

plants.name: Bobnetistul As de Aur
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Este un om mort." Cand prima licarire de aur strabate cerul, chiar si un zombi fara creier stie ca aceasta este vestitorul uitarii finale.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Coordoneaza toata puterea de foc!

<color=#4A2900>Conditii de Utilizare: Modul Odisee</color>
<color=black>Daune: </color><color=#8B0000>1000/6s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Loveste la cap o data la fiecare 6s.
<color=black>•</color> Abilitate Activa: Faceti clic pe Bobnetistul As de Aur pentru a aduce o cruce. Selectati orice zombi ca tinta, si toti lunetistii de pe teren vor coordona imediat un atac concentrat asupra lui. Acest efect are un CD(timp de odihna) de 30 de secunde. 
<color=black>Modificatori de Odisee:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Viteza de Atac a tuturor lunetistilor e marita cu 30%
2. CD pentru Abilitatea Activa e redusa la 15 secunde</color>

plants.name: Ciuper-ture Bobnetist
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Ciuper-turele Bobnetist e cea mai mica lunetista din detasament, desi ea nu vede asta ca pe o problems. "Prietenii mei lunetisti, sigur, sunt inalti si impunatori, dar au mereu nevoie de alte plante care sa-i acopere. Eu? Ma descurc singura foarte bine!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Extrem de rece si mortala!

<color=black>Daune: </color><color=#8B0000>500/3s</color>
<color=#4A2900>Conditii de Utilizare: Modul Odisee</color>
<color=#0077b6>Sistem Crio: </color><color=#8B0000>Atacurile provoaca 100 de puncte Crio si provoaca daune x4 zombilor inghetati.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Provoaca daune prin stropire intr-o singura piesa.
<color=black>•</color> Loveste la cap tinta principala dupa fiecare 6 atacuri.
<color=black>Modificatori de Odisee:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. (Primul Modificator al Ciuper-turii Mitraliera) Raza prin stropire → 3×3
2. (Al Doilea Modificator al Ciuper-turii Mitraliera) Acum provoaca daune x10 zombilor inghetati</color>
